analyzed: nam mkha'i gtos dang mnyam pa'i sku sogs pa'i //

analyzed: 'od kyi sku ni snang bas yang dag dgang //

analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad ni rtogs pa'i yul can ni chos kyi spyan no //
translated: The eye of Dharma is the object of realization of all āryas.

original: chos thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad skad cig ma gcig la mngon par byang chub pa gang rnams kyi yin pa de rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan te gang de rnams kyi'o /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad skad cig ma gcig la mngon par byang chub pa gang rnams kyi yin pa de rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan te gang de rnams kyi'o /
translated: The eye of the Buddha is the instantaneous perfect enlightenment of all aspects of all phenomena.

original: sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i mngon par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i mngon par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the characteristics of the manifest enlightenment of the vajra body, etc.?

original: dngos po'i gnyis kyi gzugs gnyis med pa'i ngo bor rnam par spyod pas rtogs pa ni de'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po'i gnyis kyi gzugs gnyis med pa'i ngo bor rnam par spyod pas rtogs pa ni de'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The realization that the two forms of the duality of entities are of the nature of non-duality is its characteristic.

original: rab 'byor gnyis ni dngos po yin la gnyis su med pa ni dngos po med pa yin no zhes thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gnyis ni dngos po yin la gnyis su med pa ni dngos po med pa yin no zhes thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Subhuti, duality is an entity, non-duality is a non-entity.

original: de nyid sangs rgyas kyi sku yin la de nyid sku'i bzlas pa yin te de thob par byed pa'i phyir brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid sangs rgyas kyi sku yin la de nyid sku'i bzlas pa yin te de thob par byed pa'i phyir brjod do //
translated: That itself is the Buddha-body, and that itself is the repetition of the body, because it is attained, it is expressed.

original: sgra rnams kun rdzob tu rjod par byed pa rnams de kho na nyid du sgra ma yin zhib rjod par byed pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: sgra rnams kun rdzob tu rjod par byed pa rnams de kho na nyid du sgra ma yin zhib rjod par byed pa ma yin pas so //
translated: All sounds are expressed conventionally, but not in reality, because they are not sound.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams gnas pa'i rdo rje de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams gnas pa'i rdo rje de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo //
translated: The mind and mental factors are the vajra of abiding, the nature of suchness.

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid don gyi rjes 'gro rnam par bsgom pas bzlas pa ste des dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi rnam par dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid don gyi rjes 'gro rnam par bsgom pas bzlas pa ste des dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi rnam par dpyad pa'o //
translated: The repetition of the sky-like equality of meaning is the meditation on the non-duality of the three times, the analysis of the Buddhas.

original: kun du ni phyogs bcu ste chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o zhes mos pas yang dang yang du @101a * //
analyzed: kun du ni phyogs bcu ste chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o zhes mos pas yang dang yang du @101a * //
translated: In all directions means in the ten directions.  All phenomena are naturally radiant.🔽Thus, one should imagine and repeat again and again.

original: spro ba ste bzhud pa dang byon pa ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: spro ba ste bzhud pa dang byon pa ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: Going and coming is gathering.

original: de rnams nyid ni rdo rje yin te mi choms pa'i phyir dang mchog kyang yin te sems can ma lus pa'i don rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams nyid ni rdo rje yin te mi choms pa'i phyir dang mchog kyang yin te sems can ma lus pa'i don rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those are vajras because they are invincible and supreme because they accomplish the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi go rims ji lta ba bzhin du sku dang gsung dang thugs dang rin po che dang don yod pa'i bzlas pa rnams so //
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi go rims ji lta ba bzhin du sku dang gsung dang thugs dang rin po che dang don yod pa'i bzlas pa rnams so //
translated: The recitations of the body, speech, mind, jewel, and action vajras are for the yogis of the constant and so on, respectively.

original: 'phags pa gshin rje gshed la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i khro bo'i rnal 'byor pas ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar nyi ma'i rang gi phyag mtshan gyi nyi ma la rang gi bzlas par bya ba bsgoms nas rang gi gsung gi rdo rje bsgrags pa ni sngags
analyzed: 'phags pa gshin rje gshed la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i khro bo'i rnal 'byor pas ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar nyi ma'i rang gi phyag mtshan gyi nyi ma la rang gi bzlas par bya ba bsgoms nas rang gi gsung gi rdo rje bsgrags pa ni sngags
translated: The yogi of any wrathful deity such as Sri Heruka, having meditated on the mantra to be repeated on a sun at his own weapon sun in the heart of the gnosis being, should utter his own speech vajra mantra.

original: kyi yi ge'i tshig ste dpag tshad bye ba'i tshad kyi gzhal yas khang na gnas pa'i lha'i dkyil 'khor pas thos so zhes mos par bya ste nga rgyal dang bcas pas khro bo'i tshig bzlas par bya'o zhes pa 'di ni khro bo'i bzlas pa'o //🔽'dod pa thams cad la nye bar longs spyod pa'i don du myos par gyur pa ni shin tu zhen pa'i phyir te 'jigs pa thams cad las skyob cing phan par 'dod pa sems can thams cad la snying rje chen pos dmigs pa ni gti mug kyang yin la
analyzed: kyi yi ge'i tshig ste dpag tshad bye ba'i tshad kyi gzhal yas khang na gnas pa'i lha'i dkyil 'khor pas thos so zhes mos par bya ste nga rgyal dang bcas pas khro bo'i tshig bzlas par bya'o zhes pa 'di ni khro bo'i bzlas pa'o // 'dod pa thams cad la nye bar longs spyod pa'i don du myos par gyur pa ni shin tu zhen pa'i phyir te 'jigs pa thams cad las skyob cing phan par 'dod pa sems can thams cad la snying rje chen pos dmigs pa ni gti mug kyang yin la
translated: One should recite the words of the wrathful one with pride. This is the recitation of the wrathful one.🔽In order to enjoy all desires, one should be intoxicated, because of great attachment.🔽One should be deluded, because of great compassion, which is the desire to protect and benefit all sentient beings from all fears.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyang yin no //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyang yin no //
translated: One should be Vairocana, because of the great desire to benefit all sentient beings.

original: rgya mtsho yang yon tan rin po che ma lus pa'i 'byung khungs zab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgya mtsho yang yon tan rin po che ma lus pa'i 'byung khungs zab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ocean is also Vairocana, because it is the source of all precious jewels, due to its depth.

original: gnas kyang rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas kyang rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The abode is also Vairocana, because it is the basis for the perfect benefit of oneself and others.

original: de'i gnas zhes pa rang gi bdag po nyid kyis de'i rnam par gyur par bsgoms te de kho na nyid du de las tha mi dad par nga rgyal te de'i rnal 'byor pas rang gi bzlas par bya ba bla ma'i man ngag las bzlas par bya ste 'di
analyzed: de'i gnas zhes pa rang gi bdag po nyid kyis de'i rnam par gyur par bsgoms te de kho na nyid du de las tha mi dad par nga rgyal te de'i rnal 'byor pas rang gi bzlas par bya ba bla ma'i man ngag las bzlas par bya ste 'di
translated: The yogi/nī of that should do one's own recitation according to the guru's instruction.

original: ni gti mug gi bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: ni gti mug gi bzlas pa'o //
translated: This is the recitation of delusion.

original: de bzhin thugs rje chen po'i 'dod chags rdo rje las byung ba'i tshig tu byas pa ste 'dod chags ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin thugs rje chen po'i 'dod chags rdo rje las byung ba'i tshig tu byas pa ste 'dod chags ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: Likewise, one should do the recitation of the passion of Mahākaruṇika, which arises from the vajra of passion, and passion is Amitābha.

original: de'i rnal 'byor pas de'i rnam pas sems can rnams la bltas te /
analyzed: de'i rnal 'byor pas de'i rnam pas sems can rnams la bltas te /
translated: The yogi/nī of that should look at sentient beings with that form,

original: thugs rje chen po'i 'dod chags kyi chags pa'i bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po'i 'dod chags kyi chags pa'i bzlas pa'o //
translated: and that is the recitation of the passion of the passion of Mahākaruṇika.

original: bcos ma'i khro bas bslang ba'i snying rje'i thabs ni zhe sdang ste de las byung ba'i thugs su byas nas te /
analyzed: bcos ma'i khro bas bslang ba'i snying rje'i thabs ni zhe sdang ste de las byung ba'i thugs su byas nas te /
translated: The method of compassion that is aroused by artificial anger is hatred, and one should do it with the mind that arises from that.

original: zhe sdang ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Hatred is Akṣobhya.

original: de'i rnam par sems can rnams bsgoms te de'i rnal 'byor pas bzlas par bya ste lhag ma ni @101b snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam par sems can rnams bsgoms te de'i rnal 'byor pas bzlas par bya ste lhag ma ni @101b snga ma bzhin no //
translated: One should meditate on sentient beings in that form, and the yogī should recite. The rest is the same as before.

original: gang rnams kyi rdo rje gsum po de rnams dam tshig yin te lam yin pa'i phyir dang / de kho na nyid kyang yin te chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang rnams kyi rdo rje gsum po de rnams dam tshig yin te lam yin pa'i phyir dang / de kho na nyid kyang yin te chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those whose three vajras are commitments, because they are the path, and they are reality, because they are the nature of the realm of phenomena.

original: dbus ma'i dam tshig rdo rje can zhes pa'i don ni bla ma'i man ngag las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dbus ma'i dam tshig rdo rje can zhes pa'i don ni bla ma'i man ngag las shes par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of “the vajra holder of the middle commitment” should be understood from the guru’s instruction.

original: de nyid rdo rje can rnams thams cad dang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid rnams chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bos skyes pa dang bud med kyi bden pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ma ning gi bzlas par brjod de
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje can rnams thams cad dang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid rnams chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bos skyes pa dang bud med kyi bden pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ma ning gi bzlas par brjod de
translated: That is said to be the recitation of the neuter, which is free from the conception of real male and female, because it is the nature of the realm of phenomena, the nature of all vajra holders and all tathāgatas, who are the embodiment of wisdom and method.

original: tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: tha snyad du byed do //
translated: It is conventionally designated.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams de srid du me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa lnga rnams su grub par byed pa yin la lhag ma rnams bsgoms pas cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams de srid du me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa lnga rnams su grub par byed pa yin la lhag ma rnams bsgoms pas cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: The five, Vairochana and so on, are established as the five, mirror-like pristine wisdom and so on. What is the point of meditating on the rest?

original: rdo rje'i bdag po rnams ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa drug po thams cad do //
analyzed: rdo rje'i bdag po rnams ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa drug po thams cad do //
translated: The lords of vajra are all six, beginning with form vajra.

original: 'dod chags ni 'dir snying rje chen po sngon du song ba shes rab dang thabs snyoms par 'jug pa bsgom pa la zhen pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni 'dir snying rje chen po sngon du song ba shes rab dang thabs snyoms par 'jug pa bsgom pa la zhen pa ste /
translated: Passion here is attachment to the cultivation of the union of wisdom and method preceded by great compassion.

original: de'i de kho na nyid kyang de phul du phyin pa las byung ba zag pa med pa mchog tu dga' ba yin la don kyang sems can ma lus pa rnams kyi mtho ris dang thar pa thob par byed pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid ste de sems par byed
analyzed: de'i de kho na nyid kyang de phul du phyin pa las byung ba zag pa med pa mchog tu dga' ba yin la don kyang sems can ma lus pa rnams kyi mtho ris dang thar pa thob par byed pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid ste de sems par byed
translated: Its reality is the uncontaminated supreme bliss that arises from perfecting that. Its object is the characteristics of the attainment of heaven and liberation for all sentient beings.

original: pa rnams bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: pa rnams bsgrub pa'o //
translated: It is the cultivation of that.

original: gang las 'dod chags las skyes pa'i byang chub sngon rjod par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang las 'dod chags las skyes pa'i byang chub sngon rjod par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: From that, the passion that arises is the enlightenment that is described as preceded.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sems can thams cad kyi phan pa skyed par byed pa de bzhed pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sems can thams cad kyi phan pa skyed par byed pa de bzhed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he is the one who desires to generate the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: chags pa dang bral bar skyes pa rnams ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub ste sems can thams cad la de lta bu'i phan par byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa dang bral bar skyes pa rnams ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub ste sems can thams cad la de lta bu'i phan par byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The listeners and so forth are born free from attachment, but they lack such benefit for all sentient beings.

original: spyan la sogs pa chen mo yang yin te de rnams btsun mo'i mchog yin pa'i phyir rang rig ma yang yin te ma rig pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyan la sogs pa chen mo yang yin te de rnams btsun mo'i mchog yin pa'i phyir rang rig ma yang yin te ma rig pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is also the great eye, etc., because they are the supreme queens, and he is the self-cognizant one, because he is the antidote to ignorance.

original: de rnams rtag pa ni ji srid nam mkha' gnas kyi bar de ru gyur cig ces pa'i smon lam gyi stobs kyis so //
analyzed: de rnams rtag pa ni ji srid nam mkha' gnas kyi bar de ru gyur cig ces pa'i smon lam gyi stobs kyis so //
translated: They are permanent by the power of the aspiration, “May they be so for as long as space remains.”

original: 'dod pa ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin la de rnams bsten pas don de dgos pa rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ma lus pa'i mtshan nyid de lhur byed pa de gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin la de rnams bsten pas don de dgos pa rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ma lus pa'i mtshan nyid de lhur byed pa de gnas pa yin no //
translated: The desired goal is the nature of the vajra of form, etc., and by relying on them, the purpose is the nature of the complete fulfillment of one’s own and others’ goals.

original: gang gi phyir @102a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir @102a * //
translated: Because of that,

original: de ltar yin pa des na grub ste mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin pa des na grub ste mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
translated: it is established, that is, it is directly perceived.

original: 'dod pa'i longs spyod 'dod pa las ma 'das pa bstan pa nyid kyis te ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba yin la rim pa tha dad pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i longs spyod 'dod pa las ma 'das pa bstan pa nyid kyis te ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba yin la rim pa tha dad pa yang yin no //
translated: By the very teaching of the desire for the enjoyment of sense objects that does not transcend desire, the word “indeed” is for emphasis, and there is also a different sequence.

original: gti mug ni mtshon par byed pa nyid kyi phyir gti mug la sogs pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: gti mug ni mtshon par byed pa nyid kyi phyir gti mug la sogs pa rnams yin te /
translated: Ignorance is the very instrument, and so on, of the ignorances,

original: de dam tshig la sogs pa yang yin pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rdo rje 'dzin pa la thug pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: de dam tshig la sogs pa yang yin pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rdo rje 'dzin pa la thug pa rnams yin te /
translated: and they are also the commitments, and so on, of Vairochana and so on, up to Vajra Holder.

original: de las byung ba ni de'i rigs rnams so //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni de'i rigs rnams so //
translated: Those who arise from them are of their type.

original: rig pa'i rgyal po rnams ni rdo rje can yin la sa'i snying po la sogs pa rnams te kun du bzang po la thug pa drug go //
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po rnams ni rdo rje can yin la sa'i snying po la sogs pa rnams te kun du bzang po la thug pa drug go //
translated: The kings of knowledge are the vajra holders, the six beginning with Kshitigarbha and ending with Samantabhadra.

original: sngar bzhin du ma ning gi gnas mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo grub pa ni rdzogs pa ste sngags kyi dngos grub mchog thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid rnal 'byor pa la ster ba yin te sgrub pa po
analyzed: sngar bzhin du ma ning gi gnas mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo grub pa ni rdzogs pa ste sngags kyi dngos grub mchog thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid rnal 'byor pa la ster ba yin te sgrub pa po
translated: As before, the nondual nature of the sense-spheres of the eyes, etc. , the neutral state, is perfected, and all the supreme powers of mantra, the nature of the gnosis of omniscience, are bestowed upon the yogi/ni, the adept.

original: la der rab tu snang ba'i ye shes skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: la der rab tu snang ba'i ye shes skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: It generates the gnosis that appears as that.

original: rdo rje'i bdag po rnams ni rigs lnga'i bdag po'o zhes gzhan rnams kyis 'chad pa la /
analyzed: rdo rje'i bdag po rnams ni rigs lnga'i bdag po'o zhes gzhan rnams kyis 'chad pa la /
translated: Others explain that the “vajra lords” are the lords of the five families.

original: dam tshig rdo rje la sogs drug / rig pa'i rgyal por thos pa yin //
analyzed: dam tshig rdo rje la sogs drug / rig pa'i rgyal por thos pa yin //
translated: The six, such as the commitment-vajra, are known as the kings of awareness.

original: gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa drug / rdo rje bdag po zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa drug / rdo rje bdag po zhes bshad do //
translated: The six, such as the form-vajra, are explained as the lords of the vajra.

original: zhes rgyud phyi ma las gnod do //
analyzed: zhes rgyud phyi ma las gnod do //
translated: This is refuted in the Later Tantra:🔽The wrathful ones such as Yamantaka, etc. , are the six families of the lords of the vajra.

original: khro bo gshin rje gshed la sogs pa rnams te zhe sdang ni mi bskyod pa yin la gnas kyang rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ma lus pa'i'o //
analyzed: khro bo gshin rje gshed la sogs pa rnams te zhe sdang ni mi bskyod pa yin la gnas kyang rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ma lus pa'i'o //
translated: Hatred is Akshobhya, and the abode is the perfection of one’s own and others’ aims.

original: de'i rigs su phal chen skyes pa'i rim pas grub pa rnams so //🔽gsod pas ni snying rje chen pos zhe sdang rnam par dag pa nyid kyis theg pa chen po'i mchog la smod pa la sogs pa'i sdig pa chen po byed pa'i sems can rnams mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i go 'phang thob par byed pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i phung
analyzed: de'i rigs su phal chen skyes pa'i rim pas grub pa rnams so // gsod pas ni snying rje chen pos zhe sdang rnam par dag pa nyid kyis theg pa chen po'i mchog la smod pa la sogs pa'i sdig pa chen po byed pa'i sems can rnams mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i go 'phang thob par byed pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i phung
translated: Those are the types of the creation stage that are mostly born from the perfection stage.

original: po brje ba'o //
analyzed: po brje ba'o //
translated: By killing, through the purification of hatred by great compassion, the aggregates of samsara are exchanged, because one causes sentient beings who commit great sins such as disparaging the Great Vehicle to attain the state of Akshobhya, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dgos pa de nyid kyis zhugs pa chos kyi mchog snying rje chen po dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyis 'grub po zhes thams cad du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dgos pa de nyid kyis zhugs pa chos kyi mchog snying rje chen po dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyis 'grub po zhes thams cad du blta bar bya'o //
translated: For that very reason, the supreme mundane quality is accomplished by the great compassion and wisdom that are the very purpose of the entry.

original: zhar la byung ba rdzogs nas sngags kyi bzlas pa'i lhag ma gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhar la byung ba rdzogs nas sngags kyi bzlas pa'i lhag ma gsungs pa /
translated: Having completed the digression, he states the remainder of the mantra recitation:

original: snying ga zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snying ga zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “at the heart” and so forth.

original: gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ni le'u gsum @102b par bshad zin to //
analyzed: gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ni le'u gsum @102b par bshad zin to //
translated: The clear light mandala, etc. have been explained in the third chapter.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i 'khor lo'i lte ba la rang gi sngags bsgoms nas chos thams cad ni ma skyes pa'o zhes bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i 'khor lo'i lte ba la rang gi sngags bsgoms nas chos thams cad ni ma skyes pa'o zhes bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The practitioner of Vairocana, having contemplated his mantra in the center of the wheel in the heart of the gnosis being, should contemplate all phenomena as unborn.

original: de bzhin du mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas te rang gi ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar mtshan ma la rang gi sngags bsgoms te chos thams cad stong pa nyid do zhes pa la sogs pa rang gi rnam par
analyzed: de bzhin du mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas te rang gi ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar mtshan ma la rang gi sngags bsgoms te chos thams cad stong pa nyid do zhes pa la sogs pa rang gi rnam par
translated: Similarly, the practitioner of Akshobhya, etc., abiding in his own mandala, having contemplated his mantra on the sign in the heart of his gnosis being, should contemplate the door of his own liberation, all phenomena are emptiness, etc.

original: thar pa'i sgo bsgom par bya'o zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: thar pa'i sgo bsgom par bya'o zhes kha cig go //
translated: So say some.

original: rang gi ye shes kyi don bsgom pa'o zhes gzhan dag go ;
analyzed: rang gi ye shes kyi don bsgom pa'o zhes gzhan dag go ;
translated: Contemplating the meaning of one's own gnosis, say others.

original: / bzlas pa yang rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa nyid kyis bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: / bzlas pa yang rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa nyid kyis bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Recitation is also to be done by abiding in one's own mandala.

original: dkyil 'khor kun gyi ngos rnams su //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor kun gyi ngos rnams su //
translated: On all sides of the mandala

original: zhes pa ni shar la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni shar la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: means in the east, etc.

original: sangs rgyas kun ni rang ji lta bar rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun ni rang ji lta bar rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams so //
translated: All buddhas are the maṇḍala members such as Vairocana, just as one is.

original: so sor de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i kha dog gi 'od zer rab tu dbye bas spros na byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so sor de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i kha dog gi 'od zer rab tu dbye bas spros na byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one emanates through the individual differentiation of the light rays of the colors of the five tathāgatas, one will attain enlightenment.

original: rim pa gnyis po dag gis so //
analyzed: rim pa gnyis po dag gis so //
translated: [It is] through the two stages.

original: sku gsum gyi rdo rje'i dbye ba nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: sku gsum gyi rdo rje'i dbye ba nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He declares just the differentiation of the vajra of the three bodies.

original: sku zhes pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: sku zhes pa la sogs pa /
translated: [He says,] “body” and so forth.

original: sku ni sku yi ngo bo yis //
analyzed: sku ni sku yi ngo bo yis //
translated: The body is the essence of the body.

original: zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should view it.

original: mchod ces pa ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: mchod ces pa ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: “Worship” is with the Rūpavajrā, etc.

original: bla na med pa'i mchod pa rnal 'byor pas thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i mchod pa rnal 'byor pas thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The unsurpassed worship is attained by the yogin.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i cha bshad nas las tshogs brjod par bzhed nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i cha bshad nas las tshogs brjod par bzhed nas gsungs pa /
translated: Having explained the topic of realization, intending to declare the collection of rites, he says,

original: dkyil 'khor chen po'i 'khor lo yis //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po'i 'khor lo yis //
translated: “With the wheel of the great maṇḍala,”

original: zhes pa ni dpag tshad bye bar yangs pa'i gzhal yas khang dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dpag tshad bye bar yangs pa'i gzhal yas khang dang ldan pas so //
translated: endowed with the immeasurable mansion vast for a million leagues.

original: rdo rje lnga rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te nye bar mtshon pa nyid kyis gzhan rnams dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyang yin te /
analyzed: rdo rje lnga rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te nye bar mtshon pa nyid kyis gzhan rnams dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyang yin te /
translated: The five vajras are the Tathagatas, and by implication the others are the mandala deities.

original: sgrub pa chen po'i mthar thug par //
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po'i mthar thug par //
translated: Having completed the great practice,

original: byas pas las ni brtsam par bya //
analyzed: byas pas las ni brtsam par bya //
translated: one should undertake the action.

original: zhes rgyud phyi ma las bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes rgyud phyi ma las bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: This is explained in the Later Tantra.

original: sna tshogs pa'i kha dog rnams kyis bsgom par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i kha dog rnams kyis bsgom par bya ba yin no //
translated: One should meditate on the colors, which are various.

original: de'i dbus su yang rang sngags rdo rje'i rang gi bdag po'i lha'i gzugs sku gsum rdo rje'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su yang rang sngags rdo rje'i rang gi bdag po'i lha'i gzugs sku gsum rdo rje'i bdag po'o //
translated: In the middle of that, one's own mantra is the form of one's lord deity, the lord of the three vajras.

original: chu dang sa dang rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor rnams las gang yang rung ba cig 'dir yin no //
analyzed: chu dang sa dang rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor rnams las gang yang rung ba cig 'dir yin no //
translated: From among the mandalas of water, earth, wind, and fire, any one is appropriate here.

original: kha dog bzhi rnams ni @103a * //
analyzed: kha dog bzhi rnams ni @103a * //
translated: The four colors

original: dkar po dang nag po dang ser po dang dmar po rnams las sbyor ba ji lta bar gang yang rung ba cig bsgoms te de'i snying gar sngags rnams kyi don zhi ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dkar po dang nag po dang ser po dang dmar po rnams las sbyor ba ji lta bar gang yang rung ba cig bsgoms te de'i snying gar sngags rnams kyi don zhi ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: are white, black, yellow, and red. Meditate on any one according to the application. In the middle of that, the meaning of the mantras is peace and so on.

original: der yang bsgrub bya 'jug pa sngon du song bas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: der yang bsgrub bya 'jug pa sngon du song bas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: There also, one should meditate with the prior engagement of the object of attainment.

original: 'di ltar gyur pa na rdo rje rnam pa bzhi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gyur pa na rdo rje rnam pa bzhi bya'o //
translated: In this way, one should perform the four vajra rites.

original: gang gi phyir las kyi tshogs nyid snying rje dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyis gzhan gyi don du 'jug pa ste sgrub pa po dang bsgrub bya'i'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir las kyi tshogs nyid snying rje dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyis gzhan gyi don du 'jug pa ste sgrub pa po dang bsgrub bya'i'o //
translated: Because the very collection of rites is the engagement for the sake of others by means of compassion and wisdom, that is, of the practitioner and the object of attainment.

original: dam pa'i rigs ni rnam pa brgya //
analyzed: dam pa'i rigs ni rnam pa brgya //
translated: The excellent family is of ten kinds.

original: zhes rgyud phyi ma las te de thob par byed pa nyid kyi phyir mchog tu rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes rgyud phyi ma las te de thob par byed pa nyid kyi phyir mchog tu rtag pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is in the Later Tantra, and because it causes the attainment of that, it is supreme and constant.

original: de gsungs pa //
analyzed: de gsungs pa //
translated: That is stated:🔽Whatever one desires,

original: gang zhig zhi dang rgyas sogs las //
analyzed: gang zhig zhi dang rgyas sogs las //
translated: whether pacifying, increasing, and so on,

original: de las gzhan pa'ang gang 'dod pa //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'ang gang 'dod pa //
translated: or other than that,

original: 'khor lo'i rjes chags sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i rjes chags sbyor ba yis //
translated: if one practices by means of the union of the wheel’s passion,

original: bsgrubs na myur du 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: bsgrubs na myur du 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: it will be quickly accomplished.

original: sngags pa byang chub don gnyer bas //
analyzed: sngags pa byang chub don gnyer bas //
translated: The mantrin who strives for the sake of enlightenment,

original: lus ngag yid kyi spyod ldan pa //
analyzed: lus ngag yid kyi spyod ldan pa //
translated: endowed with conduct of body, speech, and mind,

original: de yis cho gas las byas te //
analyzed: de yis cho gas las byas te //
translated: having performed the rite by that,

original: de kun byang chub ched du 'dod //
analyzed: de kun byang chub ched du 'dod //
translated: all of that is desired for the sake of enlightenment.

original: de nyid rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i 'khor lo thams cad la zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang chags pa dang / khros pa'i sems rnams te /
analyzed: de nyid rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i 'khor lo thams cad la zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang chags pa dang / khros pa'i sems rnams te /
translated: That very one, in all the wheels of the deity of one's choice, has the minds of peace, increase, attraction, and wrath.

original: zhi ba la ni zhi ba'i sems //
analyzed: zhi ba la ni zhi ba'i sems //
translated: In peace, with a peaceful mind.

original: rgyas la rgyas pa'i yid kyis te //
analyzed: rgyas la rgyas pa'i yid kyis te //
translated: In increase, with an increasing mind.

original: dbang la chags pa'i yid byas nas //
analyzed: dbang la chags pa'i yid byas nas //
translated: In attraction, having made the mind of passion.

original: khros la khro bos bsgrub par bya ;
analyzed: khros la khro bos bsgrub par bya ;
translated: In wrath, one should practice with wrath.

original: / zhes rgyud phyi ma las so //
analyzed: / zhes rgyud phyi ma las so //
translated: Thus it is in the Later Tantra.

original: dkar po dang ser po dang dmar po dang / nag po'i gos dang stan dang thams cad kyi bdag nyid bsgom pa go rims ji lta bar ston pas zhi ba la sogs pa'i las bzhi thun mong du bshad nas khyad par du bstan pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: dkar po dang ser po dang dmar po dang / nag po'i gos dang stan dang thams cad kyi bdag nyid bsgom pa go rims ji lta bar ston pas zhi ba la sogs pa'i las bzhi thun mong du bshad nas khyad par du bstan pa gsungs pa /
translated: The meditation on the nature of all, white, yellow, red, and black garments and seats, is taught in order. Having explained the four actions of peace, etc., in common, he teaches the special teaching:

original: zhi ba la sogs pa'i bya ba la spyan gyi rnam pa bzhin du gang gi rnam pa yin pa de ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa'i bya ba la spyan gyi rnam pa bzhin du gang gi rnam pa yin pa de ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: In the performance of peace, etc., he who has the aspect of the eye is Vairochana.

original: padma rdo rje can ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: padma rdo rje can ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: He who has the lotus and vajra is Amitabha.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyang 'dir bya ba'i sgra'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyang 'dir bya ba'i sgra'o //
translated: Vairocana is also the word for action here.

original: gnas kyang rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ma lus par sgrub pa byed pa de ni don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: gnas kyang rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ma lus par sgrub pa byed pa de ni don yod grub pa'o //
translated: And the abode is Amoghasiddhi, who accomplishes all of one's own and others' aims without exception.

original: rdo rje yang yin te de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje yang yin te de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: And he is also the vajra, the Tathagata.

original: khro bo yang yin te gdul dka' ba nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pa'i sems can gyi nyon mongs pa rnams la snying rjes bcos ma'i khro bor bstan pas so //
analyzed: khro bo yang yin te gdul dka' ba nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pa'i sems can gyi nyon mongs pa rnams la snying rjes bcos ma'i khro bor bstan pas so //
translated: And he is also the wrathful one, because he displays a wrathful form out of compassion for the afflictions of beings who are difficult to tame and have fallen under the power of afflictions.

original: khros pas na yang sems can don //
analyzed: khros pas na yang sems can don //
translated: And even though he is wrathful, he is for the sake of beings.

original: khro bo chen por @103b rab tu bstan //
analyzed: khro bo chen por @103b rab tu bstan //
translated: He is fully revealed as the great wrathful one.

original: zhes pa'i grub mthas so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i grub mthas so //
translated: This is the conclusion.

original: 'phags pa gshin rje gshed la sogs pa de rnams go rims ji lta bar sngar bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa gshin rje gshed la sogs pa de rnams go rims ji lta bar sngar bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Those noble ones such as Yamantaka should be meditated on in sequence as before.

original: mdor bstan pa'i dag 'di'i don //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa'i dag 'di'i don //
translated: The meaning of this brief explanation is:

original: zhi ba'i dkyil 'khor dam pa ni //
analyzed: zhi ba'i dkyil 'khor dam pa ni //
translated: The sublime mandala of peace,

original: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus gnas par //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus gnas par //
translated: abiding in the center of the realm of space,

original: zhes pa nas brtsams te ji srid du zhal gsum zhes pa la thug pas gang gi phyir sngar bstan pa'i ngag gi don rab tu spros par byed do //
analyzed: zhes pa nas brtsams te ji srid du zhal gsum zhes pa la thug pas gang gi phyir sngar bstan pa'i ngag gi don rab tu spros par byed do //
translated: Beginning from here up to the three faces, the meaning of the verse that was taught previously is elaborated.

original: sgyu mas byed pa'i rol mo bzhin du 'di'i ye shes kyi rdo rje nyid kyis sprul cing mtshon pa yang yin no //
analyzed: sgyu mas byed pa'i rol mo bzhin du 'di'i ye shes kyi rdo rje nyid kyis sprul cing mtshon pa yang yin no //
translated: And it is also emanated and indicated by the wisdom-vajra of this one, like an illusory performance.

original: da ni mdor bstan pa'i rim pa las 'das te snying rje chen po'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pas drag po'i las kyi yul la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa po dag gis mtho ris dang thar pa'i bar du gcod pa yin no zhes pa'i
analyzed: da ni mdor bstan pa'i rim pa las 'das te snying rje chen po'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pas drag po'i las kyi yul la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa po dag gis mtho ris dang thar pa'i bar du gcod pa yin no zhes pa'i
translated: Now, having gone beyond the sequence of the brief teaching, he, having become subject to the power of great compassion, is the one who obstructs heaven and liberation for those to be trained and the trainers by means of the domain of wrathful action.

original: log par rtog pa bsal bar 'dod nas yul nges pa bstan pa'i ched du de nyid thob par byed pa'i phyir dang por gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: log par rtog pa bsal bar 'dod nas yul nges pa bstan pa'i ched du de nyid thob par byed pa'i phyir dang por gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Desiring to dispel that wrong conception, in order to teach the ascertainment of the domain, he first taught in order to attain reality,

original: dkon mchog gsum la mi snyan pa smra ba'i ngang tshul nyid rab tu ston pas so //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la mi snyan pa smra ba'i ngang tshul nyid rab tu ston pas so //
translated: because he is the one who teaches the nature of speaking unpleasantly to the Three Jewels.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral ba la gal te brgya la smras kyang de dang phrad pa las de spong ba'i yi dam de yang dag par blangs pa rnams ni yul ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral ba la gal te brgya la smras kyang de dang phrad pa las de spong ba'i yi dam de yang dag par blangs pa rnams ni yul ma yin no //
translated: If one is separated from the spiritual friend, even if one were to speak to him a hundred times, it is not the proper occasion for taking the vow to abandon that, because of the difficulty of meeting him.

original: rdo rje slob dpon ni dpal gsang ba 'dus pa ru dbang bskur ba la gang rnams kyis smod par byed pa zhes khyad par smos pas mtshams med pa lnga rnams byas pas kyang de la smad pa'i pham par gyur pa nyid kyis shin tu lci bar gyur pa'i
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon ni dpal gsang ba 'dus pa ru dbang bskur ba la gang rnams kyis smod par byed pa zhes khyad par smos pas mtshams med pa lnga rnams byas pas kyang de la smad pa'i pham par gyur pa nyid kyis shin tu lci bar gyur pa'i
translated: The vajra master is mentioned by the special phrase “who reviles the initiation of Sri Heruka’s tantra.” Even one who has committed the five acts of immediate retribution has a very heavy sin by the downfall of reviling him,

original: mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu thob par byed pa nyid du gsungs so //🔽dkon mchog gsum la gnod byed pa //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu thob par byed pa nyid du gsungs so // dkon mchog gsum la gnod byed pa //
translated: and is said to obtain an undesirable result.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa rgyud gzhan las gsungs pa'i phyir gang gzhan rnams kyang ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa rgyud gzhan las gsungs pa'i phyir gang gzhan rnams kyang ste /
translated: “One who harms the Three Jewels” and so on is mentioned in other tantras, and so is anyone else.

original: ma gsod pa la sogs pa la zhugs pa sdang ba de rnams nyid dkon mchog gsum dang sems can mang po la gnod pa byed pa nyid kyis ngan song gi lam du zhugs pa rnams la snying rje chen po'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pas de las bzlog
analyzed: ma gsod pa la sogs pa la zhugs pa sdang ba de rnams nyid dkon mchog gsum dang sems can mang po la gnod pa byed pa nyid kyis ngan song gi lam du zhugs pa rnams la snying rje chen po'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pas de las bzlog
translated: Those who are engaged in killing and so on, who are hostile, are themselves engaged in the path to the lower realms by their harm to the Three Jewels and to many sentient beings.

original: pa'i phyir 'chad par 'gyur ba 'di rmi lam la sogs pa dang 'dra bar brgyal ba dang nad la sogs pa yang dag par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid ni drag po'i las te gang gis dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa la @104a * //
analyzed: pa'i phyir 'chad par 'gyur ba 'di rmi lam la sogs pa dang 'dra bar brgyal ba dang nad la sogs pa yang dag par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid ni drag po'i las te gang gis dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa la @104a * //
translated: For them, through the power of great compassion, this wrathful rite, which is to be explained, is like a dream and so on, with the characteristics of being taught as an antidote to fainting and sickness and so on.

original: gnod pa byed pa'i sdig pa can de rnams la bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa'i sdig pa can de rnams la bskul bar bya'o //
translated: By this, one should incite those who harm the Three Jewels and so on.

original: rang gi sdig pa'i las 'di byas pa 'dis nga la 'di lta bu byung ngo zhes de las ldog pa'i don du dran du gzhug go //
analyzed: rang gi sdig pa'i las 'di byas pa 'dis nga la 'di lta bu byung ngo zhes de las ldog pa'i don du dran du gzhug go //
translated: One should remind them, By doing this sinful deed, this has happened to me. For the sake of turning them away from that,

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa'i phyir snying rje chen po dang ldan pa rnams kyis de rab tu bskul bar bya'o //🔽ae ma kun du bzang po yi //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa'i phyir snying rje chen po dang ldan pa rnams kyis de rab tu bskul bar bya'o // ae ma kun du bzang po yi //
translated: The great compassion of those who are endowed with great compassion is aroused in order to attain the unsurpassed enlightenment of the object to be attained and the means of attaining it.

original: thugs rje mchog ni dri ma med //🔽sdang la drag po'i las kyis kyang //
analyzed: thugs rje mchog ni dri ma med // sdang la drag po'i las kyis kyang //
translated: How wonderful is the supreme, stainless compassion of Samantabhadra,

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu stsol //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu stsol //
translated: who bestows the fruit of buddhahood even on the hateful and violent!

original: zhes rgyud phyi ma las so //
analyzed: zhes rgyud phyi ma las so //
translated: Thus it is in the Later Tantra.

original: chen po yang dngos po ma lus pa la khyab pa'i phyir yin la ye shes kyang chos thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: chen po yang dngos po ma lus pa la khyab pa'i phyir yin la ye shes kyang chos thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas so //
translated: It is great because it pervades all things without exception, and it is intuition because it is characterized by the realization of all aspects of all things.

original: de nyid 'khor lo ni dkyil 'khor yin te ye shes lnga'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir gang rdo rje yin pa de ni de bzhin te bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: de nyid 'khor lo ni dkyil 'khor yin te ye shes lnga'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir gang rdo rje yin pa de ni de bzhin te bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po yin no //
translated: That wheel is the mandala, because it is the nature of the five intuitions. He who is the vajra is just that, the Great Vajradhara, the Blessed One.

original: khams gsum zhes pa la sogs pa la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra mo rnams dang mnyam pa'i sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi sku rnams su bsgoms nas mi snyan par smra ba la sogs pa rnams kyi sta res bcad cing tho bas bye
analyzed: khams gsum zhes pa la sogs pa la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra mo rnams dang mnyam pa'i sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi sku rnams su bsgoms nas mi snyan par smra ba la sogs pa rnams kyi sta res bcad cing tho bas bye
translated: With respect to the line all the realms of the three worlds, and so on, one should imagine that all sentient beings equal to the atoms of all the world realms meditate on the forms of the buddhas, and that those who speak unpleasantly and so on are cut with axes and smashed with hammers by the buddhas.

original: mar byas par bsams nas sdang ba'i sems can de rnams nga ni sangs rgyas gsod par byed pa'o zhes 'gyod pa skyes te dmyal bas 'jigs pa rnams skyabs med par blta ste /
analyzed: mar byas par bsams nas sdang ba'i sems can de rnams nga ni sangs rgyas gsod par byed pa'o zhes 'gyod pa skyes te dmyal bas 'jigs pa rnams skyabs med par blta ste /
translated: Thinking, Those sentient beings who are hostile are killers of the buddhas, they should be seen as having no refuge, since they are afraid of the hells.

original: de dag gnon pa'i ched du snying rje chen po'i khro ba bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gnon pa'i ched du snying rje chen po'i khro ba bskyed par bya'o //
translated: For the purpose of subduing them, one should generate the wrath of great compassion.

original: kha sbyar dbye ba byas nas ni //
analyzed: kha sbyar dbye ba byas nas ni //
translated: Having opened the joined palms,

original: zhes pa ni bsrung ba'i kha sbyar bsal nas so ;
analyzed: zhes pa ni bsrung ba'i kha sbyar bsal nas so ;
translated: this means that the joined palms of protection are removed.

original: /'di skad brjod par 'gyur te rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor pa ji ltar brjod pa'i sems can gyi yul rnams kyis mi dge ba'i tshogs bsags te 'jigs pas brgyal bar 'gyur ba rnams bltas la de rnams gdon pa'i ched du snying rje chen pos khro ba
analyzed: /'di skad brjod par 'gyur te rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor pa ji ltar brjod pa'i sems can gyi yul rnams kyis mi dge ba'i tshogs bsags te 'jigs pas brgyal bar 'gyur ba rnams bltas la de rnams gdon pa'i ched du snying rje chen pos khro ba
translated: One should say this: “The yogī of one’s chosen deity, seeing that beings, due to the accumulation of nonvirtue, are frightened and faint, should arouse wrath out of great compassion in order to rescue them.

original: bskyed de rang gi snying ga nas rdo rje lcags kyu bton nas des de rnams kyi h'um dang bam las byung ba'i phyi'i bsrung ba'i kha sbyar dang dbyangs yig tha ma las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje yi ge ham gis byin gyis brlabs pa mgo bo la
analyzed: bskyed de rang gi snying ga nas rdo rje lcags kyu bton nas des de rnams kyi h'um dang bam las byung ba'i phyi'i bsrung ba'i kha sbyar dang dbyangs yig tha ma las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje yi ge ham gis byin gyis brlabs pa mgo bo la
translated: Having emanated a vajra hook from one’s heart, with that one should draw out those beings from the outer enclosure of a protection circle arisen from hūṃ and vaṃ, and from the variegated vajra cross arisen from the final vowel [ḥ], consecrated with the syllable haṃ, which is on their heads.

original: gnas pa yang bkug ste rang gi g-yon phyogs su bzhag nas slar yang de @104b nyid rdo rje'i lam nas zhugs nas de'i snying ga na gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems zla ba la gnas pa'i ye shes kyi lha'i 'khor lo h'um yig la sogs pa las byung
analyzed: gnas pa yang bkug ste rang gi g-yon phyogs su bzhag nas slar yang de @104b nyid rdo rje'i lam nas zhugs nas de'i snying ga na gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems zla ba la gnas pa'i ye shes kyi lha'i 'khor lo h'um yig la sogs pa las byung
translated: Again, having entered through the vajra path, one should protect the wheel of the gnosis deity residing in the moon of bodhicitta in the heart of the pledge being, arisen from the syllable hūṃ, etc.,

original: ba'i rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang rin po che dang padma dang yi ge ham gis byin gyis brlabs pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i kha sbyor gyis mngon par bsrung ba byas pa la rdo rje lcags kyus bskul bar bya ste 'di ni snyan par smra ba dang bla
analyzed: ba'i rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang rin po che dang padma dang yi ge ham gis byin gyis brlabs pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i kha sbyor gyis mngon par bsrung ba byas pa la rdo rje lcags kyus bskul bar bya ste 'di ni snyan par smra ba dang bla
translated: with the union of the vajra cross consecrated by the vajra, wheel, jewel, lotus, and syllable haṃ.🔽One should urge the vajra hook to do this, saying, “Since this one is a flatterer, a slanderer of the guru, and a killer of many buddhas, you should abandon the protection and consecration of this one.”

original: ma la smod pa dang sangs rgyas mang po gsod par byed pa gang yin pa des na 'di bsrung ba dang byin gyis brlab pa yang thong cig / de ltar ma yin na khyod nyid brdzun gsungs pa yin la rang gis gsungs pa'i dam tshig las 'da' ba
analyzed: ma la smod pa dang sangs rgyas mang po gsod par byed pa gang yin pa des na 'di bsrung ba dang byin gyis brlab pa yang thong cig / de ltar ma yin na khyod nyid brdzun gsungs pa yin la rang gis gsungs pa'i dam tshig las 'da' ba
translated: If one does not do it that way, one is a liar, and one transgresses one’s own spoken pledge.

original: yang yin no zhes so //
analyzed: yang yin no zhes so //
translated: And they said, Yes!

original: de nas de rnams kyis kyang zhal gyis bzhes te /🔽kho bo cag rnams kyis 'di'i lus po btang gis ji ltar 'dod pa gyis shig ces gsungs ma thag tu rdo rje lcags kyus bsrung ba'i kha sbyor dang lhan cig pa'i lha'i 'khor lo blangs nas gtad pa de de nyid du bzhag ste lag pa g-yon pas bdud
analyzed: de nas de rnams kyis kyang zhal gyis bzhes te / kho bo cag rnams kyis 'di'i lus po btang gis ji ltar 'dod pa gyis shig ces gsungs ma thag tu rdo rje lcags kyus bsrung ba'i kha sbyor dang lhan cig pa'i lha'i 'khor lo blangs nas gtad pa de de nyid du bzhag ste lag pa g-yon pas bdud
translated: Then they agreed,🔽and said, We will give up our bodies. Do whatever you wish!🔽 As soon as they said that, Vajra Hook took the divine wheel together with the protective enclosure, and placed it there.🔽With his left hand he took up the wrathful one known as nectar, and with his right hand he took up the vajra hammer, which was in the hand of the one who was to be planted with the kīla.

original: rtsir grags pa'i khro bor bzung ste phur pa 'debs par byed pa'i lag pa g-yas pa na gnas pa'i rdo rje tho bas brdegs pas phur bus gdab bo //
analyzed: rtsir grags pa'i khro bor bzung ste phur pa 'debs par byed pa'i lag pa g-yas pa na gnas pa'i rdo rje tho bas brdegs pas phur bus gdab bo //
translated: He struck with the hammer, and planted the kīla.

original: gang 'tshang pa /
analyzed: gang 'tshang pa /
translated: Who was planted?🔽The protection and so forth, the mantras,

original: bsrung la sogs dang sngags rnams dang ; / lha rnams la ni phur bu gdab //
analyzed: bsrung la sogs dang sngags rnams dang ; / lha rnams la ni phur bu gdab //
translated: and the deities were planted with the kīla.

original: ces so // de nas zhes pa ni 'di ltar kha sbyar dbye ba byas te snying rje dang shes rab sngon du song bas bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyis gnang ba'i phyir drag po las te phul du byung ba ni skyes bu mchog thob par byed pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya
analyzed: ces so // de nas zhes pa ni 'di ltar kha sbyar dbye ba byas te snying rje dang shes rab sngon du song bas bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyis gnang ba'i phyir drag po las te phul du byung ba ni skyes bu mchog thob par byed pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya
translated: Then, after thus separating the union, one should accomplish the fierce action, because it is permitted by the Sugatas, who are preceded by compassion and wisdom.

original: ste gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: ste gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes kha cig go //
translated: The best is for the sake of attaining the state of a supreme person, not otherwise, some say.

original: bsgrub bya'i lus gang yin la yang zhes rgyud phyi ma las brjod pa'i cho gas bla ma'i man ngag nyid kyis kha sbyar dbye bar shes par bya'o zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i lus gang yin la yang zhes rgyud phyi ma las brjod pa'i cho gas bla ma'i man ngag nyid kyis kha sbyar dbye bar shes par bya'o zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: And also for the body of the one to be accomplished, one should know the separation of the union by the guru’s instruction alone, according to the procedure stated in the Continuation of the Continuation of the Compendium of Practice.

original: rdo rje rtse lnga pa kha bzhi pa ni sna tshogs rdo rje ste rdo rje sems dpa' zhe sdang gi rigs kyi bdag po bsgom par bya'o zhes ye shes zhabs kyi rjes su 'brang ba byed pa po'i dpal sde'i zhabs so //
analyzed: rdo rje rtse lnga pa kha bzhi pa ni sna tshogs rdo rje ste rdo rje sems dpa' zhe sdang gi rigs kyi bdag po bsgom par bya'o zhes ye shes zhabs kyi rjes su 'brang ba byed pa po'i dpal sde'i zhabs so //
translated: The four-faced five-pronged vajra is the variegated vajra. One should meditate on Vajrasattva, the lord of the family of anger, say those who follow the tradition of Jnanapada.

original: rtse mo nyi shu pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje las byung ba'i bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa'o zhes pa ni rdo rje zhabs so //
analyzed: rtse mo nyi shu pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje las byung ba'i bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa'o zhes pa ni rdo rje zhabs so //
translated: Vajra-pāda says that it is Vajrasattva, who arises from the variegated vajra at the tip of the twenty-point vajra.

original: rdo rje rtse lnga kha bzhi pa las grub pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po khros pa zhal bzhi pa yin no zhes pa ni @105a * //🔽chos kyi zhabs so //
analyzed: rdo rje rtse lnga kha bzhi pa las grub pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po khros pa zhal bzhi pa yin no zhes pa ni @105a * // chos kyi zhabs so //
translated: Dharma-pāda says that it is the wrathful four-faced Great Vajra-holder, who is formed from the four-faced five-pointed vajra.

original: khro bo'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rdo rje rtse lnga pa las byung ba'i zhal bzhi phyag drug pa khros pa'o zhes snying po zhabs so //
analyzed: khro bo'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rdo rje rtse lnga pa las byung ba'i zhal bzhi phyag drug pa khros pa'o zhes snying po zhabs so //
translated: Garbha-pāda says that it is the wrathful four-faced six-armed one, who arises from the five-pointed vajra in the center of the mandala of wrathful deities.

original: rtse lnga pa'i rdo rje 'bar ba las byung ba'i zhal bzhi pa khros pa g-yon brkyang bas gnas pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po zhes myu gu dang sde gzhan dang bshes gnyen zhabs rnams so //
analyzed: rtse lnga pa'i rdo rje 'bar ba las byung ba'i zhal bzhi pa khros pa g-yon brkyang bas gnas pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po zhes myu gu dang sde gzhan dang bshes gnyen zhabs rnams so //
translated: Aṅkura, the other school, and Mitrayogin say that it is the wrathful four-faced Great Vajra-holder, who arises from the blazing five-pointed vajra, and stands with the left leg straight.

original: de la rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po zhal bzhi pa zhes pa 'di dang zhal gsum pa'i tshul du snang bar gyur to zhes pa dang po'i tshig dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de la rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po zhal bzhi pa zhes pa 'di dang zhal gsum pa'i tshul du snang bar gyur to zhes pa dang po'i tshig dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Here, the phrase the great vajra-holder with four faces contradicts the phrase appeared in the form of three faces.

original: g-yon brkyang gis gnas pa zhes pa 'di yang /
analyzed: g-yon brkyang gis gnas pa zhes pa 'di yang /
translated: The phrase standing with the left leg extended

original: rnam par snang mdzad 'od 'drar 'gyur ;
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad 'od 'drar 'gyur ;
translated: contradicts the phrase like Vairocana's light.

original: / rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bco lnga pa dang po //
analyzed: / rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bco lnga pa dang po //
translated: The phrase vajra-being contradicts the phrase fifteen.

original: las tshogs kyi dbye bas sku la sogs pa dang kha dog dang gdan dang mtshan ma dang nyams kyi dbye ba nyid rgyud 'dir thos so //
analyzed: las tshogs kyi dbye bas sku la sogs pa dang kha dog dang gdan dang mtshan ma dang nyams kyi dbye ba nyid rgyud 'dir thos so //
translated: The divisions of the body, color, seat, sign, and experience by the division of the collection of actions are heard in this tantra.

original: kha bzhi pa zhes pa 'di nyid kyi shes par byed pa yin pas zhal gyi dbye ba la sogs pa'i khyad par yang yin no zhe na /
analyzed: kha bzhi pa zhes pa 'di nyid kyi shes par byed pa yin pas zhal gyi dbye ba la sogs pa'i khyad par yang yin no zhe na /
translated: Since this very four-faced is the explainer, the distinctions of the division of faces and so on are also.

original: ma yin te de gzhan du bshad pa nyid kyis shes par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir te gzhan du na rtogs par mi byed pa'i tshul ni shes par byed pa yin no zhes shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te de gzhan du bshad pa nyid kyis shes par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir te gzhan du na rtogs par mi byed pa'i tshul ni shes par byed pa yin no zhes shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because that is explained elsewhere, and it is not a means of knowledge. If it were, then the method of non-understanding would be the definition of a means of knowledge.

original: de bzhin du 'grel ba byed pa gzhan la yang ci ltar rigs par lung la sogs pa dang 'gal ba rigs pa shes pa rnams kyis spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'grel ba byed pa gzhan la yang ci ltar rigs par lung la sogs pa dang 'gal ba rigs pa shes pa rnams kyis spyad par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, other commentators should use reasoning to point out contradictions with scripture and so on, as appropriate.

original: de ltar rdo rje sems dpa' bsgoms pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams lag pa g-yas pa na yod pa'i rdo rje 'bar ba'i nang
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje sems dpa' bsgoms pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams lag pa g-yas pa na yod pa'i rdo rje 'bar ba'i nang
translated: Thus, by meditating on Vajrasattva, the maṇḍalas of tathāgatas of the past, future, and present equal to the number of atoms in all world systems are in the blazing vajra in the right hand.

original: du chud par bsams te de'i 'od zer gyis sems can gyi khams thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin du byas te rang gi lus la bcug nas spro bar byas te de nas de rnams rgyud ji lta bar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: du chud par bsams te de'i 'od zer gyis sems can gyi khams thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin du byas te rang gi lus la bcug nas spro bar byas te de nas de rnams rgyud ji lta bar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having imagined that, by the light rays of that, the entire realm of sentient beings is made into the nature of the maṇḍala of the tathāgata family, and having caused them to enter one’s body and emanate, then those should be meditated on according to the tantra.

original: gsad pa ni ngan song gi 'khor ba'i lam las bzlo ba ste bde bar gshegs pa'i byang chub kyi lam la ji ltar rigs par rab tu bzhag pas na'o //
analyzed: gsad pa ni ngan song gi 'khor ba'i lam las bzlo ba ste bde bar gshegs pa'i byang chub kyi lam la ji ltar rigs par rab tu bzhag pas na'o //
translated: “ Killing” is turning away from the path of the lower realms and establishing them in the path of the sugatas, according to their type.

original: don ni des bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa po'i don dngos te sangs rgyas nyid du sems @105b dpa'o //
analyzed: don ni des bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa po'i don dngos te sangs rgyas nyid du sems @105b dpa'o //
translated: “ Purpose” is the actual purpose of the object to be accomplished and the means of accomplishment, which is buddhahood.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' yang zhes pa dang sangs rgyas kyis kyang zhes pa ni shin tu bar brjod pa ste rnal 'byor gyi che ba nyid bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' yang zhes pa dang sangs rgyas kyis kyang zhes pa ni shin tu bar brjod pa ste rnal 'byor gyi che ba nyid bstan to //
translated: “ Vajrasattva” and “the buddhas” are stated for emphasis, indicating the greatness of the yoga.

original: dngos grub gtso bo ni de las khyad par can gzhan med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos grub gtso bo ni de las khyad par can gzhan med pa'i phyir /
translated: “ The principal spiritual power” is because there is no other spiritual power superior to that.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad mkhyen pa ste snying rje dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis yang dag par sems can gyi don du zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pa dang des byin gyis rlob pa'i bsgrub bya la sku gsum gyi
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad mkhyen pa ste snying rje dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis yang dag par sems can gyi don du zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pa dang des byin gyis rlob pa'i bsgrub bya la sku gsum gyi
translated: are granted to the practitioner and the one to be accomplished who is blessed by him, who is endowed with the nature of compassion and wisdom, who is engaged in the welfare of sentient beings, and who has the characteristic of omniscience, the perfect benefit of self and other.

original: mchog stsol ba ste de thob par byed pa ni yang dag pa'i gdams ngag gi sgo nas so //
analyzed: mchog stsol ba ste de thob par byed pa ni yang dag pa'i gdams ngag gi sgo nas so //
translated: The attainment of that is by means of the correct instruction.

original: rmongs pa'i bdag nyid kyi bsgrub bya yang dag pa'i lam ma yin par zhugs pa de byin gyis brlabs pa des 'chi ba yin te rgyud kyi sdig pa bcad nas yang dag pa'i lam la brten pa'i rgyud kyis 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rmongs pa'i bdag nyid kyi bsgrub bya yang dag pa'i lam ma yin par zhugs pa de byin gyis brlabs pa des 'chi ba yin te rgyud kyi sdig pa bcad nas yang dag pa'i lam la brten pa'i rgyud kyis 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: The one to be accomplished, who is of the nature of delusion, who is engaged in the incorrect path, dies by that blessing, and after cutting off the sins of the tantra, enters the tantra that is based on the correct path.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi byin gyi rlabs kyis yin no //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi byin gyi rlabs kyis yin no //
translated: That is by the blessing of the spiritual friend, because it is inconceivable.

original: mi 'grub po zhes pa ni bya ba nyams pa'i bsgrub bya la sangs rgyas kyis kyang bsrung pa'i sgo nas so zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: mi 'grub po zhes pa ni bya ba nyams pa'i bsgrub bya la sangs rgyas kyis kyang bsrung pa'i sgo nas so zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say: It is not accomplished, because even the Buddha cannot protect the object to be accomplished who has impaired action.

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis rjes su gnang ba yin na yang ji skad du brjod pa'i bsgrub bya snying rje'i yul la rnal 'byor pa de dman pas btang snyoms su byas na de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' las 'das pa'i ngo bo phas
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis rjes su gnang ba yin na yang ji skad du brjod pa'i bsgrub bya snying rje'i yul la rnal 'byor pa de dman pas btang snyoms su byas na de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' las 'das pa'i ngo bo phas
translated: If the object to be accomplished is an object of compassion, as stated, and the yogi is inferior and neutralizes it, then at that time, the essence of transgressing the word of the Tathagata is a downfall of a defeating offense.

original: pham pa'i ltung ba byung ba mi 'grub ste dge ba'i rtsa ba ma lus pa bcad pas ta la'i mgo bo bcad pa bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba'i myu gu skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: pham pa'i ltung ba byung ba mi 'grub ste dge ba'i rtsa ba ma lus pa bcad pas ta la'i mgo bo bcad pa bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba'i myu gu skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: It is not accomplished because the root of virtue is severed, like the severed head of a palm tree, and the sprout of virtue does not grow.

original: rdo rje dam tshig rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pas 'khor lo gang du bka' ster bar byed pa de yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: rdo rje dam tshig rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pas 'khor lo gang du bka' ster bar byed pa de yang de bzhin te /
translated: The wheel that the vajra being who is a vajra being master bestows is also like that.

original: de nas bka' mnos khro bos ni //
analyzed: de nas bka' mnos khro bos ni //
translated: Then, the one who receives the command should be wrathful.

original: zhes rgyud phyi ma las brjod pas de'i ming gi ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: zhes rgyud phyi ma las brjod pas de'i ming gi ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: This is the samadhi called “Name”.

original: bri ba'i dkyil 'khor la rnal 'byor pas bgegs bskrad pa gsungs pa nam mkha'i dbyings zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bri ba'i dkyil 'khor la rnal 'byor pas bgegs bskrad pa gsungs pa nam mkha'i dbyings zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The yoga of the maṇḍala to be drawn is taught, beginning with “the realm of space”, and so on.

original: de'i phyag na zhes pa ni de rnams kyi'o zhes kha cig go //🔽'khor lo las byung ba sngar bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad rdzogs par bya ste bsgoms nas lag pa g-yas pa nam mkha' dang mnyam par bsams te de'i steng du rdo rje 'bar bas brgyan pa'i 'khor la dus gsum @106a * //
analyzed: de'i phyag na zhes pa ni de rnams kyi'o zhes kha cig go // 'khor lo las byung ba sngar bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad rdzogs par bya ste bsgoms nas lag pa g-yas pa nam mkha' dang mnyam par bsams te de'i steng du rdo rje 'bar bas brgyan pa'i 'khor la dus gsum @106a * //
translated: Some say that “in his hands” means “in their hands”.

original: gyi dam tshig las yang dag par byung ba'i rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra mo dang mnyam pa'i khro bo'i dkyil 'khor thams cad bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gyi dam tshig las yang dag par byung ba'i rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra mo dang mnyam pa'i khro bo'i dkyil 'khor thams cad bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having visualized Vairocana as before, arisen from the wheel, having meditated, one should visualize one’s right hand as equal to space, and on top of that, the blazing vajra, adorned with the maṇḍala arisen from the three times’ commitments, and Vajrasattva, and all the wrathful maṇḍalas equal to the atoms in all world realms, arisen from the three times’ commitments, should be meditated upon.

original: thams cad kyang yin la sems can gyi khams kyang yin te 'khor lo'i 'od zer gyi snang bas khro bo'i rigs kyi rang bzhin du byas te /
analyzed: thams cad kyang yin la sems can gyi khams kyang yin te 'khor lo'i 'od zer gyi snang bas khro bo'i rigs kyi rang bzhin du byas te /
translated: All of them are sentient beings, and the realm of sentient beings, since they are made into the nature of the wrathful clan by the illumination of the light rays of the wheel.

original: slar bsdus nas rang gi lus la bcug nas slar yang khro bo rnams spro bar bya ste /
analyzed: slar bsdus nas rang gi lus la bcug nas slar yang khro bo rnams spro bar bya ste /
translated: Having withdrawn them again, and having placed them in one's own body, one should again emit the wrathful ones.

original: nam mkha' bkang la 'di skad brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' bkang la 'di skad brjod par bya ste /
translated: Having filled the sky, one should utter this:

original: sangs rgyas thams cad bdag la gson //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad bdag la gson //
translated: All Buddhas, listen to me!

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so forth.

original: 'di skad brjod nas sdang ba gsang par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di skad brjod nas sdang ba gsang par bya'o //
translated: Having uttered this, one should perform the secret wrath.

original: gal te dam tshig las 'das na zhes pa ni gal te rnal 'byor pa nus pa yod kyang sdang ba la chad pa mi byed na zhig par te 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dam tshig las 'das na zhes pa ni gal te rnal 'byor pa nus pa yod kyang sdang ba la chad pa mi byed na zhig par te 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one transgresses the pledge, if the yogi, even though he has power, does not perform the punishment of wrath, he will perish, that is, he will die.

original: gang gi phyir khros pa ma yin yang sems can gyi don du khro bo chen po ston pa ni dam tshig yin no zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khros pa ma yin yang sems can gyi don du khro bo chen po ston pa ni dam tshig yin no zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: Others say, Because it is a pledge that even though one is not angry, one displays great wrath for the sake of sentient beings.

original: ye shes mchog gi gnyen zhes pa ni snying rje'i rtsa ba yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa nyid kyis mchog gi gnyen no //
analyzed: ye shes mchog gi gnyen zhes pa ni snying rje'i rtsa ba yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa nyid kyis mchog gi gnyen no //
translated: The friend of supreme intuition is compassion, which is the root of the intuition of reality, and is the supreme friend because it causes all sentient beings to attain supreme enlightenment.

original: 'khor lo de las byung ba ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: 'khor lo de las byung ba ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The one who arises from that wheel is Vairocana.

original: des na bka'i dam tshig gi rdo rje gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: des na bka'i dam tshig gi rdo rje gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, the one who is the vajra of the commitment of the word is just that.

original: sangs rgyas ni rnam par snang mdzad de de sngon du song ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa 'di khyad par gyi gnod pa gang du med pa yin na thams cad du yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni rnam par snang mdzad de de sngon du song ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa 'di khyad par gyi gnod pa gang du med pa yin na thams cad du yin no //
translated: The Buddha is Vairocana, and the mandala that precedes him is one in which there is no special harm, and it is everywhere.

original: de la rdo rje can ni ye shes lnga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa gshin rje gshed kyi dkyil 'khor can yin no //
analyzed: de la rdo rje can ni ye shes lnga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa gshin rje gshed kyi dkyil 'khor can yin no //
translated: There, the one who has the vajra is the one who has the mandala of the sublime Akshobhya, who is endowed with the five intuitions, and so on.

original: de nyid gsal bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated clearly:

original: gshin rje gshed ces pa la sogs pa ste rang yang yin la rdo rjer grags pa yang yin no //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed ces pa la sogs pa ste rang yang yin la rdo rjer grags pa yang yin no //
translated: The one who is called Yamantaka, and so on, is himself and is also renowned as the vajra.

original: sems can sangs rgyas kyi rnam pa can rnams sdang ba rnams kyis gsad par bsgom par bya zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: sems can sangs rgyas kyi rnam pa can rnams sdang ba rnams kyis gsad par bsgom par bya zhes 'brel to //
translated: One should meditate on the killing of those who hate sentient beings who have the aspect of Buddhas.

analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa nas brjod ces pa'i mthar thug bzhes pa 'di'i bshad pa ni h'um mdzad ces pa la sogs pa nas // bsams la bgegs ni rnam par gzhom // zhes pa la thug pa'o // de la gtsug tor gyi dam tshig gtsug tor chen po'i 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs @106b pa brgyad do // nam mkha' rdo rje dbus gnas par //
translated: The explanation of this from “Vajra of Body, Speech, and Mind” up to “say” is from “Humkara” up to “one should imagine and destroy the obstructors.”

original: zhes pa la sogs pa nas rtag ces pa'i mthar thug pa de'i bshad pa ni rig bcas pa'i /🔽rnam par snang mdzad yan lag las byung ba //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa nas rtag ces pa'i mthar thug pa de'i bshad pa ni rig bcas pa'i / rnam par snang mdzad yan lag las byung ba //
translated: The explanation of this from “in the center of the vajra of space” up to “always” is from “the one endowed with knowledge” up to “one should imagine and destroy the obstructors.”

original: zhes pa nas /🔽gzhal yas khang pa der ni bsam par bya //
analyzed: zhes pa nas / gzhal yas khang pa der ni bsam par bya //
translated: The explanation of this from “Vairochana arisen from the limbs” up to “one should imagine and destroy the obstructors” is from “the one endowed with knowledge” up to “one should imagine and destroy the obstructors.”

original: zhes pa la mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The explanation of this from “the one endowed with knowledge” up to “one should imagine and destroy the obstructors” is from “the one endowed with knowledge” up to “one should imagine and destroy the obstructors.”🔽The explanation of this from “the one endowed with knowledge” up to “one should imagine and destroy the obstructors” is from “the one endowed with knowledge” up to “one should imagine and destroy the obstructors.”

original: mkha' dbyings sangs rgyas zhes pa la sogs pa nas ting nge 'dzin to zhes pa'i mthar thug pa de'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: mkha' dbyings sangs rgyas zhes pa la sogs pa nas ting nge 'dzin to zhes pa'i mthar thug pa de'i bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation from “the space buddha” up to “samādhi” is as follows.

original: dpal mchog dang po'i snying po las byung ba //🔽zhes pa la sogs pa nas /🔽'gro ba mchog gi don rnams byas gyur pa //
analyzed: dpal mchog dang po'i snying po las byung ba // zhes pa la sogs pa nas / 'gro ba mchog gi don rnams byas gyur pa //
translated: It arises from the essence of the glorious Supreme Original Buddha.

original: zhes pa'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: Up to “having accomplished the aims of the supreme migrators.”

original: rdo rje phra mo bsgom pa bstan par byas te /
analyzed: rdo rje phra mo bsgom pa bstan par byas te /
translated: The meditation on the subtle vajra is taught.

original: rnam pa kun gyi mchog ldan pa'i //
analyzed: rnam pa kun gyi mchog ldan pa'i //
translated: Having meditated on oneself as Vajrasattva endowed with the supreme of all aspects,🔽one should place the tongue on the palate and imagine the form of a buddha at the tip of the nose from the syllable hūṃ.

original: rdo rje sems dpar bdag nyid yi ge h'um las bsgoms te lce yang rkan la sbyar nas yi ge h'um las sangs rgyas kyi gzugs sna'i rtse mor bsams te rdo rje phra mo spros pa'i sbyor bas chu'i rdul phra rab sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyi rang bzhin du
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpar bdag nyid yi ge h'um las bsgoms te lce yang rkan la sbyar nas yi ge h'um las sangs rgyas kyi gzugs sna'i rtse mor bsams te rdo rje phra mo spros pa'i sbyor bas chu'i rdul phra rab sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyi rang bzhin du
translated: Having made the subtle vajra emanate, one should imagine the subtle particles of water in the nature of the form of a buddha.

original: byas te de nas gsal por byas la chu'i steng du bcag par bya'o //
analyzed: byas te de nas gsal por byas la chu'i steng du bcag par bya'o //
translated: Then, having clarified that, one should break through the surface of the water.

original: mchog tu mnyam pa'i sbyor bas rang gi lus kyi rdul phra rab rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin du bsgoms nas so //
analyzed: mchog tu mnyam pa'i sbyor bas rang gi lus kyi rdul phra rab rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin du bsgoms nas so //
translated: By the supreme yoga of equality, having meditated on the atoms of one’s body as having the nature of the Tathāgatas,

original: dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya zhes pa ni /
translated: one should meditate on the maṇḍala of the great element.

original: yi ge lam las gru bzhi pa kha dog ser po yi ge lam gyi sa bon gyis byin gyis brlab pa zur rnams su rdo rje rtse gsum pas mtshon pa'i dbus su yi ge aa las grub pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje ste yi ge aa yang de'i dbus
analyzed: yi ge lam las gru bzhi pa kha dog ser po yi ge lam gyi sa bon gyis byin gyis brlab pa zur rnams su rdo rje rtse gsum pas mtshon pa'i dbus su yi ge aa las grub pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje ste yi ge aa yang de'i dbus
translated: From the syllable laṃ, one should meditate on a square, yellow maṇḍala, blessed by the seed syllable laṃ, marked in the corners with three-tined vajras, in the center of which is a variegated vajra arisen from the syllable aṃ, and the syllable aṃ in its center.

original: na yod par bsams te dbus su khro bo'i dkyil 'khor bkod nas bsgrub bya'i steng du bsam par byas na thams cad rengs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na yod par bsams te dbus su khro bo'i dkyil 'khor bkod nas bsgrub bya'i steng du bsam par byas na thams cad rengs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having arranged the maṇḍala of wrathful ones in the center, if one visualizes it above the victim, all will be paralyzed.

analyzed: khro bo 'di dag thams cad kha dog ser por bsgom mo zhes gsungs pa rdo rje gsum mchog ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: One should meditate on all these wrathful ones as yellow.

original: rengs pa thams cad la rigs lnga po thams cad nyid kyi dkyil 'khor rnams ni dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor gyi sbyor bas khro bo'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa rnams su blta bar bya'o //

translated: In all the paralyzations, the maṇḍalas of all the five families should be seen in the form of the wrathful maṇḍala by the method of the maṇḍala of great power.

translated: Abiding in the center of the wrathful maṇḍala, one should imagine the syllable hūṃ in the form of a five-pronged vajra in the heart of the enemy.

original: yig gis phur pa bya'o //
analyzed: yig gis phur pa bya'o //
translated: Also in villages, towns, and so forth, one should make a kila with the syllable hūṃ, since all the hostile ones are struck down with the kila.

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa / grong ngam yang na grong khyer ram //
translated: For that very reason it is said:🔽“In a village or a town,

analyzed: ljongs rnams su ni rab tu sbyor //

original: spro ba zhes pa la sogs pa la rdo rje de las rin po che yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i 'od kyi rang bzhin rnams chos kyi sprin rnams sprul te chos kyi sprin de rnams kyis nad pa de la dgang bar bya ste h'um yig zlos shing ngo //
