translated: The sick person should be imagined as being filled with the light of the vajra flames.

original: de ltar na de la dbang bskur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de la dbang bskur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The sick person should be

original: yang na rdo rje de las sangs rgyas kyi sprin rnams sprul pa'am rdo rje sems dpa'i sprin de rnams kyis de na gnas pa'i nad pa la dgang bar yang bya'o //

translated: Or else, from that vajra, one should emit the cloud of Buddhas, or the cloud of Vajrasattvas, and they should fill the patient who is there.

original: de ltar na cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens if one does that?

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du yang gnas shing sangs rgyas kun gyis byin gyis rlob po //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du yang gnas shing sangs rgyas kun gyis byin gyis rlob po //
translated: One will remain for three incalculable aeons, and all the Buddhas will bless one.

original: lo'am lo brgya'am lo stong de srid du'ang gnas pa na zhi bar byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo'am lo brgya'am lo stong de srid du'ang gnas pa na zhi bar byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will remain for as long as one wishes, for a year, or a hundred years, or a thousand years, and one will be pacified.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du yang zhes pa brtan par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du yang zhes pa brtan par gsungs pa'o //
translated: One will remain for three incalculable aeons, it is said, for stability.

original: bsam gtan las byung ba sngar brjod ma thag pas zhi ba'i cho gas rtag tu sems can thams cad la zhi bar bsgoms pa'i yi dam ste gnas gang du yang dag par sbyor bas rnal 'byor pa la bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan las byung ba sngar brjod ma thag pas zhi ba'i cho gas rtag tu sems can thams cad la zhi bar bsgoms pa'i yi dam ste gnas gang du yang dag par sbyor bas rnal 'byor pa la bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the previously mentioned meditation, one should always meditate on pacification for all beings, with the vow of the rite of pacification. Wherever one applies oneself, the practitioner will be protected.

original: de na gnas pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis rlob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de na gnas pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis rlob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is there will be blessed by all the Tathagatas.

original: rdo rje bdud rtsi zhes pa la sogs pa la 'phags pa bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su de'i rnal 'byor gyis gnas nas de'i sngags kyis bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i khro bo phur par bsgoms te /
analyzed: rdo rje bdud rtsi zhes pa la sogs pa la 'phags pa bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su de'i rnal 'byor gyis gnas nas de'i sngags kyis bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i khro bo phur par bsgoms te /
translated: In the Vajra Amṛta and so forth, having remained in the center of the maṇḍala of Ārya Amṛtakuṇḍali through his yoga, one should meditate on the wrathful Kīlaya of Amṛtakuṇḍali through his mantra.

original: des phyogs bcu'i sdang ba rnams la gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: des phyogs bcu'i sdang ba rnams la gdab par bya'o //
translated: One should strike the enemies in the ten directions with that.

original: zhi ba la ni spyan gyi tshul //
analyzed: zhi ba la ni spyan gyi tshul //
translated: In the case of pacification, it is the manner of the eyes.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa mdor bstan pa bzhi po 'di rgyas par bshad pa bzhi go rims ji ltar gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa mdor bstan pa bzhi po 'di rgyas par bshad pa bzhi go rims ji ltar gsungs pa /
translated: These four brief explanations are the four extensive explanations, in the same order as they are taught.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus su bsam //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus su bsam //
translated: One should imagine in the middle of the realm of space.

original: zhi ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni bam las @107b byung ba'i chu dkar po bum pas mtshan pa'i zlum po de nyid dam pa yin te /
analyzed: zhi ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni bam las @107b byung ba'i chu dkar po bum pas mtshan pa'i zlum po de nyid dam pa yin te /
translated: The maṇḍala of pacification is the circle marked with a vase of white water arisen from vaṃ, which is itself supreme.

original: rnam par snang mdzad gzugs zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad gzugs zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Vairocana’s form and so forth.

original: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te ci skad brjod pa'i chu'i dkyil 'khor la rig pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi bdag nyid zhal gsum dang sku yang kha dog dkar po zhi ba'i nyams dang shin tu thugs rje dang ldan pa de dang 'dra ba'i dkyil
analyzed: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te ci skad brjod pa'i chu'i dkyil 'khor la rig pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi bdag nyid zhal gsum dang sku yang kha dog dkar po zhi ba'i nyams dang shin tu thugs rje dang ldan pa de dang 'dra ba'i dkyil
translated: One should say this: “On the circle of water as it is described, visualize the form of Vairocana with three faces and bodies, endowed with knowledge, white in color, with a peaceful expression, and full of compassion.

original: 'khor pas yongs su bskor bar bsams te ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar zla bar bsgrub bya spyan gyi sngags kyi phreng ba mgo gyen du bltas pa kha dog dkar po bdud rtsi 'dzag pa bsgrub bya'i lus la khyab par bkod de de'i shes pa yang nang du
analyzed: 'khor pas yongs su bskor bar bsams te ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar zla bar bsgrub bya spyan gyi sngags kyi phreng ba mgo gyen du bltas pa kha dog dkar po bdud rtsi 'dzag pa bsgrub bya'i lus la khyab par bkod de de'i shes pa yang nang du
translated: In the center of that, visualize a moon in the heart of the gnosis being, and on it the mantra garland of Locanā, facing upward, white in color, dripping nectar, and pervading the body of the person to be liberated.

original: bcug pa sngon du 'gro bas 'od zer gyi sgo las byung ba'i spyan la sogs pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: bcug pa sngon du 'gro bas 'od zer gyi sgo las byung ba'i spyan la sogs pa rnams kyis /
translated: Having first caused their consciousness to enter there, one should visualize light rays emanating from the eyes of Locanā and so forth,

original: nam mkha'i khams gang bar blta ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams gang bar blta ste /
translated: filling the realm of space.

original: sngags las byung pa'i 'od zer gyi lcags kyu rnams kyis de rnams bkug ste /
analyzed: sngags las byung pa'i 'od zer gyi lcags kyu rnams kyis de rnams bkug ste /
translated: With hooks of light rays emanating from the mantra, they are summoned.

original: bum pa'i dbang gi tshul gyis bsgrub bya'i lus po la bcug ste /
analyzed: bum pa'i dbang gi tshul gyis bsgrub bya'i lus po la bcug ste /
translated: Having entered the body of the one to be accomplished by the method of the vase empowerment,

analyzed: slar yang rtag pa rnams spros te de kho na ltar dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: again the permanent ones are emanated and the empowerment is conferred just like that.

original: rgyas la padma rdo rje can //
analyzed: rgyas la padma rdo rje can //
translated: For the increase, the lotus-vajra one.

original: zhes pa'i mdo gsal bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'i mdo gsal bar gsungs pa /
translated: The sutra clearly states:

original: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus gnas pa //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus gnas pa //
translated: In the center of the realm of space,

original: zhes pa la sogs te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs te /
translated: and so forth.

original: dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This has the characteristic of possessing the mandala of great earth.

original: de ni dge ba'i bzhon pa yin pa'i phyir dge ba'o //
analyzed: de ni dge ba'i bzhon pa yin pa'i phyir dge ba'o //
translated: That is virtuous because it is the mount of virtue.

original: chos 'dzin pa 'od dpag tu med pa ste rig ma dang bcas pa kha dog ser po rgyas pa yid yin te de dang 'dra ba'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba'i thugs kar don gnyer ro //
analyzed: chos 'dzin pa 'od dpag tu med pa ste rig ma dang bcas pa kha dog ser po rgyas pa yid yin te de dang 'dra ba'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba'i thugs kar don gnyer ro //
translated: The Dharma-holder Amitābha, together with the knowledge consort, is yellow in color, and the increase is the mind. The mandala that is similar to that is completely surrounded by the deities of the maṇḍala.🔽The one to be benefited is at the heart.

original: bshad ma thag pa bzhin du gos dkar mo'i sngags kyis bskor ba'o //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa bzhin du gos dkar mo'i sngags kyis bskor ba'o //
translated: As just explained, the one to be benefited is surrounded by the mantra of Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: gos dkar mo rnams kyis nam mkha' yongs su gang ste /
analyzed: gos dkar mo rnams kyis nam mkha' yongs su gang ste /
translated: The space is completely filled with the Pāṇḍaravāsinīs.

original: slar bsdus nas sngar bzhin du bsgrub bya'i lus la gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: slar bsdus nas sngar bzhin du bsgrub bya'i lus la gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Again, having gathered them, one should enter the body of the victim as before.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He himself says that:

original: 'dod pa de la dbab par bya //
analyzed: 'dod pa de la dbab par bya //
translated: “One should cause it to descend upon the desired one.”

original: zhes so // rang gi ba spu'i bug nas byung ba 'od dpag tu med pa'i tshogs spros te slar bsdus nas de kho na bzhin du dbang bskur ba'i mthar gzhug par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes so // rang gi ba spu'i bug nas byung ba 'od dpag tu med pa'i tshogs spros te slar bsdus nas de kho na bzhin du dbang bskur ba'i mthar gzhug par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having emanated a mass of Amitābha from one’s pores, one should again gather it and meditate on it entering just as before at the conclusion of the initiation.

original: 'dis zhes pa ni brjod ma thag pas so //
analyzed: 'dis zhes pa ni brjod ma thag pas so //
translated: “By this” refers to the immediately preceding [topic].

original: dbang la rnam par snang mdzad gnas //
analyzed: dbang la rnam par snang mdzad gnas //
translated: “Vairocana abides in the initiation.”

original: zhes pa spros te gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa spros te gsungs pa /
translated: Having emanated, he says:

original: nam mkha'i dbyings zhes pa la @108a * //🔽sogs pa'o // rdo rje zla gam dkyil 'khor la //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings zhes pa la @108a * // sogs pa'o // rdo rje zla gam dkyil 'khor la //
translated: “In the realm of space,” etc.

original: zhes pa ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor zla ba phyed kyi rnam pa dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid la dbang gi cho ga la dmar po brjod de /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor zla ba phyed kyi rnam pa dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid la dbang gi cho ga la dmar po brjod de /
translated: “In the maṇḍala of the vajra half-moon” has the characteristic of the air maṇḍala having the form of a half-moon. In the rite of the initiation, it is said to be red.

original: rdo rje nam mkha'i chos kyi mchog ni don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje nam mkha'i chos kyi mchog ni don yod grub pa'o //
translated: Vajra space is Amoghasiddhi.

original: 'dod pa zhes pa ni 'gro ba thams cad dbang du byed par 'dod pa'i gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes pa ni 'gro ba thams cad dbang du byed par 'dod pa'i gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: The word desire means the supplication to bring all beings under one's power.

original: sangs rgyas kyis zhes pa ni don yod grub pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis zhes pa ni don yod grub pa rnams kyis so //
translated: The word buddhas means Amoghasiddhis.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis zhes pa ni 'phags ma sgrol ma'i gzugs rnams kyis so //🔽don ni 'di yin te sngar brjod pa'i dkyil 'khor du gnas te kha dog dmar po'i don yod grub pa sems can thams cad la thugs rje chen po'i chags pas yang dag par zhen pa'i thugs shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid rang nyid de dang 'dra ba'i
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis zhes pa ni 'phags ma sgrol ma'i gzugs rnams kyis so // don ni 'di yin te sngar brjod pa'i dkyil 'khor du gnas te kha dog dmar po'i don yod grub pa sems can thams cad la thugs rje chen po'i chags pas yang dag par zhen pa'i thugs shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid rang nyid de dang 'dra ba'i
translated: The word bodhisattvas means the forms of the noble Tara.🔽 The meaning is this: Dwelling in the mandala described earlier, one should visualize oneself as red Amoghasiddhi, whose mind is fully attached to all sentient beings with the passion of great compassion, whose nature is that of wisdom and method, and who is surrounded by the retinue of the mandala, which is similar to oneself.

original: dkyil 'khor pas bsgoms te sngar bzhin don du gnyer ba 'phags ma sgrol ma'i phreng ba'i sngags kyis bskor bar blta ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor pas bsgoms te sngar bzhin don du gnyer ba 'phags ma sgrol ma'i phreng ba'i sngags kyis bskor bar blta ste /
translated: As before, one should visualize the object of desire, surrounded by the mantra garland of the noble Tara.

original: sngags las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi sgo las 'thon pa'i kha dog dmar po yang dag par zhen pa'i thugs kyi 'phags ma sgrol ma'i tshogs kyis nam mkha'i khams gang bar byas te /
analyzed: sngags las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi sgo las 'thon pa'i kha dog dmar po yang dag par zhen pa'i thugs kyi 'phags ma sgrol ma'i tshogs kyis nam mkha'i khams gang bar byas te /
translated: The assembly of Noble Tārās, red in color, perfectly attached to the door of light rays arisen from the mantra, fills the realm of space.

original: yang dag par bsdus nas de rnams kyis de la bum pa dmar po'i bdud rtsis dbang bskur nas 'dod chags kyi sems kyi mes bskul nas 'od zer lnga 'bar ba kha dog dmar po byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyun rnams kyis mngon par dbang bskur te zhu bar
analyzed: yang dag par bsdus nas de rnams kyis de la bum pa dmar po'i bdud rtsis dbang bskur nas 'dod chags kyi sems kyi mes bskul nas 'od zer lnga 'bar ba kha dog dmar po byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyun rnams kyis mngon par dbang bskur te zhu bar
translated: Having gathered perfectly, they confer the empowerment of the red vase elixir upon him, and having been urged by the fire of the mind of passion, they confer the empowerment with the blazing five light rays, the stream of bodhicitta, which is red in color.

original: gyur pa'i 'phags ma sgrol ma'i tshogs zhugs pas dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: gyur pa'i 'phags ma sgrol ma'i tshogs zhugs pas dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: The assembly of Noble Tārās, which has entered into the state of liquid, confers the empowerment.

original: de bzhin du rang gi ba spu'i bu ga las 'thon pa don yod grub pa'i tshogs kyis dbang bskur ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi ba spu'i bu ga las 'thon pa don yod grub pa'i tshogs kyis dbang bskur ba yang yin no //
translated: In the same way, the assembly of Amoghasiddhi, which has emerged from one’s pores, also confers the empowerment.

original: de ni zhes pa ni dbang don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes pa ni dbang don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: “That” refers to the one who seeks the empowerment.

original: de ma thag tu zhes pa ni sems brtan pa'i rnal 'byor pa bsgrub ma thag pa nyid du sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs su byon pa'o //
analyzed: de ma thag tu zhes pa ni sems brtan pa'i rnal 'byor pa bsgrub ma thag pa nyid du sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs su byon pa'o //
translated: Immediately means that the yogi who has stabilized the mind, immediately upon accomplishment, has entered the hearts of all the Buddhas.

original: 'jam pa ni mnyen pa ste nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gyong ba dang bral ba'i phyir dang ; / dpal ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi bdag nyid phun sum tshogs pa ste de dang 'dra ba'i lus so //
analyzed: 'jam pa ni mnyen pa ste nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gyong ba dang bral ba'i phyir dang ; / dpal ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi bdag nyid phun sum tshogs pa ste de dang 'dra ba'i lus so //
translated: Smooth means soft, because of being free from the roughness of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.  Splendor means the perfection of the nature of the accumulations of merit and wisdom, and the body is like that.

original: mthong ba tsam gyis 'gro ba thams cad dbang du byed pa'i las byed par dbang bskur ma thag nyid du 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mthong ba tsam gyis 'gro ba thams cad dbang du byed pa'i las byed par dbang bskur ma thag nyid du 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that by merely seeing it, one has the power to control all beings.  Immediately upon empowerment means that one becomes empowered to perform the action.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: 'gro ba thams cad dbang @108b du byed ;
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad dbang @108b du byed ;
translated: Controlling all beings,

original: / mthong ba tsam ni nyid kyis brjod //🔽ces so // rdo rje khro bo mngon spyod la //
analyzed: / mthong ba tsam ni nyid kyis brjod // ces so // rdo rje khro bo mngon spyod la //
translated: merely by seeing it, is said.

original: zhes mdor bstan pa'i rgyas par bshad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes mdor bstan pa'i rgyas par bshad pa gsungs pa /
translated: With regard to vajra wrathful activity, the extensive explanation of the brief indication is stated:

original: nam mkha' rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Space vajra and so forth.

original: khros shing mi sdug pa dang gtum pa 'jigs su rung ba'i khro bo gshin rje gshed la sogs pa dang / drag po ni snying rje med pa bzhin du sdang ba'i don byed pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: khros shing mi sdug pa dang gtum pa 'jigs su rung ba'i khro bo gshin rje gshed la sogs pa dang / drag po ni snying rje med pa bzhin du sdang ba'i don byed pa rnams kyis so //
translated: The fierce ones are those who act with hatred, like those without compassion.

original: ce spyang la sogs pa sha za ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i phyugs dang bya rnams kyis so //
analyzed: ce spyang la sogs pa sha za ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i phyugs dang bya rnams kyis so //
translated: The various animals and birds that eat meat, such as jackals and so forth,🔽are the ones who dwell in the triangular fire maṇḍala that arises from the karma of those who harm the Three Jewels and so forth.

original: me'i dkyil 'khor ram las byung ba 'bar zhing gsal ba'i rnam pa'i zur gsum po der gnas pa'i sdang ba rnams dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa rnams la gnod pa byed pa bla na med pa'i rang dang gzhan gyi don las nyams pa la zhugs pa rnams yin
analyzed: me'i dkyil 'khor ram las byung ba 'bar zhing gsal ba'i rnam pa'i zur gsum po der gnas pa'i sdang ba rnams dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa rnams la gnod pa byed pa bla na med pa'i rang dang gzhan gyi don las nyams pa la zhugs pa rnams yin
translated: They are engaged in the unsurpassed degeneration of their own and others’ aims.

original: pa de nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: pa de nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: Therefore,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la gnod pa byed pa rnams so zhes nges par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la gnod pa byed pa rnams so zhes nges par bya ste /
translated: it should be ascertained that they are the ones who harm all buddhas.

original: shes rab dang snying rje'i bdag nyid kyis sbyor ba'i thabs dang shes rab kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i ngo bo rab tu sbyar ba bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang snying rje'i bdag nyid kyis sbyor ba'i thabs dang shes rab kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i ngo bo rab tu sbyar ba bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate the application of the nature of wisdom and compassion, the essence of the union of method and wisdom.

original: cho ga 'di thams cad du bsam gtan las byung ba'i mngon spyod la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: cho ga 'di thams cad du bsam gtan las byung ba'i mngon spyod la blta bar bya'o //
translated: In all these rites, one should look to the rites of violence that arise from meditative concentration.

original: ji skad du brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji skad du brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: As it will be said:

original: ji skad brjod pa'i me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa khro bo gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor sngon du byas te /
analyzed: ji skad brjod pa'i me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa khro bo gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor sngon du byas te /
translated: Having performed the yoga of any wrathful deity abiding in the maṇḍala of fire as described,

original: de bzhin du bsgrub bya'i sdig pa bsags pa'i kha sbyar phye nas 'jigs shing brgyal ba mdun gyi me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa sgren mo skra grol ba mar nag gis byugs pa'i lus su dmigs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgrub bya'i sdig pa bsags pa'i kha sbyar phye nas 'jigs shing brgyal ba mdun gyi me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa sgren mo skra grol ba mar nag gis byugs pa'i lus su dmigs te /
translated: one should open the mouth of the victim’s accumulation of sins, and visualize him in front, terrified and fainting, naked, with loose hair, his body smeared with oil, abiding in the maṇḍala of fire.

original: rang gi ba spu'i bu ga las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi sgo las 'thon pa'i rdo rje srin po la sogs pa rnams kyis nam mkha'i khams gang nas mtshon cha sna tshogs pa thogs pa'i khro bo rnams kyis mnan zhing dum bur byas shing srin po la sogs
analyzed: rang gi ba spu'i bu ga las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi sgo las 'thon pa'i rdo rje srin po la sogs pa rnams kyis nam mkha'i khams gang nas mtshon cha sna tshogs pa thogs pa'i khro bo rnams kyis mnan zhing dum bur byas shing srin po la sogs
translated: One should meditate on the vajra raksasas and so on that emerge from the doors of light rays that arise from one's pores, filling the realm of space, trampling and pulverizing the wrathful ones who hold various weapons.

original: pa rnams kyis rgyu ma dang rkang la sogs pa phyung zhing zos pa bsgom par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: pa rnams kyis rgyu ma dang rkang la sogs pa phyung zhing zos pa bsgom par bya'o zhes so //
translated: One should meditate on the raksasas and so on pulling out and eating the entrails, legs and so on.

original: 'di yang snying rje dang shes rab la goms pa'i bdag nyid kyis gzhan gyi don du zhugs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' dang slar gyi bka' thob pas sems can thams cad mtho ris dang thar pa dag la snod ji lta ba bzhin du gzhag par 'dod pas
analyzed: 'di yang snying rje dang shes rab la goms pa'i bdag nyid kyis gzhan gyi don du zhugs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' dang slar gyi bka' thob pas sems can thams cad mtho ris dang thar pa dag la snod ji lta ba bzhin du gzhag par 'dod pas
translated: This is also for the benefit of others by one who is habituated to compassion and wisdom, who has entered the teachings of the Tathagata and received the oral instructions, who wishes to establish all sentient beings in the higher realms and liberation according to their individual vessels.

original: smon lam btab ste rnam pa thams cad du rang gi don la ltos pa med pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su gnang ba 'di le'u lnga pa la sogs @109a * //
analyzed: smon lam btab ste rnam pa thams cad du rang gi don la ltos pa med pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su gnang ba 'di le'u lnga pa la sogs @109a * //
translated: Having made this aspiration, he is completely indifferent to his own welfare.🔽

original: pa rnams su kho bo cag gis tshad ma dang lung gis nges par byas pas slar yang 'dir rgyas par mi byed do //
analyzed: pa rnams su kho bo cag gis tshad ma dang lung gis nges par byas pas slar yang 'dir rgyas par mi byed do //
translated: Having made this aspiration, and being completely indifferent to his own welfare, he received the permission of the Lord. We have established this with reasoning and scripture in the fifth chapter, etc., and so we will not elaborate on it here.

original: sangs rgyas zhes pa ni shin tu bar brjod pas 'di'i rnal 'byor gyi che ba nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes pa ni shin tu bar brjod pas 'di'i rnal 'byor gyi che ba nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: The word Buddha is used in the sense of one who has awakened, and so it expresses the greatness of his yoga.

original: da ni ting nge 'dzin gsum dang 'brel pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bdag po'i sku mdog dang phyag mtshan gyi des pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni ting nge 'dzin gsum dang 'brel pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bdag po'i sku mdog dang phyag mtshan gyi des pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, he states the colors and implements of the lords Vairochana, etc., which are related to the three samadhis.

original: zhal gsum ni thugs dang gsung dang sku ste /
analyzed: zhal gsum ni thugs dang gsung dang sku ste /
translated: The three faces are the mind, speech, and body,

original: chos dang longs spyod pa dang sprul pa'i sku stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: chos dang longs spyod pa dang sprul pa'i sku stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: which are the purities of the doors of liberation, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, which are the Dharma Body, Enjoyment Body, and Emanation Body.

original: ston ka'i 'dam bu'i mdog 'dra ba ni sku thams cad zla ba'i kha dog ste /
analyzed: ston ka'i 'dam bu'i mdog 'dra ba ni sku thams cad zla ba'i kha dog ste /
translated: The color of autumnal lotus is the color of the moon for all bodies.

original: dkar po nag po dmar chen po //
analyzed: dkar po nag po dmar chen po //
translated: White, black, and red

original: dbus dang g-yas dang cig shos so //
analyzed: dbus dang g-yas dang cig shos so //
translated: are the middle, right, and left faces.

original: rdo rje can ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje can ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The vajra-holder is Akshobhya.

original: nag po dmar po dkar po'i zhal //
analyzed: nag po dmar po dkar po'i zhal //
translated: Black, red, and white are the faces.

original: rtsa ba g-yon pa g-yas pa'i zhal //
analyzed: rtsa ba g-yon pa g-yas pa'i zhal //
translated: The root, left, and right faces🔽are the three bodies of the buddhas.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su 'di mnyam pa yin zhing chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa gang gi phyir chos yod pa ma yin par spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa de'i phyir rigs pas chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi thams cad du yin te shes rab🔽dang mnyam pa'i sems yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su 'di mnyam pa yin zhing chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa gang gi phyir chos yod pa ma yin par spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa de'i phyir rigs pas chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi thams cad du yin te shes rab dang mnyam pa'i sems yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The world-realms are equal in this, and apart from the dharma-dhātu, there are no dharmas. Therefore, in general, the nature of the dharma-dhātu is everywhere, because of the equality of wisdom and mind.

original: 'khrug pa bzhin du yang yin te snying rjes 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du phan pa bskyed pas 'khor ba las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrug pa bzhin du yang yin te snying rjes 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du phan pa bskyed pas 'khor ba las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also like a churning, because of the generation of benefit in all world-realms through compassion, in order to turn away from cyclic existence.

original: khyad par 'di yang snga ma dang phyi ma thams cad du yang ci ltar rigs par rtags la sogs pa yongs su bsgyur bar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: khyad par 'di yang snga ma dang phyi ma thams cad du yang ci ltar rigs par rtags la sogs pa yongs su bsgyur bar blta bar bya ste /
translated: This distinction should be understood as applicable to all the previous and subsequent [deities], and the signs [and so forth] should be transformed as appropriate.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'di dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'di dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all the Tathagatas are similar to this.

original: 'dod chags can ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags can ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The passionate one is Amitabha.

original: dmar po nag po dkar po'i zhal //
analyzed: dmar po nag po dkar po'i zhal //
translated: Red, black, and white faces.

original: rtsa ba g-yas dang cig shos zhal //
analyzed: rtsa ba g-yas dang cig shos zhal //
translated: The right and left faces of the principal one are similar to the principal face.

original: rtsa ba'i zhal dang 'dra bar thams cad du sku thams cad blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i zhal dang 'dra bar thams cad du sku thams cad blta bar bya'o //
translated: All the bodies should be seen in the same way as the principal one.

original: thor tshugs dbu rgyan longs spyod can //
analyzed: thor tshugs dbu rgyan longs spyod can //
translated: Wearing a crown of hair, and enjoying the crown of the Buddhas,

original: bsgoms na nges par 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: bsgoms na nges par 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: If meditated upon, will certainly be accomplished.

original: zhes pa ni thams cad du 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni thams cad du 'brel to //
translated: This is connected to everything.

original: 'khor lo rdo rje padma che //
analyzed: 'khor lo rdo rje padma che //
translated: The great wheel, vajra, and lotus,

original: g-yas pa'i phyag tu rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: g-yas pa'i phyag tu rnam par bsgom //
translated: Meditate on them in the right hands.

original: zhes pa ni rtsa ba'i phyag mtshan go rims ji lta bar ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rtsa ba'i phyag mtshan go rims ji lta bar ro //
translated: This is the root mudra, in the same order.

original: rdo rje phyag drug bsgom par bya //
analyzed: rdo rje phyag drug bsgom par bya //
translated: One should meditate on the six-armed Vajra.

original: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid rgyud 'dir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid rgyud 'dir ro //

original: mtshon @109b cha sna tshogs 'dzin pa ni //
analyzed: mtshon @109b cha sna tshogs 'dzin pa ni //

original: zhes pa ni man ngag ji lta bar kun du bzang po'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga'i rjes su 'brang ba rigs gsum gyi rnam par gzhag pa 'dir rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni man ngag ji lta bar kun du bzang po'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga'i rjes su 'brang ba rigs gsum gyi rnam par gzhag pa 'dir rgyas par bshad pa'o //

original: rigs lnga'i rnam par gzhag pa ni gsum pa ru spros pa rnams so //
analyzed: rigs lnga'i rnam par gzhag pa ni gsum pa ru spros pa rnams so //

original: sems can kun la phan bzhed dam //
analyzed: sems can kun la phan bzhed dam //

analyzed: zhes pa ni snga ma dang phyi mar yang rtags la sogs par rnam par bsgyur ba dang 'brel bar bya'o //

original: 'dis kyang theg pa gsum po yang dag par bsdus pa dpal gsang ba 'dus pa mthar thug pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bstan par thugs rje chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus pa gtso bo nyid du brjod pa yin no //

translated: This also expresses the supremacy of the perfection of wisdom, the great compassion, which is the ultimate teaching of all the Buddhas, the glorious Guhyasamaja, which perfectly includes the three vehicles.

original: shes rab pha rol phyin sbyor bas //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin sbyor bas //
translated: The union with the perfection of wisdom,

original: thabs dang snying rje'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: thabs dang snying rje'i bdag nyid do //

original: zhes dpal sangs rgyas thams cad las so //
analyzed: zhes dpal sangs rgyas thams cad las so //
translated: Thus it is from the Shri-sarva-buddha-tattva-samgraha.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab dang snying rje nyid goms pa sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa 'di la dbang ba yin no zhes lung las kyang grub po //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab dang snying rje nyid goms pa sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa 'di la dbang ba yin no zhes lung las kyang grub po //
translated: Therefore, the cultivation of wisdom and compassion is the power in this teaching of the Buddha.

original: dkar po nag po dmar chen po //
analyzed: dkar po nag po dmar chen po //

original: zhes pa ni rtag pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rtag pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: is like the eternal.

analyzed: nam mkha' rdo rje ni mi bskyod pa yin la spyan ni gtso mo ste de'i rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: rtag par zhes pa ni spyod lam bzhi ste thams cad blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtag par zhes pa ni spyod lam bzhi ste thams cad blta bar bya'o //

analyzed: langs pa dang ni 'dug pa dang // gtsang ba'am yang na mi gtsang bar //

original: rtag tu sgom par byed pa yang //
analyzed: rtag tu sgom par byed pa yang //

original: dngos grub rtogs par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: dngos grub rtogs par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: one will attain power.

original: gnag dang dmar dang dkar pa'i tshul ni rdo rje can bzhin no //
analyzed: gnag dang dmar dang dkar pa'i tshul ni rdo rje can bzhin no //

analyzed: gsung rdo rje'i spyan ni gos dkar mo ste dmar dang dkar dang gnag pa ni 'dod chags can bzhin no //
translated: The eye of vajra speech is Pāṇḍaravāsinī, red, white, and black, like the passionate one.

analyzed: rdo rje autpala ni ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin ser po de 'dzin pa ste / ser po nag po dkar po'i tshul //

original: rtsa ba g-yas dang g-yon gyi zhal //
analyzed: rtsa ba g-yas dang g-yon gyi zhal //
translated: The root face, the right face, and the left face are yellow, black, and white, respectively.

original: bsgoms na dngos po thams cad kyi de kho na nyid yul yin pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: bsgoms na dngos po thams cad kyi de kho na nyid yul yin pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //

analyzed: gshin rje gshed ni zhal gsum pa ste rdo rje can bzhin no //

original: khyad par yin no //

analyzed: rta mgrin ni padma mthar byed de zhal gsum ni 'dod chags can bzhin no //

analyzed: rdo rje mi 'chi ba ni bdud rtsi 'khyil pa ste zhal gsum ni rdo rje can bzhin no //

original: zhal gsum ni rdo rje can bzhin no //
analyzed: zhal gsum ni rdo rje can bzhin no //

translated: The Crown Victor and so forth are taught in the later tantra in the manner of mantra, and because of the nature of wisdom and compassion, the wheel-possessor is also the mandala-possessor, according to some.

analyzed: lhag ma'i phyag rang gi rigs kyi phyag mtshan dang zhal gsum phyag drug pa'o zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: The remaining hands hold their own family emblems, and have three faces and six arms.

analyzed: so so so sor dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po nyid kyis yin gyi dkyil 'khor pa ma yin pa nyid yin te /
translated: Each one is the lord of the mandala, and not a member of the mandala.

original: 'di rnams mtha' med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di rnams mtha' med pa nyid yin te /
translated: These are infinite.

original: 'di rnams mtha' med pa nyid du rgyas par bshad pas te gsal por gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di rnams mtha' med pa nyid du rgyas par bshad pas te gsal por gsungs pa /
translated: They are explained in detail as infinite, and are clearly stated.

original: dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba ni rgyud 'dir dkyil 'khor pa rnams nges pa yin la rgyud gzhan rnams su ni dkyil 'khor ba'i bdag po nges pa yin te grangs su bcad pa'i phyir /

translated: The incalculable means that in this tantra the members of the mandala are definite, and in other tantras the lord of the mandala is definite, because they are enumerated.

original: nam mkha'i steng du shin tu mang /
analyzed: nam mkha'i steng du shin tu mang /
translated: They are very numerous in the sky.

original: zhes khyad par du byas te shin tu khyad par can du 'gyur ro //🔽don gzhan la ni brten nas su //🔽don de nyid ni bzlas pa yin //
analyzed: zhes khyad par du byas te shin tu khyad par can du 'gyur ro // don gzhan la ni brten nas su // don de nyid ni bzlas pa yin //
