original: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis bstan pa'i don yang bstan pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis bstan pa'i don yang bstan pa gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning of the verse The meaning of the tantra is not taught in the tantra itself, but is explained in dependence on another meaning is stated.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings ni chos dbyings yin par thams cad du man ngag las yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings ni chos dbyings yin par thams cad du man ngag las yin no //
translated: The realm of space is the dharma realm, as is taught everywhere in the esoteric instructions.

original: gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni gsum par bshad zin to //
analyzed: gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni gsum par bshad zin to //
translated: The “clear maṇḍala” was explained in the third [chapter].

original: sangs rgyas ni rdo rje 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni rdo rje 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: The Buddha is the vajra holder.

original: de yongs su gyur pa'i dngos po yin pas ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa'i dngos po yin pas ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi'o //
translated: Since he is the transformed entity, he is the nature of all meditative stabilizations.

original: gsal ba ste thams cad rang rig pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba ste thams cad rang rig pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is clear, because everything is the essence of reflexive awareness.

original: zla ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni gsum par nges par byas so //
analyzed: zla ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni gsum par nges par byas so //
translated: “Like the moon” is ascertained in the third [chapter].

original: zhi ba ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa'i bslad pa bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyis spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa'i bslad pa bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyis spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is peaceful, because he has abandoned all afflictive obstructions and obstructions to omniscience, together with their predispositions.

original: me long bzhin du chos thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan skye ba'i rten yin pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
analyzed: me long bzhin du chos thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan skye ba'i rten yin pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
translated: He is the mirror-like pristine awareness, the nature of omniscient pristine awareness, because he is the support for the arising of the reflections of all phenomena, like a mirror.

original: de nyid kyi phyir @111a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir @111a * //
translated: For that very reason,

original: khams gsum gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: the maṇḍala of the three realms.

original: 'di thams cad kyi dbang du byas pa yin te ci ltar rigs par ro //
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyi dbang du byas pa yin te ci ltar rigs par ro //
translated: All of this is to be understood as appropriate.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' ni 'dir mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' ni 'dir mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Vajrasattva here is Akṣobhya.

original: 'di gsal ba'i lus kyang yin la 'dra bar byed pas na 'dra ba yang yin zhing khro ba yang yin te zhe sdang rnam par dag pa ste ;
analyzed: 'di gsal ba'i lus kyang yin la 'dra bar byed pas na 'dra ba yang yin zhing khro ba yang yin te zhe sdang rnam par dag pa ste ;
translated: He is also a likeness, because he makes likenesses, and he is wrathful, because he is the purification of hatred,

original: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa rnams la snying rje chen po'i khro bas so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa rnams la snying rje chen po'i khro bas so //
translated: with the wrath of great compassion toward the afflictions of all sentient beings.

original: rdo rje mi bskyod pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje mi bskyod pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: He is the greatness of Akṣobhya.

original: chos kyi sems dpa' ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sems dpa' ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: Dharmasattva is Amitābha.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa 'di'i dbang du byas pa ni 'phags ma sgrol ma la thug pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa 'di'i dbang du byas pa ni 'phags ma sgrol ma la thug pa'o //
translated: This is to be understood as referring to the maṇḍala of the moon up to the noble Tārā.

original: rdo rje dkyil 'khor ni mi bskyod pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: rdo rje dkyil 'khor ni mi bskyod pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The vajra maṇḍala is the maṇḍala of Akṣobhya.

original: nam mkha' rdo rje mchog ni nam mkha' sgyu ma'i mchog ste m'a ma k'i'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' rdo rje mchog ni nam mkha' sgyu ma'i mchog ste m'a ma k'i'o //
translated: The supreme of the vajra of space is the supreme of the illusion of space, i.e., Māmakī.

original: autpala sngo dmar zhes pa la sngon po ni zhe sdang rnam par dag pa yin la dmar po ni kha dog go //
analyzed: autpala sngo dmar zhes pa la sngon po ni zhe sdang rnam par dag pa yin la dmar po ni kha dog go //
translated: The blue-red lotus is blue, which is the purity of hatred, and red, which is the color.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The wheel of Dharma is the mandala of Amitābha.

original: rdo rje chos ni gos dkar mo'o //
analyzed: rdo rje chos ni gos dkar mo'o //
translated: Vajradharma is Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: padma r'a ga zla 'dra ba ni kha dog dang mdzes pas kyang yin te go rims bzhin du yin no //
analyzed: padma r'a ga zla 'dra ba ni kha dog dang mdzes pas kyang yin te go rims bzhin du yin no //
translated: The red lotus like the moon is both the color and the beauty, respectively.

original: thugs rje chen po'i 'dod chags kyis chags pa'i thugs 'dzin pa'i phyir 'dod chags 'dzin pa ste 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po'i 'dod chags kyis chags pa'i thugs 'dzin pa'i phyir 'dod chags 'dzin pa ste 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The holder of passion is Amitābha, because he holds the mind of passion with great compassion.

original: de'i sdug pa ni de'i rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sdug pa ni de'i rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: His beloved is red, because it is of his type.

original: autpala dmar po ni kha dog dmar po dang chos mthun pas dmar po ste padma'o //
analyzed: autpala dmar po ni kha dog dmar po dang chos mthun pas dmar po ste padma'o //
translated: The red lotus is red, because it is similar in color to the red lotus.

original: thams cad sgra ji bzhin par bzung na ni ral gri dang gtun shing dang dgra stva dang zhags pa'i phyag dang zhal bzhi pa dang phyag bzhi pa dang zhabs drug pa la sogs pa gshin rje gshed la sogs pa yin pas dpal gsang ba 'dus par yang ye
analyzed: thams cad sgra ji bzhin par bzung na ni ral gri dang gtun shing dang dgra stva dang zhags pa'i phyag dang zhal bzhi pa dang phyag bzhi pa dang zhabs drug pa la sogs pa gshin rje gshed la sogs pa yin pas dpal gsang ba 'dus par yang ye
translated: If one takes everything literally, then one would have to accept that Yamantaka and so on are literally so, with swords, pestles, enemies, hooks, four faces, four arms, six legs and so on.

original: shes zhabs kyi yang lugs la mi 'tsham pa shin tu mang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes zhabs kyi yang lugs la mi 'tsham pa shin tu mang por 'gyur ro //
translated: And in the glorious Guhyasamaja, there would be many things that would be unsuitable in the system of Jnanapada.

original: sgra ni ji bzhin dpyod pa na //
analyzed: sgra ni ji bzhin dpyod pa na //
translated: If one analyzes the words literally,

original: sgrib pa zhes rgyal ba byams pas brjod pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa zhes rgyal ba byams pas brjod pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one would contradict what the Victor Maitreya said in the Sutralamkara:

original: rgyun ma chad cing gnod pa med pa'i gzhung nyid sgra'i don du nges pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyun ma chad cing gnod pa med pa'i gzhung nyid sgra'i don du nges pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the words is ascertained by the text itself, which is uninterrupted and nonerroneous.

original: de las gzhan du srid pa'i phyir the tshom ni sgra tsam las mi ldog go //
analyzed: de las gzhan du srid pa'i phyir the tshom ni sgra tsam las mi ldog go //
translated: Since it is possible for it to be otherwise, doubt does not arise from mere words.

original: gang rnam 'grel las /
analyzed: gang rnam 'grel las /
translated: As it says in the Pramanavarttika:

original: gzhan du mi srid med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan du mi srid med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is not impossible that it is otherwise,

original: nus pa sna tshogs rang gi sgra //
analyzed: nus pa sna tshogs rang gi sgra //
translated: The various potencies of the words

original: nges par byed pa ma mthong la //
analyzed: nges par byed pa ma mthong la //
translated: Are not seen to be determinative.

original: the tshom nges par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: the tshom nges par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: and doubt is resolved.

original: 'dis ni 'dam las skyes pas 'dam skyes te //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dam las skyes pas 'dam skyes te //
translated: The lotus is called utpala because it is born in a swamp.

original: autpala yin zhes @111b gsal lo //
analyzed: autpala yin zhes @111b gsal lo //
translated: The word utpala is explained.

original: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan tsam yod pas don la 'jug pa ma yin la 'on kyang grags pa'i dbang gis yin te /
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan tsam yod pas don la 'jug pa ma yin la 'on kyang grags pa'i dbang gis yin te /
translated: The word is applied not because the reason for the application exists, but rather by convention.

original: 'gro bas na ba lang zhes pa la sogs pa la 'gro ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa nyid kyis bram ze la sogs pa rnams la yang btags pa ma yin par ba lang gi sgra 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro bas na ba lang zhes pa la sogs pa la 'gro ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa nyid kyis bram ze la sogs pa rnams la yang btags pa ma yin par ba lang gi sgra 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word cow is applied to the cow because of the reason for the application, going, and so on, and it is not a designation for brahmins and so on, because it would follow that the word cow would be applied to them.

original: grub pa ni don yod par grub pa de'i dkyil 'khor ro //🔽kha dog ser po yang yin la mdangs kyang yin pas mdangs so //
analyzed: grub pa ni don yod par grub pa de'i dkyil 'khor ro // kha dog ser po yang yin la mdangs kyang yin pas mdangs so //
translated: The circle of the sun is established as having a purpose.🔽It is yellow and radiant, thus it is yellow radiance.

original: ser po yang kha dog gis yin la mdangs kyang yin pas mdangs so //
analyzed: ser po yang kha dog gis yin la mdangs kyang yin pas mdangs so //
translated: It is yellow by color and radiant by nature, thus it is yellow radiance.

original: de bzhin du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: lha mo 'di rnams nges pa'i phyag mtshan ni //
analyzed: lha mo 'di rnams nges pa'i phyag mtshan ni //
translated: The goddesses have the following definite hand emblems.

original: 'khor lo bzang dang autpala dmar po dang // padma autpala gser mdog rim bzhin bsam //
analyzed: 'khor lo bzang dang autpala dmar po dang // padma autpala gser mdog rim bzhin bsam //
translated: The excellent wheel, the red lotus, the lotus, the golden utpala, respectively.

original: lhag ma rnams ni ji bzhin 'dod par 'dod //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni ji bzhin 'dod par 'dod //
translated: The rest are as desired, just as they are desired.

original: sangs rgyas gzugs ni bsgom byas nas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzugs ni bsgom byas nas //
translated: Having meditated on the form of the Buddha,

original: zhes pa ni rang gi sa bon du yongs su gyur pa'i dus na nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la ji ltar rigs par bsam par bya zhes pa ni thams cad du 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang gi sa bon du yongs su gyur pa'i dus na nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la ji ltar rigs par bsam par bya zhes pa ni thams cad du 'brel to //
translated: This is to be contemplated on the sun mandala, etc., at the time of complete transformation into one's own seed, as appropriate. This is connected everywhere.

original: phyag na ral gri ni gang gi gsum pa na yod pa de yin no //
analyzed: phyag na ral gri ni gang gi gsum pa na yod pa de yin no //
translated: The sword in the hand is the one that exists in the third [hand].

original: dam tshig ni 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam tshig ni 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The pledge is because it should not be transgressed.

original: de bzhin du thams cad du ci ltar srid par ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad du ci ltar srid par ro //
translated: Similarly, everywhere, as is possible.

original: gzhan gyis mi thub pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi thub pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis so //
translated: Unsurpassable means by adverse factors.

original: sbrul gyis brgyan cing ske rags can //
analyzed: sbrul gyis brgyan cing ske rags can //
translated: Adorned with snakes, with a belt,

original: zhes pa ni mtshon pa ste khro bo mi sdug pa thams cad kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mtshon pa ste khro bo mi sdug pa thams cad kyi khyad par ro //
translated: This is an indication. All the distinctions of the wrathful ones are ugly.

original: gyes pa ni gdangs pa'i zhal te gdong mi sdug pa dang mche ba 'khyog pa dang zhal 'jigs su rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gyes pa ni gdangs pa'i zhal te gdong mi sdug pa dang mche ba 'khyog pa dang zhal 'jigs su rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The dispersal is the face of the one who is radiant, because of the ugly face, the curved fangs, and the terrifying face.

original: 'di dag kyang de rnams nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang de rnams nyid kyi'o //
translated: These are also of those.

original: rta mgrin zhes pa ni padma mthar byed kyi ming gzhan no //
analyzed: rta mgrin zhes pa ni padma mthar byed kyi ming gzhan no //
translated: The one called Hayagrīva is another name for Padmanarteśvara.

original: rgyud 'dir ni thams cad zhal gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud 'dir ni thams cad zhal gsum pa'o //
translated: In this Tantra, all are three-faced.

original: gdug pa thams cad kyi gnas ni 'dug sa ste /
analyzed: gdug pa thams cad kyi gnas ni 'dug sa ste /
translated: The place of all the wicked is the abode.

original: de mnan pa de dang de gang gis bsal ba de'o //
analyzed: de mnan pa de dang de gang gis bsal ba de'o //
translated: The one who suppresses that and that is he who removes that.

original: sku dmar po ni lus thams cad dang rtsa ba'i zhal lo //
analyzed: sku dmar po ni lus thams cad dang rtsa ba'i zhal lo //
translated: The red body is the entire body and the principal face.

original: dpag med ni sangs rgyas 'od dpag tu med pa'o ;
analyzed: dpag med ni sangs rgyas 'od dpag tu med pa'o ;
translated: The boundless is the Buddha Amitābha.

original: / rdo rje mi 'chi ba ni bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'o zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: / rdo rje mi 'chi ba ni bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'o zhes bshad zin to //
translated: The vajra immortality is Amṛtakuṇḍali, as has been explained.

original: kun du 'khrugs shing khros zhes pa yang ngo //
analyzed: kun du 'khrugs shing khros zhes pa yang ngo //
translated: The angry is the one who is angry and agitated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir khros shing mche ba rnon po yang yin pa ni 'jigs su rung ba'i khro bo thams cad kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir khros shing mche ba rnon po yang yin pa ni 'jigs su rung ba'i khro bo thams cad kyi khyad par ro //
translated: For that very reason, he is also the sharp-fanged one who is angry, the special one among all the terrifying angry ones.

original: 'dod pa sems pa khros pa ni //
analyzed: 'dod pa sems pa khros pa ni //
translated: The one who is angry, thinking of passion,🔽is the one who is angry, thinking of passion.

original: 'jigs su rung @112a * //
analyzed: 'jigs su rung @112a * //
translated: Terrifying.🔽🔽

original: ba'i sku mchog ste //
analyzed: ba'i sku mchog ste //
translated: The most terrifying form,

original: rgyan rnams thams cad yongs su rdzogs //
analyzed: rgyan rnams thams cad yongs su rdzogs //
translated: with all ornaments complete.

original: zhes pa ni rol pa'i khro bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rol pa'i khro bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he is the wrathful one of play.

original: stobs po che zhags pa 'dzin pa ni las kyi tshogs nyid la'o //
analyzed: stobs po che zhags pa 'dzin pa ni las kyi tshogs nyid la'o //
translated: The great powerful one who holds the noose is in the assembly of deeds.

original: rdo rje sngon po ni dbyig pa sngon po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sngon po ni dbyig pa sngon po'o //
translated: The blue vajra is the blue club.

original: 'di gnag pa yang yin la sku thams cad dang rtsa ba'i zhal gyis so //
analyzed: 'di gnag pa yang yin la sku thams cad dang rtsa ba'i zhal gyis so //
translated: He is dark because of all the bodies and the principal face.

original: rgya mtsho yang yin te thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir dang yon tan ma lus pa'i rten yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: rgya mtsho yang yin te thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir dang yon tan ma lus pa'i rten yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: He is the ocean because he is difficult to fathom by those who are not omniscient and because he is the basis of all good qualities.

original: 'phel bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'phel bar byed pa ni /
translated: The one who increases

original: sems can ma lus pa'i rgyud kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams so //
analyzed: sems can ma lus pa'i rgyud kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams so //
translated: is the roots of virtue in the mindstreams of all sentient beings.

original: gzugs nag po 'dzin pa ni de'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba rjes su bzung ba'i phyir yin gyi rang bzhin gyis gnag pa ni ma yin te bcom ldan 'das thams cad dkar po'i chos kyi rang bzhin chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs nag po 'dzin pa ni de'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba rjes su bzung ba'i phyir yin gyi rang bzhin gyis gnag pa ni ma yin te bcom ldan 'das thams cad dkar po'i chos kyi rang bzhin chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The form of the black one is for the sake of those to be disciplined by that form. It is not naturally black, because the Blessed One is the nature of the realm of phenomena, which is the nature of all good qualities.

original: mi g-yo ba'i mchog khros shing 'jigs pa zhes pa ni phyir 'thon pa'i cung zad mche ba gtsigs pa 'jigs su rung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i mchog khros shing 'jigs pa zhes pa ni phyir 'thon pa'i cung zad mche ba gtsigs pa 'jigs su rung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The supreme immovable one is angry and frightening because he has a slightly bared fang that emerges, which is terrifying.

original: 'di yang rol pa'i khro bo yin te rdo rje mi g-yo ba bzhi pa zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yang rol pa'i khro bo yin te rdo rje mi g-yo ba bzhi pa zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This one is also a wrathful one for play, because he is called the fourth immovable vajra.

original: zhags pa 'dzin cing 'khrugs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhags pa 'dzin cing 'khrugs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: Holding a noose and agitated has been explained.

original: rig pa'i 'khor lo ni gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rig pa'i 'khor lo ni gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba yin no //
translated: The wheel of knowledge is the uṣṇīṣa cakravartin.

original: mtshan rnams thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa ni rol pa'i khro bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan rnams thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa ni rol pa'i khro bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having all the marks completely perfect is because he is a wrathful one for play.

original: 'khor lo 'bar bas yongs su bskor ba ni phyi rol gyi nyi ma'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'khor lo 'bar bas yongs su bskor ba ni phyi rol gyi nyi ma'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The blazing wheel that completely surrounds it is the outer orb of the sun's light.

original: rdo rje gnod mdzes kyi phyag na rdo rje yin pa ni de rtsa ba'i phyag mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje gnod mdzes kyi phyag na rdo rje yin pa ni de rtsa ba'i phyag mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Vajra-Bhairava's hand is Vajrapani, because that is his root emblem.

original: bsgoms na dngos grub kyi mchog sangs rgyas kyi mtshan nyid dang thun mong ba yang mi snang ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo ci ltar mngon sbyor thob par 'gyur zhes pa ni thams cad dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: bsgoms na dngos grub kyi mchog sangs rgyas kyi mtshan nyid dang thun mong ba yang mi snang ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo ci ltar mngon sbyor thob par 'gyur zhes pa ni thams cad dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: If one meditates on the supreme attainment, which is the nature of the Buddha, how does one attain the accomplishment of invisibility, etc.? This is connected to everything.

original: 'gog pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la bya'o //
translated: Cessation is to be understood as all adverse factors.

original: ci byas pas she na /
analyzed: ci byas pas she na /
translated: By what is it done?

original: khro bo'i 'khor lo ste srung ba'i 'khor lo'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: khro bo'i 'khor lo ste srung ba'i 'khor lo'i ngo bos so //
translated: By the wheel of wrath, by the nature of the protection wheel.

original: byed pa po gang gang gis sangs rgyas rdo rje bsten pa ni ting nge 'dzin gsum dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas so //
analyzed: byed pa po gang gang gis sangs rgyas rdo rje bsten pa ni ting nge 'dzin gsum dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas so //
translated: The agent is one who relies on the Buddha Vajra, a yogi endowed with the three samadhis.

original: 'dis ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does this happen?

original: gsungs pa / ting nge 'dzin rdo rje ye shes can 'grub ces so //
analyzed: gsungs pa / ting nge 'dzin rdo rje ye shes can 'grub ces so //
translated: It is said: “One achieves the vajra-gnosis samādhi.”

original: ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: gsungs pa / rdo rje dkyil 'khor rnams zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: gsungs pa / rdo rje dkyil 'khor rnams zhes kha cig go //
translated: It is said: “The vajra maṇḍalas.”

original: cis she na /
analyzed: cis she na /
translated: What is it by?

original: gsungs pa / rdo rje dkyil 'khor las zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: gsungs pa / rdo rje dkyil 'khor las zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: It is said: “From the vajra maṇḍala.”

original: rdo rje'i @112b dam tshig gi de kho na nyid bsgoms pas mngon par byang chub pa de ston par byed pa'i gzhung yongs su gcod pa'i le'u'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i @112b dam tshig gi de kho na nyid bsgoms pas mngon par byang chub pa de ston par byed pa'i gzhung yongs su gcod pa'i le'u'o //
translated: The chapter that completely cuts off the text that teaches the manifest enlightenment by meditating on the reality of the vajra commitments.

original: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyan las le'u bcu gsum pa'o /
analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyan las le'u bcu gsum pa'o /
translated: The thirteenth chapter of the Śrī Guhyasamāja Ornament.

original: // / de nas zhes pa la zhi ba la sogs pa'i cho ga gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / de nas zhes pa la zhi ba la sogs pa'i cho ga gsungs pa /
translated: Then, the ritual of pacification, etc. is taught.

original: de la bya ba gzhan ci bya zhes pa la sogs pa gdul bya'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su shes pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: de la bya ba gzhan ci bya zhes pa la sogs pa gdul bya'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su shes pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: There, after the complete understanding of the concepts of the disciples, “What other action should be done?” and so forth.

original: drag po la sogs pa'i dngos grub la bar du gcod pa bsal ba'i don du zhi ba la sogs pa'i sngags rnams sngar brjod pa'i lha la sogs pa rnams kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: drag po la sogs pa'i dngos grub la bar du gcod pa bsal ba'i don du zhi ba la sogs pa'i sngags rnams sngar brjod pa'i lha la sogs pa rnams kyis gsungs so //
translated: For the sake of removing obstacles to the powers of Rudra and so on, the mantras of pacification and so on are taught by the previously mentioned gods and so on.

original: drag po la sogs pa zhi bar byed pa'i dam tshig 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pas bcom ldan 'das ma spyan no //
analyzed: drag po la sogs pa zhi bar byed pa'i dam tshig 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pas bcom ldan 'das ma spyan no //
translated: Since the commitments of pacifying Rudra and so on are not to be transgressed, the Bhagavatī is Locanā.

original: de nyid mchog gang du dmigs pa yin pa de ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid mchog gang du dmigs pa yin pa de ni de bzhin no //
translated: That very one is just so, in which the supreme is visualized.

original: 'byor pa kun la dgyes pa rnams ni sems can thams cad kyi phun sum tshogs par bzhed pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: 'byor pa kun la dgyes pa rnams ni sems can thams cad kyi phun sum tshogs par bzhed pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas are those who delight in all prosperity, who wish for the excellence of all sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas rdo rje ni rnam par snang mdzad rdo rje can gyi ngo bor gsal ba rjes su dran te des sems can gyi khams bde bar byas pa de'i tshe gzigs te dgyes la dbang du yang byas te mnyes pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdo rje ni rnam par snang mdzad rdo rje can gyi ngo bor gsal ba rjes su dran te des sems can gyi khams bde bar byas pa de'i tshe gzigs te dgyes la dbang du yang byas te mnyes pa'o //
translated: The Buddha Vajra is Vairocana, who is the essence of the vajra holder. He is remembered, and by him, when the realm of sentient beings is made happy, then he sees, delights, and also brings them under his control, and they are pleased.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyang zhes pa ni /
translated: The Buddhas also

original: shin tu bar brjod do zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: shin tu bar brjod do zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say, It is said to be very much so.

original: drag po sgrub pa'i dus su'o zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: drag po sgrub pa'i dus su'o zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: Others say, At the time of accomplishing Rudra.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi gang zhi ba ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas par spangs pa'i mtshan nyed yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi gang zhi ba ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas par spangs pa'i mtshan nyed yin te /
translated: The peace of the buddhas is characterized by the abandonment of afflictive and knowledge obscurations along with their imprints.

original: de skyed par byed pa ni snod ji lta bar sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la dngos su'o //
analyzed: de skyed par byed pa ni snod ji lta bar sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la dngos su'o //
translated: It is generated directly in the mindstreams of all sentient beings, just like a vessel.

original: las thams cad la yang phul du byung bas sgrub pa ni kha dog dang nyams la sogs pa'i dbye bas so ;
analyzed: las thams cad la yang phul du byung bas sgrub pa ni kha dog dang nyams la sogs pa'i dbye bas so ;
translated: It is accomplished as the best in all activities, by the divisions of color, experience, and so on.

original: /'chi ba sos par byed ces pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: /'chi ba sos par byed ces pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the line, “It revives the dead,” is as follows.

original: spyan gyi rnal 'byor pas ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i sa bon gyi lcags kyus bar ma ba do'i srid pa'i bdag nyid dam mngal du chud pa dri ma med pa bskyod pa med pa mi g-yo ba gnyug ma'i mar me'i rtse mo'i rgyun dang 'dra ba'i rnam
analyzed: spyan gyi rnal 'byor pas ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i sa bon gyi lcags kyus bar ma ba do'i srid pa'i bdag nyid dam mngal du chud pa dri ma med pa bskyod pa med pa mi g-yo ba gnyug ma'i mar me'i rtse mo'i rgyun dang 'dra ba'i rnam
translated: The yogin of the eye, with the hook of the seed syllable in the heart of the gnosis being, moves the stainless being of the intermediate state, who is like the continuous flame of a lamp, into the womb.

original: par shes pa bkug ste /
analyzed: par shes pa bkug ste /
translated: Having summoned the consciousness,

original: shi ba de'i snying gar bcug la de la lam gyi sa bon bsgoms nas de'i 'od zer rnams kyis de'i lus po rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: shi ba de'i snying gar bcug la de la lam gyi sa bon bsgoms nas de'i 'od zer rnams kyis de'i lus po rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar bya ste /
translated: one should place it in the heart of the dead person, and having meditated on the seed of the path, one should visualize that the body of the dead person is naturally radiant with light rays.

original: grub pa'i dngul chus zangs gser du byas pa bzhin du /
analyzed: grub pa'i dngul chus zangs gser du byas pa bzhin du /
translated: Just like copper is made into gold by the elixir of the alchemists,

original: spyan gyi rnam par yongs su gyur par bltas la mig la @113a * //
analyzed: spyan gyi rnam par yongs su gyur par bltas la mig la @113a * //
translated: one should visualize the transformation into the form of the eye.

original: sogs pa byin gyis brlab par byas te /
analyzed: sogs pa byin gyis brlab par byas te /
translated: One should bless the eyes, etc.

original: rang gi ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i sa bon gyi 'od zer las byung ba spyan gyi tshogs kyis bum pa'i bdud rtsi dang byang chub kyi sems dang bdag nyid zhugs pas dbang bskur bas dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i sa bon gyi 'od zer las byung ba spyan gyi tshogs kyis bum pa'i bdud rtsi dang byang chub kyi sems dang bdag nyid zhugs pas dbang bskur bas dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: One should confer initiation by the assembly of eyes arisen from the light rays of the seed in the heart of one's gnosis being, having entered the nectar and bodhicitta of the vase, and having been initiated by oneself.

original: de ltar shi ba de sos shing rdo rje'i sku yang thob par 'gyur te thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa la bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir grub pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i byin gyis brlab pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar shi ba de sos shing rdo rje'i sku yang thob par 'gyur te thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa la bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir grub pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i byin gyis brlab pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the dead person is revived and also attains the vajra body, because of the inconceivable power of the blessing of the accomplished yogi, since he is not omniscient.

original: rdo rje dam tshig bskul mdzad ma ni de kho na nyid skul bar byed pa'i glus te /
analyzed: rdo rje dam tshig bskul mdzad ma ni de kho na nyid skul bar byed pa'i glus te /
translated: The vajra pledge inciter is the song that incites reality.

original: dbang du byas pa yang 'phags ma sgrol ma la thug pa'o //
analyzed: dbang du byas pa yang 'phags ma sgrol ma la thug pa'o //
translated: The subjugation is also related to the noble Tara.

original: de nas zhes pa ni m'a ma k'i'i sngags kyis gdul bya yongs su smin par chod pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa ni m'a ma k'i'i sngags kyis gdul bya yongs su smin par chod pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: Then, after the mantra of Mamaki has ripened the disciples,

original: de bzhin du de dang de'i sngags brjod pa la sogs pa'i gdul bya yongs su smin par shes pa'i rjes la ste thams cad la de nas kyi sgra dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de dang de'i sngags brjod pa la sogs pa'i gdul bya yongs su smin par shes pa'i rjes la ste thams cad la de nas kyi sgra dpyad par bya'o //
translated: similarly, after the mantra recitation, etc. of each has ripened the disciples, one should analyze the word then in all cases.

original: sku gsum gyi dam tshig khro bo ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsum gyi dam tshig khro bo ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The pledge of the three bodies is Akshobhya.

original: dngos po rnams ni gzung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin la dngos po med pa ni nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa dang bral ba'i ye shes yongs su grub pa'i bdag nyid do zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni gzung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin la dngos po med pa ni nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa dang bral ba'i ye shes yongs su grub pa'i bdag nyid do zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say that things are the nature of the apprehended object, etc. and nonthings are the nature of the perfect pristine consciousness free from afflictions and traces.

original: dngos po ni sems can gyi don ma lus pa sgrub pa'i bsam pa snying rje chen po'i thabs so//🔽dngos po med pa ni brtags pa med par dmigs pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: dngos po ni sems can gyi don ma lus pa sgrub pa'i bsam pa snying rje chen po'i thabs so// dngos po med pa ni brtags pa med par dmigs pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: The entity is the means of great compassion, the intention to accomplish the complete benefit of sentient beings.🔽The non-entity is the wisdom that observes without conceptualization.

original: gang zhig dngos med shes rab ste //
analyzed: gang zhig dngos med shes rab ste //
translated: The non-entity is wisdom,

original: thabs ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: thabs ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the means is the characteristic of the entity.

original: zhes rgyud phyi ma las so //
analyzed: zhes rgyud phyi ma las so //
translated: Thus it is in the Later Tantra.

original: de dag gi dam tshig srid pa dang zhi ba mnyam par ro gcig pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo m'a ma k'i'o //
analyzed: de dag gi dam tshig srid pa dang zhi ba mnyam par ro gcig pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo m'a ma k'i'o //
translated: Their pledge is the essence of non-abiding nirvana, the single taste of existence and peace, Mamaki.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa ni 'dir mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa ni 'dir mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Vajra Holder here is Akshobhya.

original: sku gsum dbyer med rdo rje can //
analyzed: sku gsum dbyer med rdo rje can //
translated: The indivisible three bodies are the vajra holder.

original: zhes pa ni zhe sdang gi rigs can rnams so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni zhe sdang gi rigs can rnams so //
translated: This is for those of the angry type.

original: rdo rje srung ba'i sbyor ba la //
analyzed: rdo rje srung ba'i sbyor ba la //
translated: In the application of vajra protection,

original: zhes pa ni rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor gyi ro langs la sogs pa bsgrub pa rnams la de'i sngags las byung ba'i rdo rje 'bar ba zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa rang gi mgo bo la bsams te m'a ma k'i de'i lte ba'i nang na gnas par
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor gyi ro langs la sogs pa bsgrub pa rnams la de'i sngags las byung ba'i rdo rje 'bar ba zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa rang gi mgo bo la bsams te m'a ma k'i de'i lte ba'i nang na gnas par
translated: This is for those who practice the zombie rite of one's deity yoga, etc. One should imagine the blazing vajra arisen from its mantra, located on a moon-disk, on one's head, and Mamaki in its center.

original: bya'o // de lta na ma nyams pa'i bsrung bar 'gyur ro //🔽las rnams rtag tu rab sgrub pa //
analyzed: bya'o // de lta na ma nyams pa'i bsrung bar 'gyur ro // las rnams rtag tu rab sgrub pa //
translated: In this way, one's protection will be unbroken.

original: zhes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rab tu sgrub par yang 'gyur te spyan bzhin no //🔽rdo rje chen po 'jigs @113b nyen la ;
analyzed: zhes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rab tu sgrub par yang 'gyur te spyan bzhin no // rdo rje chen po 'jigs @113b nyen la ;
translated: One always accomplishes the rites means that one also accomplishes the rites of pacification, etc., just like the eyes.

original: / zhes pa ni mtshams med pa la sogs pa'i las byas pas sems shin tu ngan song gi 'jigs pa sems 'khrugs pa rnams so //
analyzed: / zhes pa ni mtshams med pa la sogs pa'i las byas pas sems shin tu ngan song gi 'jigs pa sems 'khrugs pa rnams so //
translated: The great vajra is for those who are frightened, means that those whose minds are disturbed by the fear of the lower realms due to having committed the heinous crimes, etc.,

original: stobs byed pa ni m'a ma k'i'i rnal 'byor gyis ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi sngags bzlas pa sngon du song bas chos thams cad stong pa nyid do zhes mngon du byas te bdag nyid de'i rnam par bsgoms pas ngan song gi 'jigs pas nyen pa sel🔽bar byed do //
analyzed: stobs byed pa ni m'a ma k'i'i rnal 'byor gyis ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi sngags bzlas pa sngon du song bas chos thams cad stong pa nyid do zhes mngon du byas te bdag nyid de'i rnam par bsgoms pas ngan song gi 'jigs pas nyen pa sel bar byed do //
translated: The power-wielder, having previously recited his mantra with the yoga of Mamaki, as prescribed, actualizes all phenomena as emptiness, and by meditating on himself in that aspect, he dispels the danger of the lower realms.

original: 'dod chags chen po ni 'dir 'od dpag tu med pa yin la gang gi dam tshig tu byed pa gos dkar mor grags pa de gzigs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gang gis yul du byas pa de la de skad ces brjod do ;
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po ni 'dir 'od dpag tu med pa yin la gang gi dam tshig tu byed pa gos dkar mor grags pa de gzigs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gang gis yul du byas pa de la de skad ces brjod do ;
translated: Great passion is Amitabha here, and the one who makes his pledge, known as Pandaravasini, is the object of his gaze. The samadhi by which he makes her his object is called by that name.

original: / rdo rje chos mchog 'dzin pa rnams //
analyzed: / rdo rje chos mchog 'dzin pa rnams //
translated: Those who hold the supreme vajra dharma

original: zhes pa ni 'dod chags kyi rigs can rnams so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dod chags kyi rigs can rnams so //
translated: are those of the passion family.

original: chos rgyas stobs zhes pa ni ma 'dres pa'i chos la sogs pa rnams rgyas pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la gsal bar snang ba yin la stobs kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis ma nyams pa'i nus pa yin te rtag tu ni rgyun rtag pas so //
analyzed: chos rgyas stobs zhes pa ni ma 'dres pa'i chos la sogs pa rnams rgyas pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la gsal bar snang ba yin la stobs kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis ma nyams pa'i nus pa yin te rtag tu ni rgyun rtag pas so //
translated: The “great power of the Dharma” is the manifestation in the continuum of the yogin of the unshared qualities and so forth, and “power” is the capacity of not being damaged by opposing factors. “ Always” means by a continuous stream.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das ma 'dis sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams kyi mdzod chen po dang ldan pa de'i byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das ma 'dis sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams kyi mdzod chen po dang ldan pa de'i byed do //
translated: Because this Bhagavatī possesses the great treasure of the qualities of a Buddha, she is the doer of that.

original: bzlas pa tsam gyis zhes pa la tsam smos pas phyag rgya 'ching ba la sogs pa rnam par bcad pa'i ched du yin gyi bsgom pa rnam par dpyad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bzlas pa tsam gyis zhes pa la tsam smos pas phyag rgya 'ching ba la sogs pa rnam par bcad pa'i ched du yin gyi bsgom pa rnam par dpyad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: “ Merely by reciting” — by mentioning “merely,” the purpose is to eliminate the binding of the consort and so forth, but it is not to eliminate meditation.

original: de nyid 'bras bu thob pa la gtso bo'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid 'bras bu thob pa la gtso bo'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the principal cause of attaining the result.

original: rtag tu ni 'khor ba ji srid par mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu ni 'khor ba ji srid par mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Always” means that it is a phenomenon of not passing into nirvāṇa for as long as saṃsāra exists.

original: ji ltar gsungs pa rdo rje'i tshig mi slu ba de bzhin du 'di nyams su blangs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gsungs pa rdo rje'i tshig mi slu ba de bzhin du 'di nyams su blangs pa'o //
translated: Just as the vajra words spoken by him are infallible, so is the practice of this.

original: kun nas 'byung ba ni sems can ma lus pa'i don byed pa de la de skad du yin te /
analyzed: kun nas 'byung ba ni sems can ma lus pa'i don byed pa de la de skad du yin te /
translated: The origin of all is so called because of the performance of the aim of all sentient beings.

original: don yod rdo rje'o //
analyzed: don yod rdo rje'o //
translated: It is Amoghasiddhi.

original: de nyid sgrol mar grags pa rdo rje gang la yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid sgrol mar grags pa rdo rje gang la yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: He who has that vajra which is known as Tārā is just so.

original: sangs rgyas kun bdag che las skyes pa ni dam tshig gi rigs can rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun bdag che las skyes pa ni dam tshig gi rigs can rnams so //
translated: Born from the great lord of all buddhas is one who has the family of the commitments.

original: rdo rje'i sku zhes pa ni don yod rdo rje'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i sku zhes pa ni don yod rdo rje'o //
translated: The vajra body is Amoghasiddhi.

original: thams cad bran bzhin byed ces pa ni rang gis sgrol ma'i rnal 'byor mngon sum du byas te de yang kha dog dmar po'i na bza' dang rgyan gyis brgyan pa bsgrub bya mdun du mngon sum du byas pa sngon du song bas snying gar padma dmar po'i 'dab
analyzed: thams cad bran bzhin byed ces pa ni rang gis sgrol ma'i rnal 'byor mngon sum du byas te de yang kha dog dmar po'i na bza' dang rgyan gyis brgyan pa bsgrub bya mdun du mngon sum du byas pa sngon du song bas snying gar padma dmar po'i 'dab
translated: All act like servants is the direct perception of the yoga of Tārā by oneself, and having also accomplished the one to be liberated in front, adorned with red-colored clothing and ornaments, having gone in front, the red lotus at the heart

original: ma rnams la skyes pa rnams kyi yin zhing de bzhin du padma dmar po'i ze'u 'bru rnams la bud med rnams @114a * //
analyzed: ma rnams la skyes pa rnams kyi yin zhing de bzhin du padma dmar po'i ze'u 'bru rnams la bud med rnams @114a * //
translated: The women are on the anthers of the red lotuses.

original: la bud med rnams kyi yin te rang gi sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i mda' dmar po rnams kyis bskul zhing sngags brjod de yang nas yang du bsnun nas bran du bya'o //
analyzed: la bud med rnams kyi yin te rang gi sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i mda' dmar po rnams kyis bskul zhing sngags brjod de yang nas yang du bsnun nas bran du bya'o //
translated: With red arrows consecrated with one's mantra, one should repeatedly strike and enchant them, and make them one's servants.

original: dri ma med pa'i 'od zer gyi sprin bkod pa gshin rje gshed gang gis de nyid kyi rdo rje gang la yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i 'od zer gyi sprin bkod pa gshin rje gshed gang gis de nyid kyi rdo rje gang la yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: The array of clouds of stainless light-rays of Yamantaka, by which one's vajra is just that.

original: 'jigs shing yid skrag pa zhes pa ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams skrag pa skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'jigs shing yid skrag pa zhes pa ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams skrag pa skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: Frightened and terrified means generating fear in childish ordinary beings.

original: 'di zhes pa ni rang gi sngags yang dag par bstan pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes pa ni rang gi sngags yang dag par bstan pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This means possessing the perfect teaching of one's mantra.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang 'jug par 'gyur ba la brten nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste so so'i skye bo nyid du dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang 'jug par 'gyur ba la brten nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste so so'i skye bo nyid du dgongs pa ste /
translated: The one who is a Tathāgata by means of the yoga of the Tathāgata is the Tathāgata, i.e., the ordinary man.

original: de rnams skrag pa nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams skrag pa nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the intention.

original: khro bo'i sngags 'bum bzlas pa byas te ji skad brjod pa'i cho gas thod pa la bsgrub bya'i ming dang lhan cig pa yang dag par bris te rkang pa g-yon pas mnan te ming dang spel ba'i cho gas rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug ste sngags🔽bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: khro bo'i sngags 'bum bzlas pa byas te ji skad brjod pa'i cho gas thod pa la bsgrub bya'i ming dang lhan cig pa yang dag par bris te rkang pa g-yon pas mnan te ming dang spel ba'i cho gas rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug ste sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having recited the mantra of the wrathful one one hundred thousand times, one should write the name of the victim together with the name on a skull, trample it with one’s left foot, and recite the mantra with the name added in the middle of one’s maṇḍala.

original: bsgrub bya yang rdo rje rlung gi dkyil 'khor la zhon pa zhags pas kyang bkug pa ste dgug pa thams cad kyi sbyor ba la bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya yang rdo rje rlung gi dkyil 'khor la zhon pa zhags pas kyang bkug pa ste dgug pa thams cad kyi sbyor ba la bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The victim should be imagined riding on a vajra wind maṇḍala, and also drawn by a noose, in all the rites of summoning.

original: dam tshig nyid 'od zer rnams te de rnams kyis stug po ni tshogs yin la de nyid gang du mchog yin pa de ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: dam tshig nyid 'od zer rnams te de rnams kyis stug po ni tshogs yin la de nyid gang du mchog yin pa de ni de bzhin no //
translated: The commitments are the light rays, and the mass of them is the dense array, and that itself is supreme.

original: bdud rtsi'i bdag nyid khro bo ni bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i bdag nyid khro bo ni bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'o //
translated: The wrathful one who is the nature of nectar is Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: sngags rnams kun gyi sbyor rnams la //
analyzed: sngags rnams kun gyi sbyor rnams la //
translated: In all the rites of the mantras,

original: zhes pa ni lha thams cad kyi las kyi tshogs sna tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnams la bcom ldan 'das nyid sbyar bar bya ste bya ba ma lus par rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lha thams cad kyi las kyi tshogs sna tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnams la bcom ldan 'das nyid sbyar bar bya ste bya ba ma lus par rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the Blessed One himself should be applied to all the characteristics of the various collections of rites of all the deities, because he perfects all activities.

original: khyad par du yang 'di ni rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par du yang 'di ni rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In particular, this is the vajra, etc.

original: cho ga yis zhes pa ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du rdo rje rnga mo'i rgyab tu zhon pa sgren mo skra grol ba rdo rje khro bo'i rigs kyis skrag pa sdang pa lho phyogs su 'gro ba blta'o //
analyzed: cho ga yis zhes pa ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du rdo rje rnga mo'i rgyab tu zhon pa sgren mo skra grol ba rdo rje khro bo'i rigs kyis skrag pa sdang pa lho phyogs su 'gro ba blta'o //
translated: By the rite, one should visualize the wind mandala, and on top of that, Vajravārāhī, naked, with loose hair, frightened by the wrathful vajra family, angry, going to the south.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rnam pa'i 'od zer rnams nyid rdo rje ste gang la de yod pa de bzhin no ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rnam pa'i 'od zer rnams nyid rdo rje ste gang la de yod pa de bzhin no ;
translated: The light rays of the form of the Buddha are themselves the vajra, and he who has that is so called.

original: / cho ga bzhin du zhes te gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i khro bo'i rnal 'byor sgrub pa chen po'i bar du bya ba ste rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyis sa gzhi dang ra ba dang gur dang phyogs dang mtshams bcing bar byas te /
analyzed: / cho ga bzhin du zhes te gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i khro bo'i rnal 'byor sgrub pa chen po'i bar du bya ba ste rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyis sa gzhi dang ra ba dang gur dang phyogs dang mtshams bcing bar byas te /
translated: According to the rite, one should perform the yoga of the invincible wrathful one up to the great attainment, and having made the ground, the enclosure, the canopy, and the binding of the directions and subdirections with the nature of the vajra,

original: bsgrub bya'i bsrung ba spel ba dang bcas par sngags bzlas te rdo rje thugs rab tu sbyor bar bya'o//
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i bsrung ba spel ba dang bcas par sngags bzlas te rdo rje thugs rab tu sbyor bar bya'o//
translated: one should recite the mantra with the increase of the protection of the one to be protected, and one should apply the vajra mind.

original: @114b dpag tu med pa ni 'od dpag med de gang las byung ba rta mgrin gang yin pa de nyid rdo rje ste gang la de yod pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: @114b dpag tu med pa ni 'od dpag med de gang las byung ba rta mgrin gang yin pa de nyid rdo rje ste gang la de yod pa de de bzhin no //
translated: Amitābha is immeasurable light, and he from whom it arises is Hayagrīva, and he who has that is so called.

original: chos kyi rdo rje che mchog skyes //
analyzed: chos kyi rdo rje che mchog skyes //
translated: The supreme great Dharma vajra is born.

original: zhes pa ni 'dod chags kyi rigs can rnams so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dod chags kyi rigs can rnams so //
translated: This is for those of the family of passion.

original: ha la ha la'i 'od ni shin tu drag po'o //
analyzed: ha la ha la'i 'od ni shin tu drag po'o //
translated: The light of Hālāhala is extremely fierce.

original: khro bo'i rgyal pos bskul ba yis //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal pos bskul ba yis //
translated: Urged on by the king of wrathful ones,

original: zhes pa la ci lta ba bzhin du 'phags pa rta mgrin gyi sbyor ba dang ldan pas bsgrub bya'i snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'bar ba bskal pa'i me dang 'dra ba de'i steng du yi ge h'um bkod de de'i 'od zer rnams kyis lus thams cad la
analyzed: zhes pa la ci lta ba bzhin du 'phags pa rta mgrin gyi sbyor ba dang ldan pas bsgrub bya'i snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'bar ba bskal pa'i me dang 'dra ba de'i steng du yi ge h'um bkod de de'i 'od zer rnams kyis lus thams cad la
translated: Upon that, he should visualize the syllable hum, and with the light rays from that, the poison in the entire body of the victim🔽is burned. Then, he should visualize an eight-petaled white lotus arising from the syllable pi on his right hand, and in the center of that, the syllable ham, white in color, radiating white light rays, dripping nectar.

original: gnas pa'i dug bsregs nas lag pa g-yas par yi ge pi las byung ba'i padma dkar po 'dab ma brgyad pa bsgoms te de'i lte bar yi ge ham kha dog dkar po'i 'od zer dkar por gsal ba bdud rtsi 'dzag pa rnam par bsam zhing phreng ba'i sngags
analyzed: gnas pa'i dug bsregs nas lag pa g-yas par yi ge pi las byung ba'i padma dkar po 'dab ma brgyad pa bsgoms te de'i lte bar yi ge ham kha dog dkar po'i 'od zer dkar por gsal ba bdud rtsi 'dzag pa rnam par bsam zhing phreng ba'i sngags
translated: He should recite the mantra garland

original: bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: bzlas par bya ste /
translated: as stated.

original: nges bya bas pa na bsgrub bya la dug med par 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: nges bya bas pa na bsgrub bya la dug med par 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
translated: By this, the victim will become free of poison.

original: gang las byung ba ni sems can ma lus pa'i don te de de bzhin te /
analyzed: gang las byung ba ni sems can ma lus pa'i don te de de bzhin te /
translated: The source is the welfare of all sentient beings.🔽He is just like that.

original: de nyid rdo rje tog gang la yod pa de de yin te de ltar ro //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje tog gang la yod pa de de yin te de ltar ro //
translated: He who has that vajra crest is just like that.

original: brgyad brgya ni brgya rtsa brgyad do //
analyzed: brgyad brgya ni brgya rtsa brgyad do //
translated: Eight hundred is eight hundred times.

original: cho ga 'khor lo'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: cho ga 'khor lo'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the application of the wheel rite,

original: zhes pa ni dbyig pa sngon po'i sbyor ba ci lta bar nga rgyal dang bcas pas sngags brjod na gdug pa rnams ni gsod par 'gyur zhes pa ni 'chang par 'gyur ba'i cho gas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dbyig pa sngon po'i sbyor ba ci lta bar nga rgyal dang bcas pas sngags brjod na gdug pa rnams ni gsod par 'gyur zhes pa ni 'chang par 'gyur ba'i cho gas so //
translated: If one recites the mantra with pride, as in the application of the blue staff, the wicked will be killed. This is the rite of wearing.

original: bzlas pa tsam gyis sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: bzlas pa tsam gyis sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the application of mere recitation,

original: las rnams thams cad sgrub par byed //🔽ces so // yang na sngags pas khro bo thams cad kyi //
analyzed: las rnams thams cad sgrub par byed // ces so // yang na sngags pas khro bo thams cad kyi //
translated: one accomplishes all activities.🔽Or, the mantra practitioner,

original: sngags ni 'bum du bzlas nas ni //
analyzed: sngags ni 'bum du bzlas nas ni //
translated: having recited the mantra of all wrathful ones a hundred thousand times,

original: las rnams thams cad byed par bshad //
analyzed: las rnams thams cad byed par bshad //
translated: is said to perform all activities.

original: ces te 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis mtshan ma thob pa than pa byung ba'i dus su de'i rnal 'byor byas te sngags bzlas pa na chu'i tshogs dbab par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces te 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis mtshan ma thob pa than pa byung ba'i dus su de'i rnal 'byor byas te sngags bzlas pa na chu'i tshogs dbab par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Having attained the signs by the method to be explained, when the practitioner of that performs the yoga and recites the mantra at the time of drought, a mass of water will descend. This is the meaning.

original: kun nas bgegs rnams 'joms pa de nyid rdo rje ste gang la yod pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: kun nas bgegs rnams 'joms pa de nyid rdo rje ste gang la yod pa de bzhin no //
translated: That which completely conquers obstacles is the vajra, and that which has it is so.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the yoga of Vajrasattva.

original: zhes pa ni 'phags pa 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i sbyor ba ci lta ba dang ldan pas bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan byas te dgug pa sngon du song bas 'bar ba'i lcags kyus byin gyis brlabs pa'i rkang pa g-yas pas g-yon brkyang gis mnan te sngags bzlas pas rdo rje
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'phags pa 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i sbyor ba ci lta ba dang ldan pas bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan byas te dgug pa sngon du song bas 'bar ba'i lcags kyus byin gyis brlabs pa'i rkang pa g-yas pas g-yon brkyang gis mnan te sngags bzlas pas rdo rje
translated: One should make an effigy of the victim, and having previously summoned him, one should recite the mantra while trampling on him with one's right foot, which is blessed as a blazing vajra hook, in the manner of possessing the yoga of noble Kama raja.

original: lcags kyus dgug par bya'o //🔽ye shes ni dngos @115a * //
analyzed: lcags kyus dgug par bya'o // ye shes ni dngos @115a * //
translated: One should summon him with the vajra hook.

original: po mtha' dag gi de kho na nyid yul yin pa'i phreng rgyud yod pa ste de nyid chu yin pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma 'khru ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: po mtha' dag gi de kho na nyid yul yin pa'i phreng rgyud yod pa ste de nyid chu yin pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma 'khru ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Wisdom is the garland of existence, whose object is the thatness of all things. It is water, because it washes away the stains of passion, etc.

original: de nyid sangs rgyas rdo rje gang la yod pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid sangs rgyas rdo rje gang la yod pa de bzhin no //
translated: That is the vajra buddha, who has it.

original: kha sbyar lus kyis 'gugs par 'gyur //
analyzed: kha sbyar lus kyis 'gugs par 'gyur //
translated: One should summon with the body union.

original: zhes pa ni ci lta ba bzhin du 'phags pa mi g-yo ba'i rnal 'byor pas mi'i thod pa srub med pa mtshan nyid dang ldan pa blangs te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni ci lta ba bzhin du 'phags pa mi g-yo ba'i rnal 'byor pas mi'i thod pa srub med pa mtshan nyid dang ldan pa blangs te /
translated: The yogin of Akṣobhya should take a skull of a human being, without a crack, and endowed with the characteristics.

original: rkang pa g-yas pa'i mdzub mo'i khrag dang tsha ba'i mar nag dang ske tshe la sogs pa rnams kyis lha chen po la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan rang gi lha mo dang ldan pa yang dag par bris te dgug pa sngon du song bas sngar bzhin du rdo rje'i
analyzed: rkang pa g-yas pa'i mdzub mo'i khrag dang tsha ba'i mar nag dang ske tshe la sogs pa rnams kyis lha chen po la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan rang gi lha mo dang ldan pa yang dag par bris te dgug pa sngon du song bas sngar bzhin du rdo rje'i
translated: With blood from the toe of his right foot, and with black mustard oil, and so on, he should draw the image of Maheśvara, together with his goddess, and having summoned them, as before, he should bless the vajra

original: lcags kyus byin gyis brlabs te rkang pa g-yas pas mnan nas des lcags kyus dgug par bsams te /
analyzed: lcags kyus byin gyis brlabs te rkang pa g-yas pas mnan nas des lcags kyus dgug par bsams te /
translated: with the vajra hook, and stepping on it with his right foot, he should imagine that he summons with the hook.

original: skul ba dang lhan cig pas nges par dgug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skul ba dang lhan cig pas nges par dgug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Together with the invocation, he will certainly summon them.

original: dam tshig ni rgyu ste khro bo rnams kyi phal cher mi bskyod pa yin te /🔽khro bo zhe sdang gnas las skyes ;
analyzed: dam tshig ni rgyu ste khro bo rnams kyi phal cher mi bskyod pa yin te / khro bo zhe sdang gnas las skyes ;
translated: The cause is the pledge, and the wrathful ones are mostly Akṣobhya,

original: / zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, “The wrathful one is born from the abode of hatred.”

original: de'i rnam par 'phrul ba ni dpal gnod mdzes su grags te rdo rje gang la yod pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam par 'phrul ba ni dpal gnod mdzes su grags te rdo rje gang la yod pa de de bzhin no //
translated: His emanation is known as glorious Ucchuṣma, and he is the vajra in whom it exists.

original: bu mo zhes pa thams cad ni lha'i bu mo la sogs pa rnams yin te 'dod chags kyis tshim pa'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir skra bshig gos dang bral ba'o ;
analyzed: bu mo zhes pa thams cad ni lha'i bu mo la sogs pa rnams yin te 'dod chags kyis tshim pa'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir skra bshig gos dang bral ba'o ;
translated: The “girls” are all the celestial maidens, etc., because they are under the control of others, satisfied by passion, with disheveled hair and naked.

original: / de bzhin gshegs pa kun yang yin te dkyil 'khor du'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin gshegs pa kun yang yin te dkyil 'khor du'o //
translated: And they are all the tathāgatas, in the maṇḍala.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du bcom ldan 'das gnod mdzes rgyal po de nyid rdo rje sems dpa' yang yin la gnas kyang yin te phun sum tshogs pa ma lus pa'i gnas yin la des mnan pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du bcom ldan 'das gnod mdzes rgyal po de nyid rdo rje sems dpa' yang yin la gnas kyang yin te phun sum tshogs pa ma lus pa'i gnas yin la des mnan pa'o //
translated: Just as the Blessed Ucchuṣma King is Vajrasattva and the abode, the place of all perfections, he is the one who tramples them.

original: ci lta ba bzhin du bud med kyi thod pa rkang pa g-yon pas mnan te snying gar rdo rje lcags kyus phug ste mgrin pa zhags pas bcings na rdo rje'i bu mor nges par 'gyur te 'di'i dbang du byas pa ni ci ltar rigs par ro //
analyzed: ci lta ba bzhin du bud med kyi thod pa rkang pa g-yon pas mnan te snying gar rdo rje lcags kyus phug ste mgrin pa zhags pas bcings na rdo rje'i bu mor nges par 'gyur te 'di'i dbang du byas pa ni ci ltar rigs par ro //
translated: As it is, one should press down on the skull of a woman with one's left foot, and with a vajra hook at the heart, and bind her neck with a noose, and she will certainly become a vajra girl.

original: 'phags pa gnod mdzes kyi sbyor ba ci lta ba dang ldan pas mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i bud med kyi thod pa la lha'i bu mo la sogs pa gang yang rung ba rkang pa g-yon pa'i srin lag gi khrag gis bris te de las byung ba'i rdo rje
analyzed: 'phags pa gnod mdzes kyi sbyor ba ci lta ba dang ldan pas mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i bud med kyi thod pa la lha'i bu mo la sogs pa gang yang rung ba rkang pa g-yon pa'i srin lag gi khrag gis bris te de las byung ba'i rdo rje
translated: As it is, one should write with the blood of the left ring finger of a woman who has the characteristics, any one of a celestial maiden and so on, on the skull of a woman who has the characteristics, and with the application of Noble Ucchusma, and with that one should bless a vajra hook.

original: lcags kyus byin gyis brlabs pa'i rkang pa g-yon pas mnan nas lag pa g-yas pa na gnas pa'i lcags kyus snying gar phug ste zhags pas ske nas bcings te bskul tshig dang ldan pas sngags @115b bzlas pas dgug par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lcags kyus byin gyis brlabs pa'i rkang pa g-yon pas mnan nas lag pa g-yas pa na gnas pa'i lcags kyus snying gar phug ste zhags pas ske nas bcings te bskul tshig dang ldan pas sngags @115b bzlas pas dgug par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: One should press down with the left foot, and with a hook that is in the right hand, one should pierce the heart, and bind the neck with a noose, and one should summon with the mantra, which has the words of entreaty.

original: dam tshig chen po'i de kho na nyid ni byang chub kyi sems te des bskyed pa ni dgug pa'i las grub pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po'i de kho na nyid ni byang chub kyi sems te des bskyed pa ni dgug pa'i las grub pa'o //
translated: The reality of the great commitment is the thought of enlightenment, and that which is generated by it is the accomplishment of the act of summoning.

original: de byang chub kyi sems bsgoms pa brtan par byas pas khams gsum pa 'di dag ni sems tsam mo zhes shes par byas pas dgug la grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de byang chub kyi sems bsgoms pa brtan par byas pas khams gsum pa 'di dag ni sems tsam mo zhes shes par byas pas dgug la grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By means of the firm cultivation of that thought of enlightenment, one should know that these three realms are mind only, and thus summon them, and so accomplish.

original: dam tshig chen po ni bshad zin te de las phyung pa ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba rdo rje gsum gyi gsang ba'o //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po ni bshad zin te de las phyung pa ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba rdo rje gsum gyi gsang ba'o //
translated: The great commitment has been explained, and that which is brought forth from it is the secret of body, speech, and mind, the secret of the three vajras.

original: ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: gsung gi dam tshig ni sngags yin te de'i de kho na nyid de nyid gnas te dgug pa'i sbyor pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsung gi dam tshig ni sngags yin te de'i de kho na nyid de nyid gnas te dgug pa'i sbyor pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The commitment of speech is the mantra, and that is its reality. It is the abode, and the meaning is that it is the yoga of summoning.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rdo rje rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi rdo rje rnams te de rnams ni sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rnams yin zhing sku gsum po rnams yin te de rnams la rdo rje sems dpa' bsgom pa ni gnod mdzes bsgom pa ste de
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rdo rje rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi rdo rje rnams te de rnams ni sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rnams yin zhing sku gsum po rnams yin te de rnams la rdo rje sems dpa' bsgom pa ni gnod mdzes bsgom pa ste de
translated: The meditation on Vajrasattva is the meditation on Sumbha.

original: dgug pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis gnod mdzes bsgom par bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dgug pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis gnod mdzes bsgom par bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should meditate on Sumbha for the purpose of summoning.

original: ci ltar na gnod mdzes kyi sbyor bas sangs rgyas thams cad 'gugs she na /
analyzed: ci ltar na gnod mdzes kyi sbyor bas sangs rgyas thams cad 'gugs she na /
translated: How is it that all the Buddhas are summoned by the application of Sumbha?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / zhags pa rdo rje kyo ba 'dzin //
analyzed: gsungs pa / zhags pa rdo rje kyo ba 'dzin //
translated: The noose, the vajra, and the hook,

original: gnod mdzes rgyal po'i sprul pa rnams kyis zhags pa dang lcags kyus gnod mdzes kyi rnal 'byor pas sangs rgyas thams cad dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: gnod mdzes rgyal po'i sprul pa rnams kyis zhags pa dang lcags kyus gnod mdzes kyi rnal 'byor pas sangs rgyas thams cad dgug par bya'o //
translated: The emanations of King Sumbha, with the noose and the hook, the yogin of Sumbha should summon all the Buddhas.

original: da ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi rnal 'byor gyis dgug pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi rnal 'byor gyis dgug pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the summoning by the yoga of the Great Vajradhara, etc., is stated.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi sbyor ba rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i rnal 'byor gyis so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi sbyor ba rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i rnal 'byor gyis so //
translated: By the yoga of the Great Vajra Holder, with the application of the body, speech, and mind of the Buddha.

original: 'khor lo chen po rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i dkyil 'khor gyi sbyor ba las so //
analyzed: 'khor lo chen po rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i dkyil 'khor gyi sbyor ba las so //
translated: From the application of the mandala of the Great Vajra Holder of the Great Wheel.

original: 'khor lo padma rdo rje che //
analyzed: 'khor lo padma rdo rje che //
translated: The wheel, the lotus, and the great vajra.

original: zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas lag par 'khor lo'i lcags kyus bsams nas de dang de'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gnas te rin po che dang padma dang ral gri dang lcags kyus rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa dgug go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas lag par 'khor lo'i lcags kyus bsams nas de dang de'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gnas te rin po che dang padma dang ral gri dang lcags kyus rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa dgug go //
translated: The practitioner of Vairocana, having imagined the hook of the wheel in his hand, remaining in the center of that and that mandala, summons Ratnasaṃbhava and so forth with the jewel, lotus, sword, and hook.

original: de bzhin du gzhan rnams kyang shes par bya ba de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan rnams kyang shes par bya ba de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Similarly, one should understand the others. Therefore it is said:

original: rdo rje kyo ba'i khyad par gyis //
analyzed: rdo rje kyo ba'i khyad par gyis //
translated: By the special vajra hook,

original: sngags rnams thams cad dgug pa'i mchog / ces so //
analyzed: sngags rnams thams cad dgug pa'i mchog / ces so //
translated: the supreme summoning of all mantras.

original: rang sngags skyes bu bsgoms nas ni //
analyzed: rang sngags skyes bu bsgoms nas ni //
translated: Having meditated on the being born from one's mantra,

original: zhes pa ni rang gi lha rnams kyi ngo bor rang gi sngags kyi bdag nyid bsams nas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang gi lha rnams kyi ngo bor rang gi sngags kyi bdag nyid bsams nas so //
translated: Having contemplated one's own nature as the essence of one's deity and mantra,

original: thams cad rdo rje'i dngos zhi ba //🔽zhes pa ni sku gsung thugs @116a * //
analyzed: thams cad rdo rje'i dngos zhi ba // zhes pa ni sku gsung thugs @116a * //
translated: all things are the nature of vajra.

original: kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: This is the nature of body, speech, and mind.

original: snying gar rdo rje kyo sbyor bas //
analyzed: snying gar rdo rje kyo sbyor bas //
translated: The vajra hook gesture at the heart

original: zhes pa ni de'i snying ga'i padma rdo rje lcags kyus phug nas de rnams kyang rdo rje'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor la zhon pa rnams su bsams nas dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de'i snying ga'i padma rdo rje lcags kyus phug nas de rnams kyang rdo rje'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor la zhon pa rnams su bsams nas dgug par bya'o //
translated: means that having pierced the lotus at the heart of those to be summoned with the vajra hook, one should summon them, having contemplated them as mounted on the vajra wind mandala.

original: rnam par snang mdzad gzugs chen po //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad gzugs chen po //
translated: Vairocana, the great form,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ni 'phags pa bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i rnal 'byor byas te de'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs su bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ni 'phags pa bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i rnal 'byor byas te de'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs su bsam par bya ste /
translated: and so forth. Having performed the yoga of noble Amṛtakuṇḍali, the yogin who abides in the center of his maṇḍala should contemplate the Blessed One Vairocana in the form of a moon maṇḍala.

original: de nas sha tsi steng du gnas pa'i gzugs su bsgoms nas dgug par bya'o//
analyzed: de nas sha tsi steng du gnas pa'i gzugs su bsgoms nas dgug par bya'o//
translated: Then, having meditated on him as abiding in the space above, one should summon him.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: rdo rje mi 'chi sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: rdo rje mi 'chi sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the yoga of the immortal vajra,

translated: having summoned him and having placed him there,

original: bar 'gyur ro //

translated: In particular means that the woman, eunuch, or man is expelled by one who is similar to oneself.🔽Having written means that the yogin of the Noble Nectar-renowned-one or another wrathful one, with the blood of the left ring finger of the foot, on the skull as described, with red arsenic, charcoal, and cow's bile, writes the effigy of the one to be expelled in the center of a wind mandala marked with a sword.

original: rnams kyis ral gris mtshan pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor te de'i dbus su bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan bris te de'i snying gar ral pa gcig ma la sogs pa'i gang yang rung ba'i rang gi rig pa'i sngags dang ming spel bar bya ste bkug pa sngon du song bas

translated: In the heart of that, he should write the name and mantra of any of the single-braided ones, etc., and having previously summoned,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs 'ching pa'i phur bu'i sngags yin te sku la sogs pa la dmigs pas rdo rje gsum gyis 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the mantra of the dagger which binds the body, speech and mind of all the Tathagatas, because it is the nailing with the three vajras, by means of the visualization of body and so on.

analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin yang dbyer mi phyed pa'i phyir de skad ces brjod do //
translated: The concentration which has that as its object is also called that, because it is indivisible.

translated: The Buddha is the Bhagavān, and by “fainting” and so forth, he demonstrates the dance for the benefit of sentient beings, and the cause for passing beyond fear is the great vajra-holder, endowed with mindfulness.

translated: “The destruction of the three vajra bodies” means that having done one hundred thousand recitations of the mantra as before, one should draw on the cloth from a charnel ground a wheel with a blazing hub, black in color, wrathful, with a garland of flames, below which is a form like a spike,

original: rnam pa can gyi rnam par snang mdzad bris te /
