translated: One should make an effigy eight finger-widths long with the previously described charnel ground substances, and so forth, insert the mantra in the heart as before, and summon the victim.

original: bya'i ming bcug nas che ge mo zhes lus dang ngag dang yid ces pa dang yang mngon par spel pa sngags bzlas pa na de'i mgo nas bzung nas rkang pa la thug par phur pa btab pas @119b sku gsum gyi rdo rje rnams 'jig par byed do //
analyzed: bya'i ming bcug nas che ge mo zhes lus dang ngag dang yid ces pa dang yang mngon par spel pa sngags bzlas pa na de'i mgo nas bzung nas rkang pa la thug par phur pa btab pas @119b sku gsum gyi rdo rje rnams 'jig par byed do //
translated: Having inserted the name of the bird, and having repeated the mantra, “So-and-so’s body, speech, and mind,” having seized the head, and having driven in the dagger up to the hilt, one destroys the vajras of the three bodies.

original: de bzhin du seng ldeng gi phur bu sor brgyad pa'i khong stong du padma'i dbus su de bzhin du mngon spyod kyi cho gas 'og rtse mo'i rnam pa can bris pa'i gsung rdo rje la bcug nas de'i sbyor ba nyid kyis brjod ma thag pa nyid kyis gdab
analyzed: de bzhin du seng ldeng gi phur bu sor brgyad pa'i khong stong du padma'i dbus su de bzhin du mngon spyod kyi cho gas 'og rtse mo'i rnam pa can bris pa'i gsung rdo rje la bcug nas de'i sbyor ba nyid kyis brjod ma thag pa nyid kyis gdab
translated: Similarly, having inserted the vajra of speech into the hollow of an eight-finger-breadth acacia dagger in the center of a lotus, with the rite of violence, one should drive it in with the previously mentioned procedure, with the tip below, and with the handle above.

original: par bya'o // de bzhin du lcags kyi rang bzhin gyi phur ba'i khong stong du bu skyes pa'i ras la bris pa 'bar ba'i rdo rje bris te 'og rtse mo'i rnam pa thugs rdo rje khros pa bcug nas de nyid kyis de bzhin gdab par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: par bya'o // de bzhin du lcags kyi rang bzhin gyi phur ba'i khong stong du bu skyes pa'i ras la bris pa 'bar ba'i rdo rje bris te 'og rtse mo'i rnam pa thugs rdo rje khros pa bcug nas de nyid kyis de bzhin gdab par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should drive it in with that very [vajra].

original: sbyor ba nyid bshad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: sbyor ba nyid bshad pa gsungs pa /
translated: The application itself is explained,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' ni thugs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' ni thugs rdo rje'o //
translated: Vajrasattva is the mind vajra.

original: dkar po dang dmar po dang nag po'i phur pa rnams ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa tha dad pa mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir lcags kyi rang bzhin gyi phur pa de sbyar ro //
analyzed: dkar po dang dmar po dang nag po'i phur pa rnams ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa tha dad pa mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir lcags kyi rang bzhin gyi phur pa de sbyar ro //
translated: The white, red, and black spikes indicate the differentiation of the body vajra, etc., therefore one should apply that iron spike.

original: nye bar mtshon pa yang 'di yin te lcags kyi rang bzhin gyi phur pa don yod grub pa dang rin chen 'byung ldan 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa yang 'di yin te lcags kyi rang bzhin gyi phur pa don yod grub pa dang rin chen 'byung ldan 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is also an indication: the iron spike is for the sake of the union of Amoghasiddhi and Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: de bzhin du 'dir rigs kyi phur pa rnams rigs lnga'i rnam par bzhag pa shes par bya ste rang gi phyag mtshan gyi nang du chud pa bris la rang gi rigs kyi lha khros pa 'og rtse mo'i rnam pa can rang gi rigs kyi phur pa la bcug
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir rigs kyi phur pa rnams rigs lnga'i rnam par bzhag pa shes par bya ste rang gi phyag mtshan gyi nang du chud pa bris la rang gi rigs kyi lha khros pa 'og rtse mo'i rnam pa can rang gi rigs kyi phur pa la bcug
translated: One should draw them inside one's own hand implement. The deity of one's own family, in the form of an angry one with the upper part of the body protruding, is inserted into the dagger of one's own family.

original: ste mngon spyod kyi cho gar brjod pa de'i rnal 'byor gyis de nyid bkug ste me tog sngon pos mchod nas brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te sngar bzhin du gzugs brnyan la gdab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: ste mngon spyod kyi cho gar brjod pa de'i rnal 'byor gyis de nyid bkug ste me tog sngon pos mchod nas brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te sngar bzhin du gzugs brnyan la gdab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: One should summon him with the yoga of that, as described in the rite of killing. Having made offerings with blue flowers, one should recite [the mantra] one hundred and eight times and strike the effigy as before.

original: gshin rje gshed kyi phyag rgya che //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed kyi phyag rgya che //
translated: The great seal of Yamantaka.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽rdo rje bdud rtsi 'khyil pa yis //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o // rdo rje bdud rtsi 'khyil pa yis //
translated: And so on.🔽The vajra amrita chakra.

original: zhes pa ni thugs rdo rje phur bu'i nang du chud pas de'i rnal 'byor gyis kyang zhes pa'i don to ;
analyzed: zhes pa ni thugs rdo rje phur bu'i nang du chud pas de'i rnal 'byor gyis kyang zhes pa'i don to ;
translated: This means that one should insert the mind vajra dagger. The meaning is that one should also do it with the yoga of that.

original: / sangs rgyas kyang zhes pa ni sangs rgyas dang 'dra ba yang bsrung ba dang bral zhing kha sbyor phye ba'o //
analyzed: / sangs rgyas kyang zhes pa ni sangs rgyas dang 'dra ba yang bsrung ba dang bral zhing kha sbyor phye ba'o //
translated: And the Buddha means that even one who is like a Buddha is without protection and is split open by the separation of the two halves of the body.

original: phur bu'i mtshan nyid gsal por gsungs pa /
analyzed: phur bu'i mtshan nyid gsal por gsungs pa /
translated: The clear statement of the characteristics of the dagger is:

original: snying ga zhes pa la sogs pa ste snying ga nas brtsams te rkang pa'i mthar rdo rje rtse gcig gi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: snying ga zhes pa la sogs pa ste snying ga nas brtsams te rkang pa'i mthar rdo rje rtse gcig gi rnam pa'o //
translated: From the heart and so forth. Beginning from the heart, it is in the form of a single-pointed vajra to the end of the feet.

original: steng du 'ang dam tshig de nyid bya ;
analyzed: steng du 'ang dam tshig de nyid bya ;
translated: And above, one should do that very pledge.

original: / zhes pa ni gang yang rung ba'i lha'i gzugs te 'on kyang mngon spyod kyi cho ga las thams cad nag po'o //
analyzed: / zhes pa ni gang yang rung ba'i lha'i gzugs te 'on kyang mngon spyod kyi cho ga las thams cad nag po'o //
translated: That is, the form of any deity, but in all fierce rites it is black.

original: da ni ji lta ba bzhin du ji ltar brjod pa'i sgrub thabs kyi cho ga nyams su blangs pa'i sngags pas gang gi tshe dngos grub thob par ma gyur na de'i tshe lha rnams la legs par phur @120a * //
analyzed: da ni ji lta ba bzhin du ji ltar brjod pa'i sgrub thabs kyi cho ga nyams su blangs pa'i sngags pas gang gi tshe dngos grub thob par ma gyur na de'i tshe lha rnams la legs par phur @120a * //
translated: Now, when the mantra practitioner who has practiced the rite of the means of achievement as it is explained does not attain power, then at that time he should well strike the deities with the dagger and practice.

original: bus gdab ste bsgrub par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: bus gdab ste bsgrub par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Thus he says:

original: bsam gtan zhes pa la sogs pa ste rang gi lha'i nga rgyal gyis brjod ma thag pa'i phur bu'i rnam pa'i lha bsgoms pas rang gi sa bon las byung ba'i bsgrub bya'i lha'i rnam par bsgoms pa ni bsam gtan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan zhes pa la sogs pa ste rang gi lha'i nga rgyal gyis brjod ma thag pa'i phur bu'i rnam pa'i lha bsgoms pas rang gi sa bon las byung ba'i bsgrub bya'i lha'i rnam par bsgoms pa ni bsam gtan no //
translated: Meditation and so forth. By the pride of one's deity, the deity in the form of a dagger just mentioned is meditated upon, and the form of the deity arisen from one's seed is meditated upon.

original: rdo rje ni rang gi gsang ba'i rdo rje ste shes rab dang thabs kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i sbyor ba des so //
analyzed: rdo rje ni rang gi gsang ba'i rdo rje ste shes rab dang thabs kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i sbyor ba des so //
translated: The vajra is one's secret vajra, and by that union of wisdom and means.

original: nges par te gdon mi za bar ro //
analyzed: nges par te gdon mi za bar ro //
translated: Certainly means without doubt.

original: sangs rgyas ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The Buddha is Vairocana.

original: phur bus btab na zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: phur bus btab na zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: If struck by the dagger means in the manner to be explained.

original: gal te rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po yang dag par phur bus btab kyang mi 'grub na 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po yang dag par phur bus btab kyang mi 'grub na 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If even the Great Vajra Holder is struck by the true dagger and does not succeed, he will die.

original: de ltar yang ma yin pa des na nges par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don du brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin pa des na nges par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don du brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is not like that, it is expressed as meaning he will certainly succeed.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Buddhas, the Venerable Ones, do not pass into complete nirvāṇa.

original: sku ni rnam par snang mdzad de yin la de rnam par 'phrul pa ni sngags la sogs pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: sku ni rnam par snang mdzad de yin la de rnam par 'phrul pa ni sngags la sogs pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The body is Vairocana, and its magical emanation is the nature of the mantra, etc.

original: rdo rje gang gi yin pa de ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: rdo rje gang gi yin pa de ni de bzhin no //
translated: He who has that vajra is just so.

original: sku'i dam tshig ni rnam par snang mdzad de de'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: sku'i dam tshig ni rnam par snang mdzad de de'i sbyor bas so //
translated: The commitment of the body is Vairocana, because of his application.

original: de nyid kyang tsham ngam gyi sngags gang gis phur pa 'debs pa de'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyang tsham ngam gyi sngags gang gis phur pa 'debs pa de'o //
translated: He is also the mantra of the threatening mudrā by which one plants the kīla.

original: lag pa'i phyag rgya bcing mi bya //
analyzed: lag pa'i phyag rgya bcing mi bya //
translated: One should not bind the hand mudrā.

original: gal te dngos grub mchog 'dod na ;
analyzed: gal te dngos grub mchog 'dod na ;
translated: If one desires the supreme attainment,

original: / zhes 'di nyid du brjod pa'i phyir dang dngos grub mchog bsgrub pa'i yang phyir 'di ltar bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: / zhes 'di nyid du brjod pa'i phyir dang dngos grub mchog bsgrub pa'i yang phyir 'di ltar bshad pa yin te /
translated: because this is stated here, and because of the attainment of the supreme, it is explained in this way.

original: phan tshun dkri ba'i tshul du bya //
analyzed: phan tshun dkri ba'i tshul du bya //
translated: One should do it in the manner of mutual embrace.

original: zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas rang 'od kyi rig ma'i rnam par bu mo bsgoms te phan tshun du 'khyud pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas rang 'od kyi rig ma'i rnam par bu mo bsgoms te phan tshun du 'khyud pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the yoga of Vairochana, who meditates on the daughter as his own light consort, and they embrace each other.

original: mthe bo zhes pa ni gsang ba'i rdo rje 'bar ba yin la gnas ni bde ba chen po'i gnas te chos 'byung du grags pa'o //
analyzed: mthe bo zhes pa ni gsang ba'i rdo rje 'bar ba yin la gnas ni bde ba chen po'i gnas te chos 'byung du grags pa'o //
translated: The “thumb” is the blazing secret vajra, and the “place” is the place of great bliss, known as the “source of phenomena.”

original: de dag gi sbyor ba ni 'dus pa'o //🔽rdo rje phur bus nges par gdab //
analyzed: de dag gi sbyor ba ni 'dus pa'o // rdo rje phur bus nges par gdab //
translated: Their “union” is their coming together.🔽“One should definitely strike with the vajra stake” means that all, together with the consort, are in the form of the blazing black wrathful Vairochana, possessing the yoga of Vairochana, and abiding in the lotus of one’s own light consort.

original: ces pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du rig ma dang bcas pa thams cad nag po 'bar ba khros pa'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas rang 'od kyi rig ma'i padma la gnas pa me'i dkyil 'khor la rnam par snang mdzad kha dog dkar
analyzed: ces pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du rig ma dang bcas pa thams cad nag po 'bar ba khros pa'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas rang 'od kyi rig ma'i padma la gnas pa me'i dkyil 'khor la rnam par snang mdzad kha dog dkar
translated: On the maṇḍala of fire, Vairochana is white,

original: po dam tshig las 'da' bas 'jigs shing brgyal bar dmigs nas rang gi gsang ba'i rdo rje 'bar ba las sngar brjod pa'i phur pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par snang mdzad phyung @120b ste sngags bzlas nas spyi bor bsnun nas rkang pa'i bar du gdab par bya'o //

translated: Having visualized that the disciple is frightened and faints from transgressing the pledge, one should extract Vairocana in the form of a dagger as previously described from one’s blazing secret vajra, recite the mantra, strike the crown of his head, and plant it up to the roots.

original: de ltar gdab ma thag tu zhes pa ni de ma thag pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar gdab ma thag tu zhes pa ni de ma thag pa nyid de /
translated: “Immediately after planting” means immediately.

analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyi bdag nyid rnam par snang mdzad ldang bar 'gyur te /

original: mngon sum du 'gyur bar 'grub bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum du 'gyur bar 'grub bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be successful in visualizing him.

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug gsung ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug gsung ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The speech of Lokeśvara is Amitābha.

analyzed: kha phye ba yang yin la de'i ye shes kyi padma yang yin te rig mar bsgoms pa'i bu mo'i bha ga'o //

original: der rdo rje nyid ni sor mo yin te der gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: der rdo rje nyid ni sor mo yin te der gzhug pa'o //
translated: The vajra there is the finger, which is inserted there.

original: gzhan ni sngar bzhin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni sngar bzhin te /

analyzed: 'on kyang bsgrub bya ni 'od dpag tu med pa kha dog dmar po'o //

analyzed: thugs ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The mind is Akṣobhya.

analyzed: rdo rje rtse lngar bcings nas ni //

analyzed: de tshe de yi ye shes ni //
translated: At that time, that gnosis

original: grub pa nges par skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: grub pa nges par skye bar 'gyur //
translated: will definitely arise as accomplishment.

original: rigs kyi dbye ba'i sbyor bas ni ;
analyzed: rigs kyi dbye ba'i sbyor bas ni ;
translated: By the application of the division of the families,

original: / rdo rje phur bus phur bu gdab //
analyzed: / rdo rje phur bus phur bu gdab //
translated: one should strike with the vajra dagger.

original: ces rgyud phyi ma las brjod pa'i cho gas bla ma'i man ngag nyid las drag po'i sgrub pa bsgrub par bya'o zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: ces rgyud phyi ma las brjod pa'i cho gas bla ma'i man ngag nyid las drag po'i sgrub pa bsgrub par bya'o zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: Others say that one should perform the rite of wrathful repetition according to the guru’s instruction, by means of the rite described in the Later Tantra.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ci ltar na phur pa 'debs pa la sogs pa yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ci ltar na phur pa 'debs pa la sogs pa yin /
translated: How can the Blessed Buddhas, who are the nature of the pure realm of phenomena, be impaled on a stake and so forth?

original: bden te 'di de rnams la srid pa ma yin te 'on kyang rang gi sems nyid thams cad mkhyen par bstan pa'i rnam pa 'dra ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa bsgoms pa na bsam gyis mi khyab pa de'i 'bras bu thob par byed par 'gyur te thams
analyzed: bden te 'di de rnams la srid pa ma yin te 'on kyang rang gi sems nyid thams cad mkhyen par bstan pa'i rnam pa 'dra ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa bsgoms pa na bsam gyis mi khyab pa de'i 'bras bu thob par byed par 'gyur te thams
translated: That is true, but this is not possible for them. However, when one meditates on one’s own mind endowed with the aspect of omniscience and so forth, one will attain the inconceivable result.

original: cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa la bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa la bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is inconceivable for one who is not omniscient and because it is the nature of dependent origination.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku spros pa ni rnam par 'phrul pa yin te rdo rje phur bu'i gzugs kyi sku yongs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku spros pa ni rnam par 'phrul pa yin te rdo rje phur bu'i gzugs kyi sku yongs su gyur pa'o //
translated: The emanation of the body of the Bhagavat Vairocana is the magical creation, the transformation of the body in the form of the Vajra Stake.

original: dam tshig kyang de yin la tsham ngam yang de yin te de nyid rdo rje'o //
analyzed: dam tshig kyang de yin la tsham ngam yang de yin te de nyid rdo rje'o //
translated: It is the pledge, and it is also the threatening gesture, and it is the Vajra.

original: des phur pa btab pa ni sdang ba rnams te de'i don du sngags brjod pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: des phur pa btab pa ni sdang ba rnams te de'i don du sngags brjod pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The one who is staked is the enemy, and the one who recites the mantra is for that purpose.

original: tsham ngam gyi phyag rgya gsungs pa /
analyzed: tsham ngam gyi phyag rgya gsungs pa /
translated: The threatening gesture is stated:

original: phan tshun dkri ba'i tshul du bya //
analyzed: phan tshun dkri ba'i tshul du bya //
translated: One should do it in the manner of mutual embrace.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa la rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas de kho na nyid kyi rdo rje'i bcing bas sor mo thams cad phan tshun du kha sprad par byas nas mthe bo dag kyang rdo rje byas te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa la rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas de kho na nyid kyi rdo rje'i bcing bas sor mo thams cad phan tshun du kha sprad par byas nas mthe bo dag kyang rdo rje byas te /
translated: and so forth. The practitioner of Vairocana, with the binding of the Vajra of reality, should bring all the fingers together in mutual embrace, and also make the thumbs into a Vajra.

original: bsgrub bya la phur pas gdab pa'i bsam pas kha thur du bstan te sa la dgod par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bsgrub bya la phur pas gdab pa'i bsam pas kha thur du bstan te sa la dgod par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: With the idea of staking the victim, one should face downward and place it on the ground. This is the meaning.

original: dam tshig mchog gis ldang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dam tshig mchog gis ldang bar 'gyur //
translated: One will rise up with the supreme pledge.

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje phur bu'i gzugs bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad bsgrub bya'i lus la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje phur bu'i gzugs bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad bsgrub bya'i lus la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the Vajra Dagger form of the Blessed One Vairocana entering the body of the one to be initiated.

original: rdo rje phur bu'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs su yongs su gyur par bsgom pa ni dam tshig yin la de nyid mchog yin pa des so //
analyzed: rdo rje phur bu'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs su yongs su gyur par bsgom pa ni dam tshig yin la de nyid mchog yin pa des so //
translated: The pledge is the meditation on the Vajra Dagger as the body, speech, and mind of Vairocana, and by that very supremacy.

original: yang na 'chi ba'i gnas su 'gyur //
analyzed: yang na 'chi ba'i gnas su 'gyur //
translated: Or else, it is the state of death.

original: zhes pa ni gal te de'i ngo bor mi bsgom par phyag rgya kho nar rab tu sbyor bar byed na de'i tshe mngon par 'dod pa'i @121b dngos grub las nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gal te de'i ngo bor mi bsgom par phyag rgya kho nar rab tu sbyor bar byed na de'i tshe mngon par 'dod pa'i @121b dngos grub las nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is if one does not meditate on that nature, but applies oneself to the mere seal, then at that time one falls from the desired power.

original: 'od dpag tu med pa'i sbyor bas 'od dpag tu med pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams phur bu'i rnam par spros pa'i 'jig rten dbang phyug gsung rnam par 'phrul pa'o //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa'i sbyor bas 'od dpag tu med pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams phur bu'i rnam par spros pa'i 'jig rten dbang phyug gsung rnam par 'phrul pa'o //
translated: The speech magic creation of Lokeśvara is the emanation in the form of the Vajra Dagger of the body, speech, and mind of Amitābha through the application of Amitābha.

original: ngag gi dam tshig gi tsham ngam 'od dpag tu med pa'i ngo bo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ngag gi dam tshig gi tsham ngam 'od dpag tu med pa'i ngo bo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the speech pledge gesture is the essence of Amitābha.

original: / de'i phur pas btab pa ni sdang ba rnams te de'i don du sngags gsungs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: / de'i phur pas btab pa ni sdang ba rnams te de'i don du sngags gsungs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The stake is the enemies, and the mantra is for their sake.

original: tsham ngam gyi phyag rgya gsungs pa /
analyzed: tsham ngam gyi phyag rgya gsungs pa /
translated: The mudra of threatening is taught:🔽Opening the mouth, etc.

original: kha phye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rdo rje thal mo brdabs te 'dab ma brgyad pa padma'i rigs kyi dam tshig bya'o //
analyzed: kha phye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rdo rje thal mo brdabs te 'dab ma brgyad pa padma'i rigs kyi dam tshig bya'o //
translated: One should make the pledge of the lotus family, the eight-petaled lotus, by clapping the vajra palms.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po thugs rnam par 'phrul pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni snga ma kho na ltar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po thugs rnam par 'phrul pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni snga ma kho na ltar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The great vajra-holder's mind emanation, etc., should be seen as before.

original: tsham ngam gyi phyag rgya gsungs pa /
analyzed: tsham ngam gyi phyag rgya gsungs pa /
translated: The mudra of threatening is taught:🔽The five-pointed, etc.

original: rtse lnga zhes pa la sogs pa ste mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor byas pa'am rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i rnal 'byor bya ste /
analyzed: rtse lnga zhes pa la sogs pa ste mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor byas pa'am rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i rnal 'byor bya ste /
translated: One should perform the yoga of Akshobhya or the yoga of the great vajra-holder.

original: thal mo sbyar te srin lag gnyis kha sbyar gyi nang du bcug ste mthe bo dang mthe'u chung rnams kyi rtse mo gnyis su byas te kha gyen du bstan la gzung bar bya ste gung mo gnyis kyang rtse mor bya ste de'i rgyab kyi cha gnyis su mdzub
analyzed: thal mo sbyar te srin lag gnyis kha sbyar gyi nang du bcug ste mthe bo dang mthe'u chung rnams kyi rtse mo gnyis su byas te kha gyen du bstan la gzung bar bya ste gung mo gnyis kyang rtse mor bya ste de'i rgyab kyi cha gnyis su mdzub
translated: The two ring fingers are joined together inside the joined palms, and the tips of the thumbs and little fingers are joined together in two places, and the palms are turned upward. The two middle fingers are also made into tips, and the two index fingers are bent and held in the form of a vajra behind them.

original: mo gnyis bskum ste rdo rje'i rnam par gzung bar bya'o zhes snying po zhabs so //
analyzed: mo gnyis bskum ste rdo rje'i rnam par gzung bar bya'o zhes snying po zhabs so //
translated: This is the mudra of the vajra-fist, as taught by the venerable Ghantapa.

original: gzhan rnams kyis gzhan du bshad pa de yang shin tu gzhung rgyas pas 'jigs nas de ma bris so //
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyis gzhan du bshad pa de yang shin tu gzhung rgyas pas 'jigs nas de ma bris so //
translated: The others explain it differently, but fearing too much verbiage, I have not written that.

original: mkhas pa rnams rang nyid kyis kyang de brtags te gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams rang nyid kyis kyang de brtags te gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The wise should also examine it themselves and hold it.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la bstan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gsang ba yin pa la rtogs shing go bar byed pa 'dis zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs shes pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la bstan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gsang ba yin pa la rtogs shing go bar byed pa 'dis zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs shes pa ni gnas so //
translated: This is the abode of knowing the collection of pacifying and other activities by this realization and understanding, because it is to be taught to the sravakas and others.

original: sku rdo rje phur pas btab pa nyid kyis de'i gnas thob par byed pa nyid kyis snying po bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sku rdo rje phur pas btab pa nyid kyis de'i gnas thob par byed pa nyid kyis snying po bsdus pa'o //
translated: The essence is summarized by the very fact that the Body-Vajra is implanted with the dagger, and thereby its state is attained.

original: de bzhin du 'od dpag tu med pa dang mi bskyod pa la yang sbyor ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'od dpag tu med pa dang mi bskyod pa la yang sbyor ro //
translated: In the same way, it is applied to Amitābha and Akṣobhya.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rnams //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rnams //
translated: The Body, Speech, and Mind Vajras

original: zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yul dang yul can dang khams rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yul dang yul can dang khams rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: are the Bodhisattvas of the objects, subjects, and elements, whose nature is Body, etc.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhes pa 'di nyid kyis sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams yang dag par bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhes pa 'di nyid kyis sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams yang dag par bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “of all the Buddhas” is because the Body Vajra, etc., are included in just this.

original: bde ba chen po 'byung ba'i phyir de 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba chen po 'byung ba'i phyir de 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is the source because it is the source of the arising of great bliss.

original: dbyer med pa'i sku la sogs pa thob par byed pas sku gsung thugs kyi mchog sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dbyer med pa'i sku la sogs pa thob par byed pas sku gsung thugs kyi mchog sbyin pa'o //
translated: It is the bestower of the supreme of Bodies, Speech, and Minds because it causes the attainment of the indivisible Body, etc.

original: mdor bsdus pa slu bar mi byed pa thob par byed pa'i phyir sngags kyi de nyid bsdus @122a * //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa slu bar mi byed pa thob par byed pa'i phyir sngags kyi de nyid bsdus @122a * //
translated: The Mantra Reality is summarized because it causes the attainment of the summarized, non-deceptive [truth].

original: pa'o ; / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs rnams rmad du byung ba ni ya mtshan du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'o ; / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs rnams rmad du byung ba ni ya mtshan du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The marvelous of all the Tathāgatas’ Body, Speech, and Mind is the cause of their wonder.

original: de rnams kyi sngags rnams dang lha rnams 'gugs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sngags rnams dang lha rnams 'gugs par byed pa'o //
translated: They are the summoners of their mantras and deities.🔽They are the summoners of the continua of disciples who are endowed with the yoga and of Noble Locanā, etc.,🔽and their play is the manifestation of that.

original: sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i gdul bya'i rgyud rnams de'i rang bzhin du byed pa dang 'phags ma spyan la sogs pa 'gugs pa yang de yin te des rnam par 'phrul pa ni de rnam par rol pa yin te de nyid kyis rgyal bar byed cing gsal bar byed
analyzed: sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i gdul bya'i rgyud rnams de'i rang bzhin du byed pa dang 'phags ma spyan la sogs pa 'gugs pa yang de yin te des rnam par 'phrul pa ni de rnam par rol pa yin te de nyid kyis rgyal bar byed cing gsal bar byed
translated: It is just that which is victorious and illuminating.

original: ces pa ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: ces pa ni de bzhin no //
translated: Thus it is.

original: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyan las le'u bcu bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyan las le'u bcu bzhi pa'o /
translated: This is the fourteenth chapter in the Sri-Guhyasamajatantra-alamkara.

original: // / de nas zhes pa la bu mo thob byas nas zhes pa la sogs pas rig pa'i brtul zhugs dang rjes su mthun pa'i rig pa bsgrub pa gsungs pa yin la de'i rigs dang lo du lon pa de'i sgrub pa'i thabs kyang ci lta bu zhes pa la
analyzed: // / de nas zhes pa la bu mo thob byas nas zhes pa la sogs pas rig pa'i brtul zhugs dang rjes su mthun pa'i rig pa bsgrub pa gsungs pa yin la de'i rigs dang lo du lon pa de'i sgrub pa'i thabs kyang ci lta bu zhes pa la
translated: What is the method of accomplishment of her type and age? etc.,

original: sogs pa gdul bya'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su shes pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: sogs pa gdul bya'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su shes pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: after having understood the disciple's thought.

original: zhe sdang dang gti mug dang dam tshig dang rin po che 'dod chags kyi rigs kyi bdag nyid gsal bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang gti mug dang dam tshig dang rin po che 'dod chags kyi rigs kyi bdag nyid gsal bar gsungs pa /
translated: The nature of the types of hatred, delusion, commitment, and passion is clearly taught:

original: rgyal po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: the king, etc.🔽The yogi who has practiced the knowledge observance for six months as prescribed should accomplish it, abiding in his own mandala.

original: zla ba drug tu ji lta ba bzhin rig pa'i brtul zhugs spyad pa'i rnal 'byor pas rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas te bsgrub par bya'o zhes rigs kyi nga rgyal sun dbyung ba'i don du sku la sogs pa'i rigs rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas rig pa'i brtul
analyzed: zla ba drug tu ji lta ba bzhin rig pa'i brtul zhugs spyad pa'i rnal 'byor pas rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas te bsgrub par bya'o zhes rigs kyi nga rgyal sun dbyung ba'i don du sku la sogs pa'i rigs rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas rig pa'i brtul
translated: In order to refute the pride of the types, he teaches the knowledge observance through the door of the purities of the body, etc. types:🔽The king is the type of Vairochana, etc.

original: zhugs kyi rjes su mthun pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhugs kyi rjes su mthun pa gsungs te /
translated: The following is stated as being in accord with the ritual.

original: lo bcu gnyis lon pa ni bag mar ma btang zhing gzhan la ma song ba'o //
analyzed: lo bcu gnyis lon pa ni bag mar ma btang zhing gzhan la ma song ba'o //
translated: One who is twelve years old is one who has not been given in marriage and has not gone to another.

original: bdag nyid che zhes pa ni sngags kyi de nyid shes pa ste gang yang ci yang rung ba'i rigs las bya byed dang bcas pas ni ma yin pa'am bdag nyid kyis legs par sbyangs la gzung bar bya'o zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid che zhes pa ni sngags kyi de nyid shes pa ste gang yang ci yang rung ba'i rigs las bya byed dang bcas pas ni ma yin pa'am bdag nyid kyis legs par sbyangs la gzung bar bya'o zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: One who is great is one who knows the reality of mantra, and not one who is of any kind of caste, or one who is engaged in action, or one who is trained by oneself. One should view her as to be taken.

original: cho ga las zhes pa ni ye shes lngas byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa rgyud phyi ma las bshad pas so //
analyzed: cho ga las zhes pa ni ye shes lngas byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa rgyud phyi ma las bshad pas so //
translated: The ritual is the consecration by the five intuitions, and so on, as explained in the Later Tantra.

original: rdo rje dkyil 'khor ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i sgom pa pos so //
analyzed: rdo rje dkyil 'khor ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i sgom pa pos so //
translated: The vajra maṇḍala is the contemplator of the circle of deities.

original: nang gi dkyil 'khor lnga ru dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sangs rgyas kyi gzugs bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: nang gi dkyil 'khor lnga ru dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sangs rgyas kyi gzugs bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should contemplate the circle of deities in the form of the Buddha in the five inner maṇḍalas.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' ni 'dir mi bskyod pa ste phul du byung ba'i bsgom pa shes rab dang thabs snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' ni 'dir mi bskyod pa ste phul du byung ba'i bsgom pa shes rab dang thabs snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Vajrasattva is here Akṣhobhya, the characteristic of the union of wisdom and means, the supreme meditation.

original: chos rnams kun 'dzin pa ni 'dir 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kun 'dzin pa ni 'dir 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: Holder of all dharmas is here Amitābha.

original: ji skad brjod pa'i rigs mi srid pa la rigs gzhan bsgre ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad brjod pa'i rigs mi srid pa la rigs gzhan bsgre ba gsungs pa /
translated: The impossibility of the mentioned type is stated with the substitution of another type:

original: bram ze zhes @122b pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bram ze zhes @122b pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Brahmin,” etc.

original: rdo rje chos zhes pa ni mtshon par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje chos zhes pa ni mtshon par byed pa'o //
translated: Vajradharma is the indicator.

original: thams cad bsgrub pa'i dus gsungs pa /
analyzed: thams cad bsgrub pa'i dus gsungs pa /
translated: The time for accomplishing everything is stated:

original: nyi ma nub ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma nub ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “When the sun has set,” etc.

original: pang par bzhag nas zhes gang brjod pa de gsal bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: pang par bzhag nas zhes gang brjod pa de gsal bar gsungs pa /
translated: What was said about “placing in the lap” is clarified:

original: dbang po gnyis ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po gnyis ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The two organs,” etc.

original: bza' bar bya'o zhes pa 'dis ni 'di ston par byed de sgro btags pa 'di thams cad ni 'khrul pa yin no zhes yid brtan pas bsgrubs na 'grub po zhes so //
analyzed: bza' bar bya'o zhes pa 'dis ni 'di ston par byed de sgro btags pa 'di thams cad ni 'khrul pa yin no zhes yid brtan pas bsgrubs na 'grub po zhes so //
translated: By “one should eat,” this is taught: “All this superimposition is delusion.” If one practices with confidence, one will succeed.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'chad pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'chad pa /
translated: Therefore, it is explained:

original: sangs rgyas byang chub gnas zhi bas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub gnas zhi bas //
translated: The Buddha, the Awakened One, is the peace of the abode.

original: de nyid bla na med pa 'grub //
analyzed: de nyid bla na med pa 'grub //
translated: That is the accomplishment of the unsurpassed.

original: ces so // 'dir kha cig ni rim pa las bzlog nas bshad pa brjod do //
analyzed: ces so // 'dir kha cig ni rim pa las bzlog nas bshad pa brjod do //
translated: Here, some explain in the reverse order.

original: de la yang cung zad kyang mi rigs pas mi bzung ngo //
analyzed: de la yang cung zad kyang mi rigs pas mi bzung ngo //
translated: But since that is not reasonable at all, it should not be accepted.

original: man ngag tsam rig pa dang bral ba ni rigs pa shes pa rnams kyis gzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: man ngag tsam rig pa dang bral ba ni rigs pa shes pa rnams kyis gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: Those who know reasoning should not accept mere instruction divorced from reasoning.

original: go rims ji lta bar bshad pa la tshad ma dang lung gis gnod pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: go rims ji lta bar bshad pa la tshad ma dang lung gis gnod pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is not the slightest contradiction with valid knowledge and scripture in the explanation in the proper order.

original: ma dang pha dag las bag mar ma blangs pa'i bu mo rnyed pa 'dod pas log par spyod pa sgrub pa'i yan lag tu mi 'gyur ro zhes shes par 'dod pas bsam pa bzang pos gzhan gyi len pa mnan pa'i sgo nas bdag gi dbang du 'gyur ba
analyzed: ma dang pha dag las bag mar ma blangs pa'i bu mo rnyed pa 'dod pas log par spyod pa sgrub pa'i yan lag tu mi 'gyur ro zhes shes par 'dod pas bsam pa bzang pos gzhan gyi len pa mnan pa'i sgo nas bdag gi dbang du 'gyur ba
translated: In order to know that a girl who is not taken as a bride from her mother and father is not a limb of the practice of wrong conduct out of desire for acquisition, with a good motivation, in order to suppress the acceptance of others, one should obtain her for oneself.

original: nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes rig pa'i brtul zhugs kyi sbyor ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes rig pa'i brtul zhugs kyi sbyor ba gsungs pa /
translated: The application of the conduct of knowledge is stated:

original: dam tshig gi rdo rje nyid khro bo de'i ming yin te /
analyzed: dam tshig gi rdo rje nyid khro bo de'i ming yin te /
translated: The name of that very wrathful one is the pledge vajra.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje'i skrag par bya ba'i ched du khro bo'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje'i skrag par bya ba'i ched du khro bo'o //
translated: He is wrathful for the purpose of terrifying the vajras of all the Tathagatas.

original: gru gsum ni gru gsum gyi hom khung ngo //
analyzed: gru gsum ni gru gsum gyi hom khung ngo //
translated: The triangle is the hearth of the triangle.

original: sbyin sreg gi cho ga 'di yang bzang po zhabs kyi sbyin sreg gi cho ga'i rjes su 'brangs te shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin sreg gi cho ga 'di yang bzang po zhabs kyi sbyin sreg gi cho ga'i rjes su 'brangs te shes par bya'o //
translated: This rite of the burnt offering should be understood according to the rite of the burnt offering of Bhavyakara.

original: sngags 'di nyid kyi sbyor ba ston pa ni nag po'i tshes bcu bzhi 'am brgyad la cho gas sbyor ba dang ldan par byas te sngon gyi bsnyen pas 'di sgrub po //
analyzed: sngags 'di nyid kyi sbyor ba ston pa ni nag po'i tshes bcu bzhi 'am brgyad la cho gas sbyor ba dang ldan par byas te sngon gyi bsnyen pas 'di sgrub po //
translated: The teaching of the application of this very mantra is that, on the fourteenth or eighth day of the dark half of the month, one should perform the rite with the application of the prior service, and accomplish this.

original: tho bas brdung bar bya ste sgrub pa pos bsgrub bya brdung bar bya'o //
analyzed: tho bas brdung bar bya ste sgrub pa pos bsgrub bya brdung bar bya'o //
translated: One should strike with the hammer, and the practitioner should strike the victim.

original: yi ge h'um las byung ba 'bar ba'i phreng ba 'khrugs pa rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsams te gnod mdzes la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas sdang pa gang gi steng du dbab par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge h'um las byung ba 'bar ba'i phreng ba 'khrugs pa rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsams te gnod mdzes la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas sdang pa gang gi steng du dbab par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine a five-pronged vajra arisen from the syllable hūṃ, blazing with a garland of flames, and with the application of Sumbha-ni-sūdha, one should strike down upon the head of whomever is to be subdued.

original: des de nyams par byed do //
analyzed: des de nyams par byed do //
translated: It destroys that.

original: phyag na sta re zhes pa la yi ge phat las skyes pa khro bo'i bdag nyid 'bar ba phyag g-yas na sta re thogs pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: phyag na sta re zhes pa la yi ge phat las skyes pa khro bo'i bdag nyid 'bar ba phyag g-yas na sta re thogs pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The one with an axe in his hand means that one should imagine that one has arisen from the syllable phaṭ, with an angry nature, blazing, holding an axe in the right hand.

original: las kyi rdo rje ni kun du phyogs pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje rtse mo nyi shu pa'o //🔽kha dog ser po rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po la @123a * //
analyzed: las kyi rdo rje ni kun du phyogs pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje rtse mo nyi shu pa'o // kha dog ser po rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po la @123a * //
translated: The karma-vajra is a twenty-spoked multicolored vajra, facing in all directions.🔽The color is yellow.

original: sogs pa'i sbyor bas grong la sogs pa'i steng gi bar snang la yi ge kham las byung ba kha dog ser po'i sna tshogs rdo rje mngon par 'dod pa'i phyogs su bkab nas gnas pa'i dbus su yi ge h'um las skyes pa'i rdo rje chen po mgo steng
analyzed: sogs pa'i sbyor bas grong la sogs pa'i steng gi bar snang la yi ge kham las byung ba kha dog ser po'i sna tshogs rdo rje mngon par 'dod pa'i phyogs su bkab nas gnas pa'i dbus su yi ge h'um las skyes pa'i rdo rje chen po mgo steng
translated: Through the yoga of Mahāvajradhara and so forth, in the sky above the village and so forth, from the syllable khaṃ arises a multicolored vajra, yellow in color, imagined to cover the desired direction, and in the middle of that, from the syllable hūṃ, one should imagine a great vajra-spike facing upward.

original: du bltas pa nges par bya ste de'i lte ba la rnal 'byor pa de nyid kyis 'dug ste rang gi ba spu'i bu ga las byung ba'i 'od zer ser po rnams kyis thams cad bkab par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: du bltas pa nges par bya ste de'i lte ba la rnal 'byor pa de nyid kyis 'dug ste rang gi ba spu'i bu ga las byung ba'i 'od zer ser po rnams kyis thams cad bkab par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In the middle of that, the yogin himself sits, and he imagines that yellow light rays arise from his pores and cover everything.

original: de ltar na mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas las phyi ngos su char 'bab po zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas las phyi ngos su char 'bab po zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, the meaning is that rain falls from the side outside the desired place.

original: dkyil 'khor bri ba na rlung dang char pa la sogs pa gal te 'byung na de'i tshe mche ba'i phyag rgya ste bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i rnam pa kun gyi mchog ldan pa'i skur bsams na sdang ba rnams kyi dgra brlag par 'gyur ba ste de nyid kyi sngags
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bri ba na rlung dang char pa la sogs pa gal te 'byung na de'i tshe mche ba'i phyag rgya ste bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i rnam pa kun gyi mchog ldan pa'i skur bsams na sdang ba rnams kyi dgra brlag par 'gyur ba ste de nyid kyi sngags
translated: When drawing the maṇḍala, if wind, rain, and so on occur, then if one imagines the form of Amṛtakuṇḍali, the supreme of all endowed with the supreme of all, with the fanged mudra, the enemies of the angry ones will be destroyed.

original: kyi rgyal po dran par bya ste bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: kyi rgyal po dran par bya ste bklag par bya'o //
translated: One should recall, should recite, the king of mantras of just that [Amṛtakuṇḍali].

original: lag pa'i phyag rgya bcing mi bya //
analyzed: lag pa'i phyag rgya bcing mi bya //
translated: One should not bind the hand mudra.

original: gal te dngos grub 'dod na ni //
analyzed: gal te dngos grub 'dod na ni //
translated: If one desires power,

original: zhes 'dir brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'dir brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is stated here.

original: de brjod pa /
analyzed: de brjod pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: phyag rgya chen po'i mche ba gtsigs //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i mche ba gtsigs //
translated: The great mudra is the bared fangs.

original: sdang ba'i dgra ni sngags rgyal po //
analyzed: sdang ba'i dgra ni sngags rgyal po //
translated: The enemy of the angry ones is the king of mantras.

original: zhes so // phab nas byang chub thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: zhes so // phab nas byang chub thob par 'gyur //
translated: Having brought down, one will attain enlightenment.

original: zhes pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pas rang gi dkyil 'khor du gnas te ngos rnams su spyan la sogs par byin gyis brlabs pa'i btsun mo bzhi ji skad brjod pas bzhag nas dbus su rang gi rig mar byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyi rol gyi
analyzed: zhes pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pas rang gi dkyil 'khor du gnas te ngos rnams su spyan la sogs par byin gyis brlabs pa'i btsun mo bzhi ji skad brjod pas bzhag nas dbus su rang gi rig mar byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyi rol gyi
translated: This is the yoga of glorious Vajrasattva, who, abiding in his own maṇḍala, having blessed the four queens such as Locanā in the cardinal directions, as described, and having blessed his own knowledge consort in the center,

original: bud med dang gnyis su med pa dang ldan pas gsang ba'i rdo rjes rig ma'i padma rgya bskyed de yi ge h'um nam mkha'i khams kyi dbus su gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: bud med dang gnyis su med pa dang ldan pas gsang ba'i rdo rjes rig ma'i padma rgya bskyed de yi ge h'um nam mkha'i khams kyi dbus su gnas par bya ste /
translated: he should expand the lotus of the knowledge consort with his secret vajra, who is nondual with the external woman, and the syllable hūṃ should be placed in the middle of the realm of space.

original: yang dag par sbyor ba las byung ba'i rdo rje can dkar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis gang ba spros nas rang gi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje rnams la nang du bstims te bsgrubs na byang chub mngon du byed do zhes pa'i don to
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor ba las byung ba'i rdo rje can dkar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis gang ba spros nas rang gi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje rnams la nang du bstims te bsgrubs na byang chub mngon du byed do zhes pa'i don to
translated: The meaning is that if one practices, emanating the white Vajrī and so on, filled with light rays, and dissolving them into one’s body, speech, and mind vajras, one will manifest enlightenment.

original: // gsang ba blangs nas zhes pa ni 'jam dpal gyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas rig pa'i brtul zhugs spyad pa la ci ltar bstan pa'i btsun mo dben par rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas te gsang ba'i mchod pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems 'od zer dang
analyzed: // gsang ba blangs nas zhes pa ni 'jam dpal gyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas rig pa'i brtul zhugs spyad pa la ci ltar bstan pa'i btsun mo dben par rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas te gsang ba'i mchod pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems 'od zer dang
translated: Taking the secret means that one who is endowed with the yoga of Manjusri, who practices the spiritual deportment of knowledge, who is in a solitary place with a queen as taught, who is in one's own mandala, takes the bodhicitta arising from the secret worship, together with light rays.

original: bcas pa blangs te zhes pa'i don to //🔽sangs rgyas kyis mi mthong zhes pa ni rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor gyi dkyil 'khor la gnas te snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pas bza' bar @123b bya ba la sogs pa la yi ge gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs te rdo rje la sogs pa'i lam nas phyung
analyzed: bcas pa blangs te zhes pa'i don to // sangs rgyas kyis mi mthong zhes pa ni rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor gyi dkyil 'khor la gnas te snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pas bza' bar @123b bya ba la sogs pa la yi ge gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs te rdo rje la sogs pa'i lam nas phyung
translated: This is the meaning of taking the secret.

original: ba sngon du 'gro bas kham phor kha sbyar gyi nang du bzhag ste rang gi sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pas bsngags par bya ste de zos na sangs rgyas kyis kyang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: ba sngon du 'gro bas kham phor kha sbyar gyi nang du bzhag ste rang gi sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pas bsngags par bya ste de zos na sangs rgyas kyis kyang mi mthong ngo //
translated: The line the Buddhas do not see means that one who is endowed with the yoga of one's deity, who is in the mandala, who is in union, who is consecrated with the three syllables in the act of eating, and so on, who has previously emitted the bodhicitta through the vajra and so on, who places it in a joined pair of bowls, and who consecrates it with one's mantra one hundred and eight times, should eat it. The Buddhas do not see him.

original: 'di'i don nyid gsal por byed pas bshad pa zhes pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: 'di'i don nyid gsal por byed pas bshad pa zhes pa la sogs pas so //
translated: This very meaning is clarified by the words “explanation” and so forth.

original: kha sbyar ba yi sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: kha sbyar ba yi sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the yoga of union

original: zhes pa ni rang gi rig mar byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyi rol gyi bud med dang gnyis su med par gyur pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang gi rig mar byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyi rol gyi bud med dang gnyis su med par gyur pas so //
translated: means by becoming nondual with the external woman who is empowered as one’s knowledge consort.🔽The copper, silver, and gold are the three metals, which are purified by the three syllables.

original: zangs dang dngul dang gser gyis dkris pa ni lcags gsum gyis dkris pa yin te 'di rnams yi ge gsum gyis sbyangs te dbang po gnyis kyi sbyor ba dang ldan pa nyid kyis mtshan ma thob pa la thug pas bsgrubs na de ltar mthong bar mi 'gyur ro
analyzed: zangs dang dngul dang gser gyis dkris pa ni lcags gsum gyis dkris pa yin te 'di rnams yi ge gsum gyis sbyangs te dbang po gnyis kyi sbyor ba dang ldan pa nyid kyis mtshan ma thob pa la thug pas bsgrubs na de ltar mthong bar mi 'gyur ro
translated: By the yoga of the two organs, one should practice until the signs are obtained.

original: // ga bur ni byang chub kyi sems yin la tsandan ni tshil bu yin te /
analyzed: // ga bur ni byang chub kyi sems yin la tsandan ni tshil bu yin te /
translated: Camphor is bodhicitta, and sandalwood is marrow.

original: snying ni gi wang yin la /🔽aa ka ru ni rnam par snang mdzad yin zhing /
analyzed: snying ni gi wang yin la / aa ka ru ni rnam par snang mdzad yin zhing /
translated: The heart is vermillion,🔽and agarwood is Vairocana.

original: gur gum ni chu ser yin no //
analyzed: gur gum ni chu ser yin no //
translated: Saffron is pus.

original: mi snang ba ni lha'i sbyor bas bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: mi snang ba ni lha'i sbyor bas bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa /
translated: “Invisibility” and so on are said to be

original: byin gyis brlabs zhes pa la sogs pa la phyag rgya chen po ni gang yang rung ba'i rdo rje can gyi lha'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs zhes pa la sogs pa la phyag rgya chen po ni gang yang rung ba'i rdo rje can gyi lha'i ngo bo ste /
translated: As for empowerment, etc., the great seal is the nature of any deity with a vajra.

original: de bsgoms pa de ni de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bsgoms pa de ni de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By meditating on that, one becomes like that.

original: yang na gzugs khams gnas pa la //
analyzed: yang na gzugs khams gnas pa la //
translated: Or, in the abodes of the form realm

original: zhes pa ni gzugs kyi khams na bud med mi srid kyang shin tu bar brjod pas 'di ston par byed do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzugs kyi khams na bud med mi srid kyang shin tu bar brjod pas 'di ston par byed do //
translated: means that although women are not possible in the form realm, this is taught by the expression very much.

original: yang na gal te der yang rdzu 'phrul gyis sam rigs kyi bdag po 'gro ba srid na de rnams kyang zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang na gal te der yang rdzu 'phrul gyis sam rigs kyi bdag po 'gro ba srid na de rnams kyang zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Or, if it is possible to go there by magic or by the lord of the family, the meaning is those also.

original: da ni dbang bskur ba'i don nges pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni dbang bskur ba'i don nges pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the meaning of empowerment is stated:

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the union of Vajrasattva,

original: sangs rgyas rdo rje can mnyes 'gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdo rje can mnyes 'gyur //
translated: the buddhas, the vajra holders, are pleased.

original: zhes te / sems dpa' ni rdo rje sems dpa' sbyor ba ste shes rab dang thabs kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zhes te / sems dpa' ni rdo rje sems dpa' sbyor ba ste shes rab dang thabs kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The hero is Vajrasattva. The union is the nature of the meditative equipoise of wisdom and method.

original: des mnyes pa ni dbu rgyan gyi dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: des mnyes pa ni dbu rgyan gyi dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: Being pleased by that is the empowerment of the crown.

original: rdo rje can gyi ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje can gyi ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The vajra-holder’s is Akṣobhya.

original: rdo rje mi bskyod pa'i sbyor ba yis so //
analyzed: rdo rje mi bskyod pa'i sbyor ba yis so //
translated: By the union of Akṣobhya-vajra.

original: sangs rgyas ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: The Buddhas are Vairocana and so on.

original: mnyes pa zhes pa dang mngon par 'brel to //
analyzed: mnyes pa zhes pa dang mngon par 'brel to //
translated: The word “pleasing” is to be supplied.

original: sangs rgyas byang chub rab dbye bas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub rab dbye bas //
translated: The division of the enlightenment of the Buddhas

original: zhes te rdo rje 'dzin pa rnams ni de'i rigs rnams so //
analyzed: zhes te rdo rje 'dzin pa rnams ni de'i rigs rnams so //
translated: The vajra-holders are those of that family.

original: de nyid rnam par spros te gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par spros te gsungs pa /
translated: He himself elaborates on that and declares,

original: rdo rje spyan gyi gzugs la sogs //🔽zhes pa ste @124a * //
analyzed: rdo rje spyan gyi gzugs la sogs // zhes pa ste @124a * //
translated: The form of the vajra-eye, and so on.

original: de rnams la zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams la zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “those” is that.

original: gtsug tor ni dbu rgyan te bstan pa'i dbang ngo //
analyzed: gtsug tor ni dbu rgyan te bstan pa'i dbang ngo //
translated: The crown is the head ornament, the teaching power.

original: gtsug tor kyang 'khor los sgyur ba drug ste ci rigs par ro //
analyzed: gtsug tor kyang 'khor los sgyur ba drug ste ci rigs par ro //
translated: The crown is also the six world-emperors, as appropriate.🔽The six world-emperors of the knowledge-class

original: rig pa'i 'khor los sgyur rgyal drug / gtsug tor zhes ni rnam par 'byung //
analyzed: rig pa'i 'khor los sgyur rgyal drug / gtsug tor zhes ni rnam par 'byung //
translated: are said to be the crown.

original: zhes rgyud phyi ma las so //
analyzed: zhes rgyud phyi ma las so //
translated: In the Later Tantra.

original: khro bo gshin rje gshed la sogs pa rnams la yang de rnams kyi de mchog ni sangs rgyas rdo rje rab bsgoms te gshin rje mthar byed dang padma mthar byed dag la rab bsgoms pa ni rnam par snang mdzad dang snang ba mtha' yas bsgoms pa'o //
analyzed: khro bo gshin rje gshed la sogs pa rnams la yang de rnams kyi de mchog ni sangs rgyas rdo rje rab bsgoms te gshin rje mthar byed dang padma mthar byed dag la rab bsgoms pa ni rnam par snang mdzad dang snang ba mtha' yas bsgoms pa'o //
translated: Also, for the wrathful ones such as Yamantaka, their supreme one is the vajra of the Buddha, that is, one should meditate on the Buddha Vairochana for Yamantaka and Padmantaka.

original: shes rab mthar byed dang bgegs mthar byed dag la rdo rje rab tu bsgoms pa ni mi bskyod pa bsgoms pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab mthar byed dang bgegs mthar byed dag la rdo rje rab tu bsgoms pa ni mi bskyod pa bsgoms pa'o //
translated: For Wisdom-Indestructible and Obstacles-Indestructible, one should meditate on the vajra of the Indestructible Mind, that is, one should meditate on Akshobhya.

original: rig pa'i rgyal po chos mchog rnams //
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po chos mchog rnams //
translated: The supreme dharmas of the kings of knowledge

original: zhes pa ni rig pa'i mchog gi chos dri rdo rje la rin chen tog bsgoms pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rig pa'i mchog gi chos dri rdo rje la rin chen tog bsgoms pa'o //
translated: are the supreme knowledge vajra, and one should meditate on Ratnasambhava for the supreme dharma of the supreme knowledge vajra.

original: rig pa'i rgyal mo ni ro rdo rje ste 'di'i dbang bskur ba'i sbyor ba rnams la 'od dpag tu med pa bsgoms pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal mo ni ro rdo rje ste 'di'i dbang bskur ba'i sbyor ba rnams la 'od dpag tu med pa bsgoms pa'o //
translated: The queen of knowledge is the taste vajra, and one should meditate on Amitabha for the consecrations of this one.

original: thams cad las byed sngags zhes pa ni reg rdo rje yin te 'di las kyi rigs yin pa'i phyir don yod ye shes bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad las byed sngags zhes pa ni reg rdo rje yin te 'di las kyi rigs yin pa'i phyir don yod ye shes bsgom pa'o //
translated: The mantra that performs all actions is the touch vajra, and one should meditate on Amoghasiddhi for this one, because it is of the action family.

original: sngags rnams thams cad nyid la ni //
analyzed: sngags rnams thams cad nyid la ni //
translated: In all the mantras.

original: zhes pa ni sngags thams cad ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje ste thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de'i rdo rje sems dpa' rnam par bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngags thams cad ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje ste thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de'i rdo rje sems dpa' rnam par bsgom pa'o //
translated: All mantras are the vajra of the realm of phenomena, because they are the nature of everything. Therefore, one should meditate on Vajrasattva in them.

original: gzugs dang sgra rdo rje dag la ni rnam par snang mdzad dang mi bskyod pa dag rigs kyi bdag por blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra rdo rje dag la ni rnam par snang mdzad dang mi bskyod pa dag rigs kyi bdag por blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the vajras of form and sound, one should view Vairocana and Akshobhya as the lords of the families.

original: rgyud gzhan du grags pa'i gnod sbyin mo rnams gzugs la sogs pa spras pa'i rnam pa sngags gang gis rgyas par byed pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan du grags pa'i gnod sbyin mo rnams gzugs la sogs pa spras pa'i rnam pa sngags gang gis rgyas par byed pa de de bzhin no //

analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' ni ji skad du brjod pa'i mi bskyod pa'o //

analyzed: bsam gtan rab tu brtag ces pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
