analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dang mnyam pa yang zhes @126a * //
translated: “Even if one is equal to Vajrasattva”

original: pa'i don to //🔽sangs rgyas gnod byed dgra la ni //
analyzed: pa'i don to // sangs rgyas gnod byed dgra la ni //
translated: means that one will die.🔽“The Buddhas are the enemy who harms”

original: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa la gnod pa byas nas 'gyod pa skyes par gyur pa 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa la gnod pa byas nas 'gyod pa skyes par gyur pa 'jigs pa'o //
translated: means that one is afraid of having aroused regret after having harmed the Buddhas and so on.

original: 'jigs pas 'khrugs zhes pa ni dmyal bar ltung bas 'jigs shing brgyal bar gyur pa skyabs med cing yongs su skyob pa med pa skra grol ba sgren mo mar nag gis byugs pa'i lus la sngar brjod pa'i rim pas kha sbyar dbye bar bya ste /🔽me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas par bsams nas de la phan pa nyid kyis khro bo'i nyams dang ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor pa'i dbus su gnas nas bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i khro bo'i rnal 'byor pas srin po la sogs pa spros pa rnams kyis skrag par byas shing za bar
analyzed: 'jigs pas 'khrugs zhes pa ni dmyal bar ltung bas 'jigs shing brgyal bar gyur pa skyabs med cing yongs su skyob pa med pa skra grol ba sgren mo mar nag gis byugs pa'i lus la sngar brjod pa'i rim pas kha sbyar dbye bar bya ste / me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas par bsams nas de la phan pa nyid kyis khro bo'i nyams dang ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor pa'i dbus su gnas nas bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i khro bo'i rnal 'byor pas srin po la sogs pa spros pa rnams kyis skrag par byas shing za bar
translated: “Agitated by fear” means that one should imagine that the person has fainted from fear of falling into hell, is without refuge, and is completely unprotected, with loose hair, naked, and with a body smeared with black oil.🔽Then, in the manner described previously, one should open the embrace, imagining that the person is standing in the middle of a circle of fire.

original: bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, for the sake of benefiting that person, the yogin of Amṛtakuṇḍali, who is endowed with the experience of wrathfulness, should imagine that the person is frightened by the emanations of rākṣasas and so forth, and is being devoured by them.

original: de'i rnam par shes pa yang sngar bzhin du mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub sems dpar bsgrubs te mngon par dga' ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams na gnas pa'i chos kyi rgyal por legs par bzhag nas dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pa yang sngar bzhin du mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub sems dpar bsgrubs te mngon par dga' ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams na gnas pa'i chos kyi rgyal por legs par bzhag nas dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: His consciousness, as before, is established as the nature of Akṣobhya, the Bodhisattva, and is well-placed as the Dharma King who resides in the world of Abhirati, and is consecrated.

original: sbrul nag ces pa la sogs pa la 'chi bdag gi bdud kyi 'jigs pa yang 'jigs pa ster bar byed pas 'jigs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sbrul nag ces pa la sogs pa la 'chi bdag gi bdud kyi 'jigs pa yang 'jigs pa ster bar byed pas 'jigs par byed pa'o //
translated: The black snake and so forth are also frightening because they cause fear by the fear of the demon of death.

original: dug mchog dam tshig bsgom byas nas //
analyzed: dug mchog dam tshig bsgom byas nas //
translated: Having meditated on the supreme poison pledge,

original: zhes pa la yi ge nam gyis mngon par sngo ba'i klu rigs ldan gyi ngo bo ste de'i kha na gnas pa'i yi ge hr'i: 'od zer gyi lcags kyus khams gsum pa'i dug bkug ste yongs su gang bar bsgoms te che ge mo'i dpral ba la zo shig
analyzed: zhes pa la yi ge nam gyis mngon par sngo ba'i klu rigs ldan gyi ngo bo ste de'i kha na gnas pa'i yi ge hr'i: 'od zer gyi lcags kyus khams gsum pa'i dug bkug ste yongs su gang bar bsgoms te che ge mo'i dpral ba la zo shig
translated: The essence of the nāga lord, who is anointed with the syllable n, and the syllable hrīḥ, which resides in his mouth, with a hook of light rays, summons the poison of the three realms and meditates on it as completely filling him, and commands him, Eat the forehead of so-and-so!

original: ces de la bka' byin nas des zos te shi bar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ces de la bka' byin nas des zos te shi bar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: He should meditate on him eating it and dying.

original: de'i rnam par shes pa 'das ma thag pa bzhin du mi bskyod par bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pa 'das ma thag pa bzhin du mi bskyod par bskyed par bya'o //
translated: One should generate it as unshakable, like the immediately past consciousness.

original: phyogs bcu'i sems can thams cad kyi nye bar gnod pa la sogs pa bkug ste de bzhin du bsgrub bya'i lus po la chu bo ltar gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sems can thams cad kyi nye bar gnod pa la sogs pa bkug ste de bzhin du bsgrub bya'i lus po la chu bo ltar gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Having summoned all the harm to sentient beings in the ten directions, one should pour it into the body of the victim like a river.

original: tho ba yis zhes pa ni yi ge h'um las byung ba'i 'bar ba'i gzugs kyis so //
analyzed: tho ba yis zhes pa ni yi ge h'um las byung ba'i 'bar ba'i gzugs kyis so //
translated: With a hammer means with the blazing form arisen from the syllable hūṃ.

original: gsheg pa zhes pa la sogs pa la /🔽stva re la sogs pa'i lag pa'i rdo rje khro bo la sogs pa rnams kyis mnan nas dum bur byas par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: gsheg pa zhes pa la sogs pa la / stva re la sogs pa'i lag pa'i rdo rje khro bo la sogs pa rnams kyis mnan nas dum bur byas par bsam par bya'o //
translated: With a saw, etc.🔽One should imagine that the wrathful Vajrapāṇi, etc., having pressed down with the hands of Sattvavajrā, etc., cut it into pieces.

original: bsrung ba la sogs zhes pa ni sngar bzhin du lag na rdo rje lcags kyu thogs pa'i lha rang gi snying ga nas bton te des bsrung ba'i kha sbyar @126b la sogs pa dang lha rnams kyang bkug ste rang gi g-yon phyogs su gzhag ste 'phags pa bdud
analyzed: bsrung ba la sogs zhes pa ni sngar bzhin du lag na rdo rje lcags kyu thogs pa'i lha rang gi snying ga nas bton te des bsrung ba'i kha sbyar @126b la sogs pa dang lha rnams kyang bkug ste rang gi g-yon phyogs su gzhag ste 'phags pa bdud
translated: Protection, etc. means that, as before, one should summon the deity Vajrapāṇi holding a hook from one’s heart, and having made the protection circle, etc., and summoned the deities, one should place them to one’s left.

original: rtsi 'khyil pa'i phur bu nyid kyis aom gha gha zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags la sarba dusht'an sarba p'a pam zhes pa'i tshig gnyis po bor nas bsrung ba la sogs pa thams cad dang sngags dang lha rnams la yang phur bus thob cig ces bskul ba dang
analyzed: rtsi 'khyil pa'i phur bu nyid kyis aom gha gha zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags la sarba dusht'an sarba p'a pam zhes pa'i tshig gnyis po bor nas bsrung ba la sogs pa thams cad dang sngags dang lha rnams la yang phur bus thob cig ces bskul ba dang
translated: The kīla of the swirling poison, with the mantra “oṃ gha gha” and so on, omits the two phrases “all evil” and “all sin,” and the exhortation “strike all the mantras and deities with the kīla” in the protection and so on.

original: bcas pas brjod cing gdab po zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bcas pas brjod cing gdab po zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should recite and strike.

original: bsrung ba la sogs pa'i kha sbyar dbye ba'i dam tshig 'di 'da' bar mi bya ba'i phyir dang gsad pa thams cad la gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir yang gsad pa'i dam tshig gi mchog go //
analyzed: bsrung ba la sogs pa'i kha sbyar dbye ba'i dam tshig 'di 'da' bar mi bya ba'i phyir dang gsad pa thams cad la gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir yang gsad pa'i dam tshig gi mchog go //
translated: This pledge of the separation of the protection and so on is the supreme pledge of killing because it should not be transgressed and because it is foremost among all killings.

original: ji srid dbyer med pa'i phung po la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa rnams sems dpa' khro bo'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa de rnams thams cad gnag pa dang khros pa dang gdug pa tshar gcod pa la gcig tu mthar phyin pa
analyzed: ji srid dbyer med pa'i phung po la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa rnams sems dpa' khro bo'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa de rnams thams cad gnag pa dang khros pa dang gdug pa tshar gcod pa la gcig tu mthar phyin pa
translated: As long as the tathāgatas and so on, endowed with the aggregates and so on that are inseparable, abide in the maṇḍala of the wrathful beings, all of them are utterly perfected in the subduing of the dark, wrathful, and vicious.

original: rnams su bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rnams su bsgom par bya'o //
translated: should be meditated upon in the various places.

original: de ltar mnyes 'gyur gzhan du min //
analyzed: de ltar mnyes 'gyur gzhan du min //
translated: Thus they are pleased, not otherwise.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar nyid du ji ltar brjod pas rnal 'byor pas nyams su blangs na de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa rnams mnyes kyis gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar nyid du ji ltar brjod pas rnal 'byor pas nyams su blangs na de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa rnams mnyes kyis gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, if the yogi practices just as it has been explained, the Tathagatas, etc., are pleased, not otherwise.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i sgrub pa po rnams sangs rgyas la sogs par brjod de 'di nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te lha gzhan gyi sgom pa po yang gzung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i sgrub pa po rnams sangs rgyas la sogs par brjod de 'di nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te lha gzhan gyi sgom pa po yang gzung ngo //
translated: The practitioners of the Buddha, etc., are called the Buddha, etc. This is just an illustration, and the meditators on other deities are also included.

original: de rnams kyang sdig pa nye bar bsags pa dang bsrung ba la sogs pa phrogs pas gang la sbyar ba gang yang rung ba'i bsam gtan gyi sbyor bas 'chi bar 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams kyang sdig pa nye bar bsags pa dang bsrung ba la sogs pa phrogs pas gang la sbyar ba gang yang rung ba'i bsam gtan gyi sbyor bas 'chi bar 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
translated: And they, by the application of meditation to any object, are destroyed by the destruction of their evil accumulations and by the theft of their protection, etc. This is the meaning of “are destroyed.”

original: khro bo chen pos gsad pa'i phyir 'da' bar mi bya ba dang dbyer mi phyed pa'i phyir khro bo bstan pas drag po chen po'i dam tshig gi rdo rje khro bo ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: khro bo chen pos gsad pa'i phyir 'da' bar mi bya ba dang dbyer mi phyed pa'i phyir khro bo bstan pas drag po chen po'i dam tshig gi rdo rje khro bo ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The vajra wrathful one is glorious Vajrasattva, because of the great wrathful one’s teaching, for the sake of killing, in order not to transgress and in order to be inseparable.

original: rgyal po rdo rje 'dzin zhes pa la sogs pa'i dam tshig rnams kyis go rims ji bzhin du chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ye shes dang me long lta bu dang / so sor rtog pa dang mnyam pa nyid dang / bya ba nan tan gyi bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa yin te brjod pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po rdo rje 'dzin zhes pa la sogs pa'i dam tshig rnams kyis go rims ji bzhin du chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ye shes dang me long lta bu dang / so sor rtog pa dang mnyam pa nyid dang / bya ba nan tan gyi bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa yin te brjod pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The vajra-holding king, etc., are the pledges of the transcendent lords, respectively, the pristine awareness of the pure expanse of reality, the mirror-like, the individualizing, the sameness, and the pristine awareness that accomplishes deeds.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa'o //
translated: They are naturally pure, because of their natural purity.

original: ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rdo rje theg pa zhes te mi phyed pa'i theg pa'o //🔽de nyid thams cad las mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir @127a * //
analyzed: rdo rje theg pa zhes te mi phyed pa'i theg pa'o // de nyid thams cad las mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir @127a * //
translated: It is the vajra vehicle, the indestructible vehicle.

original: bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'o //
translated: It is unsurpassed, because it is supreme over all.🔽It is the great vehicle, because it is the vehicle of the great vehicle.

original: phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos ma skyes pa la yang kun rdzob tu drag po'i las kyi bya ba bskyed par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos ma skyes pa la yang kun rdzob tu drag po'i las kyi bya ba bskyed par bshad pa yin no //
translated: The nature of phenomena such as the aggregates, their characteristics, powers, fearlessnesses, and so on, are unborn, and it is explained that the activity of wrathful action is generated conventionally.

original: gang rnams kyis yin zhe na rgyal ba rnams kyis zhes te /
analyzed: gang rnams kyis yin zhe na rgyal ba rnams kyis zhes te /
translated: By whom? By the victors.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus pa las rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus pa las rgyal ba'o //
translated: The buddhas are victorious over all unfavorable conditions.

original: bsam gtan las skyes pa la ltos nas bri ba la sogs pa'i bya ba gtso bor gyur pas las phran tshegs kyi gsang ba yin te yi ge kham gis rdo rgyus dang dur khrod kyi sol ba la brgya rtsa brgyad du bsngags te de dag gis mi sdug
analyzed: bsam gtan las skyes pa la ltos nas bri ba la sogs pa'i bya ba gtso bor gyur pas las phran tshegs kyi gsang ba yin te yi ge kham gis rdo rgyus dang dur khrod kyi sol ba la brgya rtsa brgyad du bsngags te de dag gis mi sdug
translated: In dependence on the meditative absorptions, the activity of reduction and so on is primary. Therefore, this is the secret of the minor activities.

original: pa 'jigs su rung ba gnag pa 'bar bas 'khrugs shing khros pa lce gnyis pa so'i phreng ba can sbrul bris nas de'i khar yi ge kham me'i kha dog can ha la ha la'i dug gi bdag nyid can 'bar ba bsams te /
analyzed: pa 'jigs su rung ba gnag pa 'bar bas 'khrugs shing khros pa lce gnyis pa so'i phreng ba can sbrul bris nas de'i khar yi ge kham me'i kha dog can ha la ha la'i dug gi bdag nyid can 'bar ba bsams te /
translated: The terrifying, black, blazing, angry, two-tongued, fanged snake is drawn. In its mouth is the syllable kham, the color of fire, the nature of the poison of the hala hala, blazing.

original: bsgom pa 'dis 'di nges par gnas nas g-yo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa 'dis 'di nges par gnas nas g-yo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By this meditation, he will definitely move, having been made to tremble.

original: yi ge hr'i: yang de'i khar bsgoms te de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi lcags kyus khams gsum na yod pa'i dug sbrul gyi khar gzhug go //
analyzed: yi ge hr'i: yang de'i khar bsgoms te de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi lcags kyus khams gsum na yod pa'i dug sbrul gyi khar gzhug go //
translated: Also, the syllable hriḥ is meditated in its mouth. The light ray hook that arises from that inserts the poison existing in the three realms into the snake's mouth.

original: des reg pas sems can gyi khams 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des reg pas sems can gyi khams 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By touching it, the realm of sentient beings will die.

original: sbyor ba 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis //
analyzed: sbyor ba 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis //
translated: By the characteristic of the arising of the union

original: zhes pa ni 'das ma thag pa bzhin du yi ge kham gis mngon par bsngags te de dang de'i rjes su mthun pa'i kha dog gis dug sbal la sogs pa bris te de rnams kyi kha ru kham hr'i: de dang de de bzhin du bsams nas khams gsum
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'das ma thag pa bzhin du yi ge kham gis mngon par bsngags te de dang de'i rjes su mthun pa'i kha dog gis dug sbal la sogs pa bris te de rnams kyi kha ru kham hr'i: de dang de de bzhin du bsams nas khams gsum
translated: As before, the syllable kham is recited. The poison frog, etc., is drawn with a color corresponding to that. In their mouths, kham and hriḥ are meditated as such and such. The poison of the three realms

original: na yod pa'i dug bkug nas dbab par bya'o //
analyzed: na yod pa'i dug bkug nas dbab par bya'o //
translated: Having summoned the poison that is present, one should cause it to descend.

original: de ltar na sbal pa la sogs pa gang yang rung bas kyang reg pas de'i dus nyid ni 'jig par 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar na sbal pa la sogs pa gang yang rung bas kyang reg pas de'i dus nyid ni 'jig par 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, by the touch of any of the frogs, etc., it is destroyed at that very moment.

original: dug thams cad 'pho ba'i snying po zhes pa la ji ltar brjod pa'i rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas lag pa g-yas pa'i mthil du aom las byung ba'i 'od zer stug po'i 'khor lo dkar po rtsibs brgyad
analyzed: dug thams cad 'pho ba'i snying po zhes pa la ji ltar brjod pa'i rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas lag pa g-yas pa'i mthil du aom las byung ba'i 'od zer stug po'i 'khor lo dkar po rtsibs brgyad
translated: The essence of the transference of all poisons: abiding in one's own maṇḍala as described, endowed with the yoga of Vairocana, on the palm of the right hand, from the syllable oṃ, one should imagine a white wheel of dense light rays, with eight spokes,

original: pa'i lte ba la aom 'od zer dkar po stug po rnam par bsams te nges byabs pas ci ltar 'dod par nam mkha'i dkyil dang dbyug pa dang kham phor la sogs pa la yang rim pa 'dis bstan pa dang / g-yo ba'i dug 'pho bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: pa'i lte ba la aom 'od zer dkar po stug po rnam par bsams te nges byabs pas ci ltar 'dod par nam mkha'i dkyil dang dbyug pa dang kham phor la sogs pa la yang rim pa 'dis bstan pa dang / g-yo ba'i dug 'pho bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: in the center of which is the syllable oṃ, with dense white light rays. Having visualized that, one should transfer the moving poison, as one wishes, into the sky, or into a stick, or a bowl, etc., by this process.

original: dug chen po 'da' bar bya ba ma @127b yin pa dang dbyer mi phyed pa'i don //
analyzed: dug chen po 'da' bar bya ba ma @127b yin pa dang dbyer mi phyed pa'i don //
translated: The meaning of “indivisible” is that it is not to be transcended, like a great poison.

original: ston pas dug chen po'i dam tshig rdo rje ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: ston pas dug chen po'i dam tshig rdo rje ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The teacher’s “great poison pledge vajra” is glorious Vajrasattva.

original: de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pas dug bcos pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pas dug bcos pa gsungs pa /
translated: “This” and so forth teaches the antidote to poison.

original: bsgrub bya'i snying gar rdo rje grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rdo rje snying po yin la de skad du brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i snying gar rdo rje grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rdo rje snying po yin la de skad du brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: Since the heart of the vajra is the cause of the accomplishment of the vajra, it is the heart of the vajra, and it is said to be so.

original: rten dang brten par bcas pa'i 'khor lo'i dbus su rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas bsgrub bya'i snying gar yi ge h'um las byung ba rdo rje dkar po las 'thon pa'i zla ba dkar po zhu ba'i rnam pa'i 'od zer gyi sprin gyis
analyzed: rten dang brten par bcas pa'i 'khor lo'i dbus su rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas bsgrub bya'i snying gar yi ge h'um las byung ba rdo rje dkar po las 'thon pa'i zla ba dkar po zhu ba'i rnam pa'i 'od zer gyi sprin gyis
translated: In the center of the wheel with its support and supported, one who is endowed with the yoga of Great Vajradhara should visualize at the heart of the one to be benefited a white moon arisen from the syllable hūṃ, and a white vajra arisen from the syllable hūṃ.

original: de'i lus la mngon par khyab par bya ste de rnams nyid kyis snying ga dang mgrin pa dang dpral ba dang mgo bo la gnas pa rnams phrogs pa dang ldan par lan gnyis lan gsum gyi bar du bsams te yang snying ga nas drangs te /
analyzed: de'i lus la mngon par khyab par bya ste de rnams nyid kyis snying ga dang mgrin pa dang dpral ba dang mgo bo la gnas pa rnams phrogs pa dang ldan par lan gnyis lan gsum gyi bar du bsams te yang snying ga nas drangs te /
translated: Having pervaded his body with those, one should imagine that they are possessed of the power to steal the [deities] located at the heart, throat, forehead, and head, and that they are drawn out from the heart twice or thrice.

original: thams cad skyug pa'i tshul gyis kha dog nag po 'byung bar bsgom par blta'o //
analyzed: thams cad skyug pa'i tshul gyis kha dog nag po 'byung bar bsgom par blta'o //
translated: One should imagine that they emerge as black in color in the manner of vomiting.

original: 'bras la sogs pa nye ba'i dug nyams par byed pa'i sbyor ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'bras la sogs pa nye ba'i dug nyams par byed pa'i sbyor ba gsungs pa /
translated: The application for destroying the proximate poisons such as aconite is stated:

original: de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, this and so forth.

original: gang gzhan zhes pa 'brum bu dang bas ldag dang g-yan pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang gzhan zhes pa 'brum bu dang bas ldag dang g-yan pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The others are smallpox, herpes, scabies, and so forth.

original: bsams pa tsam gyis med par 'gyur //
analyzed: bsams pa tsam gyis med par 'gyur //
translated: They are destroyed merely by thinking of it.

original: zhes pa la de ma thag pa bzhin du rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i 'od dpag tu med pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas lag pa g-yas par yi ge a'a: las bskyed pa'i padma 'dab ma brgyad pa dkar po'i lte ba la yi ge a'a: 'od zer
analyzed: zhes pa la de ma thag pa bzhin du rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i 'od dpag tu med pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas lag pa g-yas par yi ge a'a: las bskyed pa'i padma 'dab ma brgyad pa dkar po'i lte ba la yi ge a'a: 'od zer
translated: Just as before, endowed with the yoga of the immeasurable one abiding in one's mandala, one should imagine an eight-petaled white lotus generated from the syllable A on one's right hand, with the syllable A

analyzed: lnga 'bar ba bsams te des byab par bya ste spar bas khu tshur du bsdus pa'i tshul gyis kha dog dkar po drangs nas yi ge a'a: la gzhug par bya'o //
translated: in the center of the lotus blazing with five-colored light-rays. With that one should wipe [the wound], the meaning being that one should draw out the white-colored [poison] by the method of clenching one's fist, and insert it into the syllable A.

original: bskul ba na ni dkar po 'dra //
analyzed: bskul ba na ni dkar po 'dra //

original: zhes pa yi ge a'a: brjod cing bskul bas dug med par gyur pa'i kha dog dkar por bskul bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa yi ge a'a: brjod cing bskul bas dug med par gyur pa'i kha dog dkar por bskul bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should urge the white-colored [poison] to become free of poison by uttering the syllable A and urging it.

original: 'di zhes pa ni brjod ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes pa ni brjod ma thag pa'o //
translated: This refers to what was just said.

original: gsang ba'i de kho na nyid sbas pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i de kho na nyid sbas pa'o //
translated: The secret reality is hidden.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes bskyed pa'i phyir ye shes bskyed sprul lo //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes bskyed pa'i phyir ye shes bskyed sprul lo //
translated: Because it generates the gnosis of omniscience, it is the emanation that generates gnosis.

original: phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi nad gso ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi nad gso ba gsungs pa /
translated: The healing of the disease of the outer and inner self is stated.

original: sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i sbyor bas de'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus na gnas pa lus dang ngag dang yid las spre'u'i gzugs sam sgren mo yi dags kyi gzugs kyi nad phyung ste lag par 'khor lo la sogs pa bsgoms te de rnams kyis thal bar bya'o //
analyzed: sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i sbyor bas de'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus na gnas pa lus dang ngag dang yid las spre'u'i gzugs sam sgren mo yi dags kyi gzugs kyi nad phyung ste lag par 'khor lo la sogs pa bsgoms te de rnams kyis thal bar bya'o //
translated: By the yoga of Vajra Body, etc., one should imagine that the disease is extracted from the body, speech, and mind in the form of a monkey or a naked ghost, and that it is placed in the center of the mandala, and that it is ground to dust by those visualized on the wheel, etc., in the hand.

original: de la khros par bsams @128a * //
analyzed: de la khros par bsams @128a * //
translated: Then, imagining that the disease is angry,

original: nas ni // zhes pa la nad la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa khros pa rnams kyis thal bar byed par rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: nas ni // zhes pa la nad la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa khros pa rnams kyis thal bar byed par rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: one should imagine that all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas equal to the atoms of all world-realms, angry, reduce the disease to dust.

original: des na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams kyis rang gi lus dang ngag dang yid rnams dgang bar bya'o //
analyzed: des na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams kyis rang gi lus dang ngag dang yid rnams dgang bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should fill one's own body, speech, and mind with the bodies, speech, and minds of the Tathagatas.

original: thun bzhir nyi ma bdun rnams kyis //
analyzed: thun bzhir nyi ma bdun rnams kyis //
translated: In four sessions, by the seven suns.

original: zhes pa la rang gi lha'i sngags kyis kyang sbyor ba 'di zhag bdun bsgoms pas nges par nad thams cad zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa la rang gi lha'i sngags kyis kyang sbyor ba 'di zhag bdun bsgoms pas nges par nad thams cad zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this practice, meditating for seven days with the mantra of one’s deity, all illnesses will certainly be eliminated.

original: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa ji skad brjod pa'i cho gas sbyor ba bsgoms pa la dga' bar 'gyur ba de nyid kyi tshe rmi lam mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa ji skad brjod pa'i cho gas sbyor ba bsgoms pa la dga' bar 'gyur ba de nyid kyi tshe rmi lam mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the yogi/nī is delighted by the practice of meditation according to the rite as stated, then he/she will have dreams.

original: de nas phyis mngon sum nyid du rang gi lha'i ngo bo'i bdag nyid du rmi lam du mthong ba de bzhin du des bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyis mngon sum nyid du rang gi lha'i ngo bo'i bdag nyid du rmi lam du mthong ba de bzhin du des bsgom par bya'o //

original: sems gang gis des rmi lam mthong ba'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa de sgyu ma dang 'dra bar 'khrul pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: sems gang gis des rmi lam mthong ba'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa de sgyu ma dang 'dra bar 'khrul pa'i ngo bo yin te /

original: don dam par med pa de'i phyir rmi lam na dmigs pa'i chos 'di rnams ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par med pa de'i phyir rmi lam na dmigs pa'i chos 'di rnams ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: Since it does not exist ultimately, these phenomena observed in a dream are equal to space.

original: des na chos med chos nyid kyang med do zhes so //
analyzed: des na chos med chos nyid kyang med do zhes so //
translated: Therefore, there is no phenomenon, and even the nature of phenomena does not exist.

original: sad pa rnams kyi yang gang rab tu snang ba thob pa de rnams kyang chos nyid 'di yin no zhes pa ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: sad pa rnams kyi yang gang rab tu snang ba thob pa de rnams kyang chos nyid 'di yin no zhes pa ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The import of the summary is this: the import of the verse is that the nature of things is just this, that is, the attainment of the appearance of things to those who are awakened, and also the attainment of the appearance of things to those who are asleep.

original: dbye ba rnam pa gnyis su mthong //
analyzed: dbye ba rnam pa gnyis su mthong //
translated: The verse is seen to have two divisions.

original: zhes pa ni las dang po pa ye shes la 'jug pa thob pa dag gi rmi lam dag dang ye shes la dbang thob pas mngon sum du sad pa'i gnas skabs kyang ngo //

original: rang gi sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin la yang sems shes pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa bdun gyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin la yang sems shes pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa bdun gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: One's mind is the fundamental consciousness, and the other mind is the seven consciousnesses that are not fundamental.

original: dmigs pa ni de'i rten yin pa'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni de'i rten yin pa'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'o //

original: de la chos thams cad ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'o //
analyzed: de la chos thams cad ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'o //

original: don dam par nam mkha' rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa'o //

original: de nyid gnas yin te rdzas med par mnyam pa nyid kyi chos thams cad med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa des na thams cad kyi rjes su song ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid gnas yin te rdzas med par mnyam pa nyid kyi chos thams cad med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa des na thams cad kyi rjes su song ba yin no //
translated: That is the abode, the equality of the absence of substance, the nature of the absence of all dharmas. Therefore, it is omnipresent.

original: rigs thams @129b cad dang sems can thams cad kyi sems yin no //
analyzed: rigs thams @129b cad dang sems can thams cad kyi sems yin no //
translated: It is the mind of all families and all sentient beings.

original: de rnams kyi dam tshig ni rigs lnga'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dam tshig ni rigs lnga'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams so //
translated: Their commitment is the body, speech, and mind of the five families.

original: de nyid snying po yin la de nyid rdo rje yin te de las byung ba'o zhes snying po zhabs kyis so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid snying po yin la de nyid rdo rje yin te de las byung ba'o zhes snying po zhabs kyis so zhes bshad do //
translated: The venerable Ghantapa explains that it is the essence, and that is the vajra, because it arises from that.

original: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyan las le'u bco lnga pa'o ;
analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyan las le'u bco lnga pa'o ;
translated: This concludes the fifteenth chapter of the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra.

original: // / de nas zhes pa ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gcig pu brjod pa la /
analyzed: // / de nas zhes pa ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gcig pu brjod pa la /
translated: Then, after the single mandala of mind has been described,

original: ci gcig pu nyid yin nam 'on te gzhan yang yod /
analyzed: ci gcig pu nyid yin nam 'on te gzhan yang yod /
translated: it is asked, is it only one, or are there others?

original: ci yang de la gzhan ci bya //
analyzed: ci yang de la gzhan ci bya //
translated: What else is there to do with it?

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gdul bya'i dpyod pa yongs su shes pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gdul bya'i dpyod pa yongs su shes pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: and so forth, after the complete knowledge of the analysis of the disciples.

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: All mandalas are the mandala of mind and so forth.

original: de rnams nyid seng ge lta bur seng ge ste nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i ri dags 'jigs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams nyid seng ge lta bur seng ge ste nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i ri dags 'jigs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are like lions, because they frighten the deer of afflictions and so forth.

original: de nyid dam tshig yin te /
analyzed: de nyid dam tshig yin te /
translated: That itself is the commitment.

original: des rgyal bar byed cing gsal bar byed pas rgyal po ste de'i tshogs gang yin pa de yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: des rgyal bar byed cing gsal bar byed pas rgyal po ste de'i tshogs gang yin pa de yang de bzhin no //
translated: It is the king because it conquers and illuminates, and the assembly of those is also like that.

original: rdo rje sku'i dkyil 'khor ni sprul pa'i sku rnam par dag pa sku rdo rje bdag po'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: rdo rje sku'i dkyil 'khor ni sprul pa'i sku rnam par dag pa sku rdo rje bdag po'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The mandala of the vajra body is the mandala of the lord of the body vajra, the pure emanation body.

original: thugs kyi rdo rje dang 'dra ba ni thugs kyi rdo rje lta bu ste /
analyzed: thugs kyi rdo rje dang 'dra ba ni thugs kyi rdo rje lta bu ste /
translated: Like the vajra of mind means like the vajra of mind.

original: sku yang thugs kyi rang bzhin yin //
analyzed: sku yang thugs kyi rang bzhin yin //
translated: The body is also the nature of mind.

original: zhes pa'i bsam pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bsam pas so //
translated: This is the thought.

original: phyag rgya nyid ni phyag mtshan gyi rang bzhin gyi rdo rje'i gnas so //
analyzed: phyag rgya nyid ni phyag mtshan gyi rang bzhin gyi rdo rje'i gnas so //
translated: The seal itself is the abode of the vajra, which is the nature of the hand implement.

original: dbus su rnam par snang mdzad kyi gnas su sku rdo rje'o ;
analyzed: dbus su rnam par snang mdzad kyi gnas su sku rdo rje'o ;
translated: In the center, in the abode of Vairocana, is the body vajra.

original: / mi bskyod pa la sogs pa yang shar phyogs la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams su bri'o //
analyzed: / mi bskyod pa la sogs pa yang shar phyogs la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams su bri'o //
translated: Akṣobhya and so forth are drawn in the east and so forth.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje mchog ni spyan la sogs pa dang gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje mchog ni spyan la sogs pa dang gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
translated: The supreme vajra of body, speech, and mind are Locanā and so forth and Rūpavajrā and so forth.

original: grva rnams kun ni snying po dang phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi grva rnams su'o //
analyzed: grva rnams kun ni snying po dang phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi grva rnams su'o //
translated: In all the corners means in the corners of the inner and outer mandalas.

original: khro bo rnams kyang gshin rje gshed la sogs pa rnams te sgo rnams su sgo skyong rnams bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: khro bo rnams kyang gshin rje gshed la sogs pa rnams te sgo rnams su sgo skyong rnams bri bar bya'o //
translated: The wrathful ones are also the Yamāntaka and so forth, and the gate protectors are drawn in the gates.

original: mchod pa bya zhes pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa la sogs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: mchod pa bya zhes pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa la sogs pa gsungs pa /
translated: The phrase one should make offerings and so forth teaches the accomplishment of the maṇḍala and so forth.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rnam par dag pa gsung rdo rje dkyil 'khor ni gsung gi dkyil 'khor ro / thugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab 'dra ba //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rnam par dag pa gsung rdo rje dkyil 'khor ni gsung gi dkyil 'khor ro / thugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab 'dra ba //
translated: The maṇḍala of Vajra Speech is the maṇḍala of speech, the purity of the Enjoyment Body.

original: zhes pa 'di la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa 'di la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of the maṇḍala of mind.

original: rdo rje bsgoms pas zhes pa ni lha'i rnal 'byor pas so //
analyzed: rdo rje bsgoms pas zhes pa ni lha'i rnal 'byor pas so //
translated: The phrase by meditating on the vajra refers to the yoga of the deity.

original: rdo rje chos kyir gyal po che //
analyzed: rdo rje chos kyir gyal po che //
translated: The great king of Vajra Dharma

original: zhes pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: is Amitābha.

original: de'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi dbus kyi 'khor lo ni snying po'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi dbus kyi 'khor lo ni snying po'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: Therefore, the wheel in the center of the maṇḍala is the essence maṇḍala.

original: zlum po kun du bri bar bya'o //🔽tshe dpag @130a * //
analyzed: zlum po kun du bri bar bya'o // tshe dpag @130a * //
translated: It should be drawn all around, round.

original: med pa'i phyag rgya che //
analyzed: med pa'i phyag rgya che //
translated: The great seal of Amitāyus

original: zhes pa ni padma'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni padma'o //
translated: is the lotus.

original: de nyid brjod ma thag pa nyid rdo rje'i gnas te phyag mtshan gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de nyid brjod ma thag pa nyid rdo rje'i gnas te phyag mtshan gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: That very thing just mentioned is the vajra abode, the seal of the hand implement.

original: dkyil 'khor pa thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor pa thams cad kyi'o //
translated: It is for all the maṇḍala deities.

original: yongs su gsal ba zhes pa la sogs pa ni dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: yongs su gsal ba zhes pa la sogs pa ni dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The completely clear, etc. , refers to the accomplishment of the mandala, etc.

original: bdag po'i lha rnams bsgre ba gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bdag po'i lha rnams bsgre ba gsungs pa ni /
translated: The lord deities are mentioned:

original: rdo rje 'dzin mchog gang yin pa //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin mchog gang yin pa //
translated: The supreme vajra-holder

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'o //
translated: refers to Vajrasattva, etc.

original: dbus su zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi'o //
analyzed: dbus su zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi'o //
translated: In the center means in the mandala.

original: gzugs ni lus te bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni lus te bri bar bya'o //
translated: The form is the body, which is to be drawn.

original: de'i dkyil 'khor gnas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i dkyil 'khor gnas su 'gyur ro //
translated: That is the mandala site.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: gang zhig dbus su gnas par gyur pa yi //
analyzed: gang zhig dbus su gnas par gyur pa yi //
translated: The one who is in the center

original: 'khor lo de yang de yi yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khor lo de yang de yi yin par 'gyur //
translated: is also the wheel of that.

original: zhes so // dkyil 'khor thams cad 'byung ba ni gang las so //
analyzed: zhes so // dkyil 'khor thams cad 'byung ba ni gang las so //
translated: The source of all mandalas is from that.

original: sna tshogs pa sprul pa'i tshogs nyid rdo rje yin pa de dag go //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa sprul pa'i tshogs nyid rdo rje yin pa de dag go //
translated: The various emanated hosts are vajras.

original: rdo rje dkyil 'khor gyi sngags nyid ni snying po rnams te de rnams nyid skud pa spyad pa'i ched du yi ge'i tshig rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje dkyil 'khor gyi sngags nyid ni snying po rnams te de rnams nyid skud pa spyad pa'i ched du yi ge'i tshig rnams so //
translated: The mantras of the vajra mandala are the essences. Those very [mantras] are the syllabic phrases for the purpose of the thread.

original: gdab pa ni rdo rje'i skud pa dang rdul tshon kyang gdab pa'o //
analyzed: gdab pa ni rdo rje'i skud pa dang rdul tshon kyang gdab pa'o //
translated: The “casting” is the casting of the vajra thread and the colored powder.

original: sngags kyi sems dpas mi bya ste //
analyzed: sngags kyi sems dpas mi bya ste //
translated: The mantra-hero should not do it.

original: zhes pa la sngags ni shes rab dang snying rje'i bdag nyid de dang por bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes pa la sngags ni shes rab dang snying rje'i bdag nyid de dang por bshad zin to //
translated: The mantra is the nature of wisdom and compassion, and was explained previously.

original: de'i rang bzhin gyi sems dpa'i sems gang yin pa ste des ye shes la 'jug pa thob pas rang nyid kyis zhes pa ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyi sems dpa'i sems gang yin pa ste des ye shes la 'jug pa thob pas rang nyid kyis zhes pa ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The mind of the hero who has that nature is the mind of the hero. Since he has attained the intuition-hero, he himself does it. The rest is self-evident.

original: rang gis byas nas phyi'i rnam par g-yeng bas byang chub rnyed dka' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gis byas nas phyi'i rnam par g-yeng bas byang chub rnyed dka' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having done it himself, he should not be distracted by external things, because enlightenment is difficult to attain.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pas de'i phyir dam tshig tshul shes pa ni rnal 'byor pa ste ye shes la 'jug pa thob pas ye shes gyi rang bzhin lha rnams spros te bsgoms pas nges par byas te de'i sku la sogs pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa'i gnas
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pas de'i phyir dam tshig tshul shes pa ni rnal 'byor pa ste ye shes la 'jug pa thob pas ye shes gyi rang bzhin lha rnams spros te bsgoms pas nges par byas te de'i sku la sogs pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa'i gnas
translated: Since it is so, therefore the one who knows the method of the vow is the yogin, who has attained the intuition-hero, and has emanated the gods who are the nature of intuition, and has meditated on them. He should be certain, and should bless his own body, etc.

original: bsgoms la dkyil 'khor rnams rnam par brtags te dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgoms la dkyil 'khor rnams rnam par brtags te dgod par bya'o //
translated: Having meditated on the places of the blessing of the body, etc. of the deity, he should imagine the mandalas and place them.

original: bla ma'i gzugs su khye'u byas la rnam par snang mdzad kyi gnas dbab par bya'o //
analyzed: bla ma'i gzugs su khye'u byas la rnam par snang mdzad kyi gnas dbab par bya'o //
translated: One should cause the descent of the consecration of Vairocana in the form of a boy, the form of the guru.

original: slob ma de spyan gyi gzugs su yang bya ste skud pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa'o zhes thams cad du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: slob ma de spyan gyi gzugs su yang bya ste skud pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa'o zhes thams cad du blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should view all of this as the disciple in the form of Locana, performing the actions of holding the thread, and so forth.

original: 'dis sku'i dkyil 'khor gnas yid du 'ong ba sprul pas rdo rje sku'i yon tan thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis sku'i dkyil 'khor gnas yid du 'ong ba sprul pas rdo rje sku'i yon tan thob pa'o //
translated: By this, one attains the quality of the vajra body, through the emanation of the pleasing abode of the body mandala.

original: rdo rje chos kyi rgyal po ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje chos kyi rgyal po ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The king of vajra dharma is Amitābha.

original: rang gi chos ma ni rang gi rang bzhin gyis gos dkar @130b mo dbab par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi chos ma ni rang gi rang bzhin gyis gos dkar @130b mo dbab par bya'o //
translated: One should cause the descent of one’s own dharma mother, one’s own nature of Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' rgyal po che //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' rgyal po che //
translated: The great king Vajrasattva

original: zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa yin la m'a ma k'i yang dbab par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa yin la m'a ma k'i yang dbab par bya'o //
translated: is Akṣobhya, and one should cause the descent of Māmakī.

original: de ltar byas na zhes pa la sogs pas ni 'bras bu gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas na zhes pa la sogs pas ni 'bras bu gsungs pa'o //
translated: Thus, by doing this, and so forth, the result is stated.

original: nye bar byed pa na byin gyis rlob pa yin la dbang ba ni phul du byung ba'i mthar thug pa thob pas shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin te byon nas gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor gsum gyi mchog 'dri bar mdzad pa yin la rab tu dgyes pa dang ldan
analyzed: nye bar byed pa na byin gyis rlob pa yin la dbang ba ni phul du byung ba'i mthar thug pa thob pas shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin te byon nas gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor gsum gyi mchog 'dri bar mdzad pa yin la rab tu dgyes pa dang ldan
translated: Having come, he is the one who draws the supreme of the three secret mandalas.

original: pa ni gzhan gyi don gzigs pas so //
analyzed: pa ni gzhan gyi don gzigs pas so //
translated: He is endowed with great delight, since he sees the benefit of others.

original: cho ga 'di dag gang gis bya zhe na /
analyzed: cho ga 'di dag gang gis bya zhe na /
translated: By whom are these rites to be performed?

original: sngags kyi dngos grub thob ste ye shes la 'jug pa thob pa'i sngags pas so //
analyzed: sngags kyi dngos grub thob ste ye shes la 'jug pa thob pa'i sngags pas so //
translated: By the mantrin who has attained the powers of mantra, who has attained the entry to pristine consciousness.

original: ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is he like?

original: gsang ba rmad du byung ba chen po yin te 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsang ba rmad du byung ba chen po yin te 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the great marvel of the secret, since he is supramundane.

original: de dag gis dkyil 'khor byas nas rnal 'byor pa de ltar gyur pas kyang dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa la sogs pa rang nyid nyams su blang ngo zhes rtogs par bya ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de dag gis dkyil 'khor byas nas rnal 'byor pa de ltar gyur pas kyang dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa la sogs pa rang nyid nyams su blang ngo zhes rtogs par bya ba gsungs pa /
translated: Having made the mandala with those, the practitioner who has become like that should practice the accomplishment of the mandala, and so on, himself.

original: khro bo'i rgyal pos bkug nas ni //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal pos bkug nas ni //
translated: Having summoned with the king of wrathful ones,

original: zhes pa ni gshin rje gshed yin la 'di yang mtshon pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni gshin rje gshed yin la 'di yang mtshon pa tsam yin te /
translated: This is Yamantaka, and this is just an illustration.

original: sgo skyong bzhi rnams kyis las byas nas bsgrubs te mchod pa bya'o //
analyzed: sgo skyong bzhi rnams kyis las byas nas bsgrubs te mchod pa bya'o //
translated: Having performed the action, one should accomplish and make offerings with the four door-guardians.

original: sku gsum gyi dam tshig gi mchod pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsum gyi dam tshig gi mchod pa'o //
translated: This is the offering of the pledge of the three bodies.

original: gang gi yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi yin zhe na /
translated: Whose?

original: rdo rje gsum po'i ste dri ma ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste dri ma spangs pa'i rdo rje can gyis bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum po'i ste dri ma ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste dri ma spangs pa'i rdo rje can gyis bya'o //
translated: The one with the three vajras, the one with the vajra of the abandonment of the defilements of passion and so forth.

original: rdo rje gsum gyi sbyor ba zhes pa ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyi sbyor ba zhes pa ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: The union of the three vajras is with the union of the vajra body and so forth.

original: de skad brjod pa /
analyzed: de skad brjod pa /
translated: Having said that,🔽in the mind, one should say the invocation

original: thugs la mi bskyod m'a ma k'i //
analyzed: thugs la mi bskyod m'a ma k'i //
translated: of Mamaki, the unmoving one.

original: 'bebs par yang dag brjod pa yin //
analyzed: 'bebs par yang dag brjod pa yin //
translated: In the speech, one should say the invocation

original: ngag las gos dkar 'od dpag med //
analyzed: ngag las gos dkar 'od dpag med //
translated: of Pandara, the infinite light.

original: sku la spyan dang rtag pa'o //
analyzed: sku la spyan dang rtag pa'o //
translated: In the body, one should say the invocation🔽of Locana, the eternal one.

original: thugs dang gsung dang sku bskul bas //
analyzed: thugs dang gsung dang sku bskul bas //
translated: The invocation of the mind, speech, and body

original: spras pa ngo mtshar rmad byung ba //
analyzed: spras pa ngo mtshar rmad byung ba //
translated: is the marvelous wonder.

original: zhes so // da ni gtor ma'i cho ga gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // da ni gtor ma'i cho ga gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the rite of the sacrificial cake is stated:

original: sngags rnams thams cad nyid la yang //
analyzed: sngags rnams thams cad nyid la yang //
translated: For all the mantras,

original: zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams la gtor ma sbyin par bya'o ;
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams la gtor ma sbyin par bya'o ;
translated: This is the offering of the sacrificial cake to the mundane and supramundane.

original: / gtor ma 'di yang man ngag las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: / gtor ma 'di yang man ngag las shes par bya'o //
translated: And this sacrificial cake is to be known from the esoteric instructions.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na rmad du byung ba chen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na rmad du byung ba chen po'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the great wonder.

original: rnal 'byor dang bla na med pa'i rgyud la sogs pa dang thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dang bla na med pa'i rgyud la sogs pa dang thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is common to the Yoga and unexcelled tantras, etc.

original: da ni las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor pas bri ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi thig gi cho ga gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor pas bri ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi thig gi cho ga gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the ritual of the thread-cross mandala to be drawn by the beginner yogi is stated:

original: @131a * // thig gdab pa yi cho ga 'di //
analyzed: @131a * // thig gdab pa yi cho ga 'di //
translated: This ritual of the thread-cross

original: gang tshe bdag nyid kyis spyod pa //
analyzed: gang tshe bdag nyid kyis spyod pa //
translated: when one practices it oneself,

original: zhes te mtshan ma thob pas gang gi tshe lha phab nas dkyil 'khor 'dri ba rnal 'byor pas mi nus na de'i tshe sku rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor sku rdo rje'i rnal 'byor gyis te sgrub pa'i grogs mchog ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen por bsgoms nas thig gdab
analyzed: zhes te mtshan ma thob pas gang gi tshe lha phab nas dkyil 'khor 'dri ba rnal 'byor pas mi nus na de'i tshe sku rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor sku rdo rje'i rnal 'byor gyis te sgrub pa'i grogs mchog ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen por bsgoms nas thig gdab
translated: when the one who has obtained the signs is unable to draw the mandala after summoning the deity, then at that time the yogi should draw the mandala of Body-Vajra with the yoga of Body-Vajra, and the best assistant for the practice should be visualized as the Great Vajra-Holder.

original: par bya'o // mi bskyod pa'i dkyil 'khor la mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor gyis te sgrub pa'i grogs mchog ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'o //

original: grub pa'i pho nya'i gzugs kyi sku gsung thugs la byin gyis brlab pa 'di nyid kyis bya'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i pho nya'i gzugs kyi sku gsung thugs la byin gyis brlab pa 'di nyid kyis bya'o //
translated: The consecration of the body, speech, and mind of the messenger in the form of the accomplishment should be done with this very [consecration].

original: gsang ba'i gnas ni gzhag par bya //
analyzed: gsang ba'i gnas ni gzhag par bya //
translated: The line the secret place should be placed is

original: zhes pa la phyag na rdo rje'i gzugs kyi man ngag gzhug pa'i spyi bor /
analyzed: zhes pa la phyag na rdo rje'i gzugs kyi man ngag gzhug pa'i spyi bor /
translated: the instruction for placing the form of Vajrapāṇi on the crown.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i ji lta ba'i mi bskyod pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i ji lta ba'i mi bskyod pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should visualize Akṣobhya on the moon disk in the heart.

original: de bzhin du phyag na padma'i gzugs la 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyag na padma'i gzugs la 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: Similarly, one should visualize Amitābha on a lotus form in the hand.

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i gzugs kyi spyi bor rnam par snang mdzad bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i gzugs kyi spyi bor rnam par snang mdzad bsam par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should visualize Vairocana on the crown of an Aparājitā form.

original: 'di nyid @134b 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid @134b 'chad pa ni /
translated: This is explained:

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dbus gnas pa //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dbus gnas pa //
translated: In the center of the sun disk,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: bskul ba ni snying gar ro //
analyzed: bskul ba ni snying gar ro //
translated: The incantation is in the heart.

original: thams cad rnams zhes pa ni ji skad brjod pa'i mngag gzhug pa rnams so //
analyzed: thams cad rnams zhes pa ni ji skad brjod pa'i mngag gzhug pa rnams so //
translated: All means the previously mentioned messengers.

original: sdug bsngal rnon po ni 'chad par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnon po ni 'chad par 'gyur bas so //
translated: Sharp pain is explained below.

original: de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pas ni rdo rje can thams cad kyi mngag gzhug pa rnams kyi snying po bskul ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pas ni rdo rje can thams cad kyi mngag gzhug pa rnams kyi snying po bskul ba gsungs pa /
translated: Here, beginning with “In this way,” he states the incantation for all the vajra messengers.

original: mdung rtse chen po zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: mdung rtse chen po zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: With the words “great spear” and so on.

original: rang gi lag pa na gnas pa'i yi ge aom las skyes pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa mdung rtse dang rdo rje dang lcags kyu la sogs pa rnams kyis snying gar gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi lag pa na gnas pa'i yi ge aom las skyes pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa mdung rtse dang rdo rje dang lcags kyu la sogs pa rnams kyis snying gar gdab par bya'o //
translated: With the syllable oṃ in one’s hand, one should stab the heart with various forms such as a spear-point, a vajra, a hook, and so on.

original: cho ga 'dis bskul ba na mngon par 'dod pa'i mngag gzhug rnams 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cho ga 'dis bskul ba na mngon par 'dod pa'i mngag gzhug rnams 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one impels with this rite, the desired service will be accomplished.

original: de grub pas phyis rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de grub pas phyis rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: By its accomplishment, later perfect awakening will be accomplished.

original: ri zhes pa la sogs pa mngag gzhug sgrub pa'i gnas gsungs so ;
analyzed: ri zhes pa la sogs pa mngag gzhug sgrub pa'i gnas gsungs so ;
translated: The verse beginning with “mountain” teaches the place for accomplishing service.

original: / zla ba phyed ces pa la sogs pa la ji skad du brjod pa'i dam tshig dang sdom pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgoms pas sems brtan par
analyzed: / zla ba phyed ces pa la sogs pa la ji skad du brjod pa'i dam tshig dang sdom pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgoms pas sems brtan par
translated: In the verse beginning with “half-month,” a yogin who abides in the vows and commitments as stated, possessing the yoga of any of Vajrasattva and so on, by cultivating the subtle yoga, the mind becomes stable.

original: byas pa'am / dpag tu med pa'i bzlas pa sngon du song bas lha'i rjes su gnang bas bzlas pa 'bum byas pa slar yang mngag gzhug sgrub pa'i rjes su gnang ba yod na ri bo la sogs pa'i gnas rnams su sngar bzhin du mngon par sbyangs te /
analyzed: byas pa'am / dpag tu med pa'i bzlas pa sngon du song bas lha'i rjes su gnang bas bzlas pa 'bum byas pa slar yang mngag gzhug sgrub pa'i rjes su gnang ba yod na ri bo la sogs pa'i gnas rnams su sngar bzhin du mngon par sbyangs te /
translated: Having performed the recitation of the deity's permission, which is either a hundred thousand recitations or an immeasurable recitation, if one has the permission of the evocation of the messenger, one should again perform the evocation in a place such as a mountain, as before.

original: sgrub thabs su brjod pa'i cho gas dpal rdo rje sems dpa' dang gsungs dang sku rdo rje rnams kyis gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor bya ste /
analyzed: sgrub thabs su brjod pa'i cho gas dpal rdo rje sems dpa' dang gsungs dang sku rdo rje rnams kyis gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor bya ste /
translated: One should perform the yoga of any of the vajras of body, speech, or mind, glorious Vajrasattva, by the rite stated in the evocation text.

original: de bzhin du sgrub pa chen po la thug pa'i cho ga nyams su blangs nas lha mo'i tshogs rang gi rig ma'i padmar bcug nas 'dod chags kyi mes zhu ba zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par yongs su gyur par bsgom par bya'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin du sgrub pa chen po la thug pa'i cho ga nyams su blangs nas lha mo'i tshogs rang gi rig ma'i padmar bcug nas 'dod chags kyi mes zhu ba zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par yongs su gyur par bsgom par bya'o ;
translated: Similarly, having performed the rite up to the great evocation, one should meditate that the host of goddesses enter into one's knowledge-woman's lotus, and melt by the fire of passion, and transform into the form of a moon-disc.

original: / de nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de la ji skad du brjod pa'i yi ge hr'i: mgo gyen du bltas pa bsgoms nas de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis nam mkha'i khams thams cad du khyab pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yang dag par reg🔽nas de rnams kyi sku dang gsung @135a * //🔽dang thugs a'a:kham kha zhes pa'i yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid yang dag par bsdus nas yi ge hr'i: la bcug ste de yongs su gyur pa las phyag na rdo rje dang 'jig rten dbang phyug dang gzhan gyis mi thub pa rnams gang yang rung ba'i mngag gzhug
analyzed: / de nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de la ji skad du brjod pa'i yi ge hr'i: mgo gyen du bltas pa bsgoms nas de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis nam mkha'i khams thams cad du khyab pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yang dag par reg nas de rnams kyi sku dang gsung @135a * // dang thugs a'a:kham kha zhes pa'i yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid yang dag par bsdus nas yi ge hr'i: la bcug ste de yongs su gyur pa las phyag na rdo rje dang 'jig rten dbang phyug dang gzhan gyis mi thub pa rnams gang yang rung ba'i mngag gzhug
translated: Then, having meditated on that moon mandala with the syllable hriḥ, its head facing upward, as described, the assembly of light rays that arise from it completely pervades the realm of space, and all tathāgatas are truly touched.🔽Having completely gathered their body, speech, and mind into the nature of the three syllables aḥ khaṃ and khaṃ, they are placed into the syllable hriḥ.

original: pa'i gzugs yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: pa'i gzugs yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: From that completely transforming, one should make any of the forms of Vajrapāṇi, Lokeśvara, or Aparājitā, which are the messengers.

original: yi ge gsum pa 'di nyid kyis de'i sku dang gsung dang thugs la sku rdo rje la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis byin gyis brlabs nas 'di nyid brjod de phyung nas mdun du thal mo sbyar bar rnam par bsams nas de'i mgo bo la gsang ba'i gnas bsgoms
analyzed: yi ge gsum pa 'di nyid kyis de'i sku dang gsung dang thugs la sku rdo rje la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis byin gyis brlabs nas 'di nyid brjod de phyung nas mdun du thal mo sbyar bar rnam par bsams nas de'i mgo bo la gsang ba'i gnas bsgoms
translated: having uttered this, having imagined that he joins his palms in front, having meditated on the secret place on his head,

original: nas ji skad brjod pa'i lag pa na gnas pa'i lcags kyu la sogs pa rnams kyis mngag gzhug pa rnams kyi snying gar bsnun par thun bzhi ru bsgoms pas nges par zla ba phyed kyi nang nyid du mngag gzhug pa 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to
analyzed: nas ji skad brjod pa'i lag pa na gnas pa'i lcags kyu la sogs pa rnams kyis mngag gzhug pa rnams kyi snying gar bsnun par thun bzhi ru bsgoms pas nges par zla ba phyed kyi nang nyid du mngag gzhug pa 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to
translated: having struck the heart of the servants with the hook, etc., which are located in the hands as described, in four sessions, in this way, in just half a month, the servants will certainly be accomplished.

original: // 'da' bar mi bya ba yin pa'i phyir dbyer med pa mngag gzhug sgrub pa'i thabs ston pa'i bdag nyid bzhed pa chen po'i rang bzhin ni rdo rje bzhad pa ste /
analyzed: // 'da' bar mi bya ba yin pa'i phyir dbyer med pa mngag gzhug sgrub pa'i thabs ston pa'i bdag nyid bzhed pa chen po'i rang bzhin ni rdo rje bzhad pa ste /
translated: The great lord, whose nature is the great desire that teaches the method of accomplishing the servants who are inseparable because they are not to be transcended, is Vajra Smile.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: He is glorious Vajrasattva.

original: de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor du rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i bdag po'i rang bzhin dgod pa ni rdzogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor du rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i bdag po'i rang bzhin dgod pa ni rdzogs par byed pa ste /
translated: Here, this refers to the mandala of Vajrasattva and so forth, and placing means to establish the nature of the lord in the mandala.

original: mngag gzhug gi gzugs kyis lus dang ngag dang yid la yang dgod par byas nas bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: mngag gzhug gi gzugs kyis lus dang ngag dang yid la yang dgod par byas nas bskul bar bya'o //
translated: Having placed it in the body, speech, and mind in the form of a servant, one should urge it.

original: de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa ni sbyor ba gzhan gsungs so //
analyzed: de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa ni sbyor ba gzhan gsungs so //
translated: Here, this and so forth refers to another application.

original: dbyer med pa'i me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ni rdo rje ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor te ;
analyzed: dbyer med pa'i me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ni rdo rje ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor te ;
translated: The mandala that is the nature of the five intuitions such as the mirror intuition and so forth is the vajra intuition mandala.

original: der mngag gzhug sgrub pa las 'da' bar mi bya ba'i don te rtogs shing go bar byed pas dam tshig gi gnas so //
analyzed: der mngag gzhug sgrub pa las 'da' bar mi bya ba'i don te rtogs shing go bar byed pas dam tshig gi gnas so //
translated: One should not transgress the servant in that mandala, and since one should understand and realize it, it is the place of pledge.

original: de yang rnam pa bzhi ste dam tshig bskul ba zhes pa ni rang gi lag na gnas pa'i yi ge aom las byung ba'i lcags kyu 'bar ba rnams kyis de'i snying gar brdeg cing a'a:kham kha zhes brjod cing skul bar byed do //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bzhi ste dam tshig bskul ba zhes pa ni rang gi lag na gnas pa'i yi ge aom las byung ba'i lcags kyu 'bar ba rnams kyis de'i snying gar brdeg cing a'a:kham kha zhes brjod cing skul bar byed do //
translated: The “summoning of the pledge” is that, by means of hooks blazing forth from the syllable OṀ in one’s hand, one strikes the heart of the one to be summoned, and utters the syllable AḤ.

original: dam tshig gtong ba zhes pa ni khros shing 'bar ba nag po'i lus kyis de bzhin gshegs pa lnga spros nas de rnams kyi yan lag thams cad bkang ba yang nas yang du bsam par bya'o //🔽dam tshig 'bod pa zhes pa ni grub pa'i @135b don du sngags brjod pa sngon du song bas bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dam tshig gtong ba zhes pa ni khros shing 'bar ba nag po'i lus kyis de bzhin gshegs pa lnga spros nas de rnams kyi yan lag thams cad bkang ba yang nas yang du bsam par bya'o // dam tshig 'bod pa zhes pa ni grub pa'i @135b don du sngags brjod pa sngon du song bas bskul bar bya'o //
translated: The “giving of the pledge” is that, with an angry, blazing black body, one radiates forth the five Tathāgatas, and imagines that they fill all the limbs of the one to be given the pledge, again and again.🔽The “calling of the pledge” is that, for the sake of accomplishment, one should summon, having recited the mantra beforehand.

original: dam tshig bcing ba zhes pa ni grub pa'i mngag gzhug la rang gi bka' bsgoms sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dam tshig bcing ba zhes pa ni grub pa'i mngag gzhug la rang gi bka' bsgoms sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The “binding of the pledge” is that, for the sake of accomplishment, one should bind, having made the one to be bound listen to one’s command.

original: mkha' dbyings zhes pa la sogs pas dngos po med pa yang gzugs su byed do zhes shin tu bar brjod pas sgrub pa po rnams kyi sems brtan pa gsungs so //
analyzed: mkha' dbyings zhes pa la sogs pas dngos po med pa yang gzugs su byed do zhes shin tu bar brjod pas sgrub pa po rnams kyi sems brtan pa gsungs so //
translated: The expression in the realm of space and so on indicates that even non-entities are made into form. Thus, the firm resolve of the adepts is stated.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad bu gcig pa lta bur bcom ldan 'das gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad bu gcig pa lta bur bcom ldan 'das gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: The Blessed One is just like a father to all the Buddhas, as if they were his only son.

original: yang na sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rdul phra rab rnams kyis bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rdul phra rab rnams kyis bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, it is because he is generated by the atoms of all the Buddhas.

original: rdo rje 'jam pa stobs po che //
analyzed: rdo rje 'jam pa stobs po che //
translated: The Vajra Gentle Great Hero,

original: zhes pa la rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su chud pa padma dmar po zla ba'i dbus su gnas pa kha dog dmar po dang bsam pa yang ste de'i rang bzhin gyi lha rnams kyis 'khor lo yongs su bskor ba sgrub thabs kyi tshul gyis 'jam pa'i rdo
analyzed: zhes pa la rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su chud pa padma dmar po zla ba'i dbus su gnas pa kha dog dmar po dang bsam pa yang ste de'i rang bzhin gyi lha rnams kyis 'khor lo yongs su bskor ba sgrub thabs kyi tshul gyis 'jam pa'i rdo
translated: means that in the center of one's own mandala, on a red lotus in the middle of a moon, one should visualize the red Mañjuvajra, surrounded by the retinue of deities of the same nature, in the manner of the sādhana.

original: rje'i bdag nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rje'i bdag nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on oneself as having the nature of Mañjuvajra.

original: mda' lnga'i sbyor ba dag gis ni //
analyzed: mda' lnga'i sbyor ba dag gis ni //
translated: By the union of the five arrows,🔽 means that one should visualize the five Buddhas in the five places, and the five goddesses in the five places, in the manner of the sādhana.🔽 The five arrows are the five Buddhas.🔽 The five flowers are the five goddesses.

original: zhes pa ni mda' lnga po rnams kyi sbyor ba gzhu dang lhan cig pa'i sbyor ba ste de 'dzin pa yang ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mda' lnga po rnams kyi sbyor ba gzhu dang lhan cig pa'i sbyor ba ste de 'dzin pa yang ngo //
translated: This is the application of the five arrows together with the bow, and also the holding of them.

original: de myos byed dang rmongs par byed pa dang sreg par byed pa dang brgyal bar byed pa dang sems med par byed pa'i rang bzhin yi ge mam las skyes pa kha dog dmar po yi ge aom gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i stong gi cha dang /
analyzed: de myos byed dang rmongs par byed pa dang sreg par byed pa dang brgyal bar byed pa dang sems med par byed pa'i rang bzhin yi ge mam las skyes pa kha dog dmar po yi ge aom gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i stong gi cha dang /
translated: They are born from the syllable mam, which has the nature of intoxicating, stupefying, burning, fainting, and rendering senseless, and is red in color, consecrated by the syllable om, and one thousandth part of the arrow.

original: aa yis mnan pa'i mda'i cha dang / yi ge h'um gis byin gyis brlabs pa'i autpala dmar po'i 'dab ma dang 'dra ba'i mde'u'i cha yin te /
analyzed: aa yis mnan pa'i mda'i cha dang / yi ge h'um gis byin gyis brlabs pa'i autpala dmar po'i 'dab ma dang 'dra ba'i mde'u'i cha yin te /
translated: It is the part of the arrow that is pressed down by the syllable a, and is the part of the arrowhead that is consecrated by the syllable hum, and is like a petal of a red lotus.

original: mda' lnga rna ba'i bar du bkang ste gzhu 'dzin pa'i 'phags pa gshin rje gshed kha dog dang bsam pa dmar po byis pa'i cha byad can rang gi dbu rgyan du mi bskyod pa gnas pa'i sbyor bas spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: mda' lnga rna ba'i bar du bkang ste gzhu 'dzin pa'i 'phags pa gshin rje gshed kha dog dang bsam pa dmar po byis pa'i cha byad can rang gi dbu rgyan du mi bskyod pa gnas pa'i sbyor bas spro bar bya'o //
translated: One should emanate the five arrows up to the ears, and the bow, and the noble Yamantaka, who holds the bow, is red in color and thought, has the form of a youth, and has Akṣobhya residing in his crown ornament.

original: gnas lnga rnams su zhes pa la sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams kyi spyi bo dang snying ga dang lte ba dang gsang ba dang rkang pa'i mthil rnams su yang ngo //
analyzed: gnas lnga rnams su zhes pa la sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams kyi spyi bo dang snying ga dang lte ba dang gsang ba dang rkang pa'i mthil rnams su yang ngo //
translated: In the five places, means in the head, heart, navel, secret place, and soles of the feet of the Buddhas and so on.

original: rdo rje khro bos dbab par bya //
analyzed: rdo rje khro bos dbab par bya //
translated: The Vajra Wrathful One should cause them to fall.

original: zhes pa la rigs la gcig gi tshig go //
analyzed: zhes pa la rigs la gcig gi tshig go //
translated: Here, the word “one” is a generic term.

original: des ci ltar spros pa'i 'phags pa gshin rje gshed rnams kyis ci ltar brjod pa'i mda' rnams kyis go rims ji lta bar brjod ma thag pa'i gnas rnams su dbug par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //🔽dngangs shing brgyal bar bsgom par bya //
analyzed: des ci ltar spros pa'i 'phags pa gshin rje gshed rnams kyis ci ltar brjod pa'i mda' rnams kyis go rims ji lta bar brjod ma thag pa'i gnas rnams su dbug par bya'o zhes pa'i don to // dngangs shing brgyal bar bsgom par bya //
translated: The meaning is that the Ārya Yamāri deities emanated by him should pierce the places just mentioned with the arrows just mentioned, in the proper order.

original: zhes pa @136a * //
analyzed: zhes pa @136a * //
translated: One should meditate on them as frightened and fainting.

original: ni rang gis gsungs pa'i nyams pa las 'jigs pas skrag pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ni rang gis gsungs pa'i nyams pa las 'jigs pas skrag pa bzhin du'o //
translated: As if frightened by the transgression of their own vows.

original: byis pa'i blo ni grags chen gyis //
analyzed: byis pa'i blo ni grags chen gyis //
translated: The childish minds by the great fame.

original: zhes pa ni 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi dbu rgyan las skyes pa'i gshin rje gshed po rnams kyis so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi dbu rgyan las skyes pa'i gshin rje gshed po rnams kyis so //
translated: This means the Yamāri deities born from the crown of Ārya Mañjuśrī.

original: gsang ba'i bskul ba dag gis zhes pa ni brjod ma thag pa dag gis so //
analyzed: gsang ba'i bskul ba dag gis zhes pa ni brjod ma thag pa dag gis so //
translated: By the secret urgings means by the ones just mentioned.

original: dbyer mi phyed pa nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab kyi bdag nyid 'phags pa 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu ston par byed pas rdo rje'i don gyi blo ste rdo rje sems dpa' des so //
analyzed: dbyer mi phyed pa nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab kyi bdag nyid 'phags pa 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu ston par byed pas rdo rje'i don gyi blo ste rdo rje sems dpa' des so //
translated: The meaning of vajra is the mind of vajra-being, which is the teaching of the samadhi of noble Manjushri, whose nature is the wisdom that is the indivisible discernment.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam ste sems can rnams kyang ting nge 'dzin nyid kyis dbang du byas pa'i cho ga 'di yin no zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam ste sems can rnams kyang ting nge 'dzin nyid kyis dbang du byas pa'i cho ga 'di yin no zhes gsungs pa /
translated: The buddhas and so forth are just examples; the beings are also brought under control by the samadhi itself. This is the procedure, as stated:

original: nam mkha' rdo rjer zhes pa la sogs pa ste sngags kyi rdo rje ni yi ge h'um ngo //
analyzed: nam mkha' rdo rjer zhes pa la sogs pa ste sngags kyi rdo rje ni yi ge h'um ngo //
translated: The mantra vajra is the syllable hum.

original: de gang rnams la dang por yod pa de ni aom la sogs pa rnams te de bzhin du de rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de gang rnams la dang por yod pa de ni aom la sogs pa rnams te de bzhin du de rnams kyis so //
translated: Those who have it at the beginning have the om and so forth, and likewise by those.

original: rdo rje gsum la sogs par bsgom //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum la sogs par bsgom //
translated: Meditate on the three vajras and so forth.

original: zhes pa ni thugs rdo rje la sogs pa rnams 'jam pa'i rdo rje dang 'dra bar brjod pa'i kha dog dang bsam pa la sogs pa dang ldan par de rnams bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni thugs rdo rje la sogs pa rnams 'jam pa'i rdo rje dang 'dra bar brjod pa'i kha dog dang bsam pa la sogs pa dang ldan par de rnams bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should meditate on those, Vajra Mind and so forth, as having the color, thought, and so forth, as Mañjuvajra.

original: de bzhin du rang gi dbu rgyan la gnas pa'i rang gi bdag po las gnod mdzes rgyal po la sogs pa rang gi rigs kyi khro bo rnams spros pas sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams dbang du bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi dbu rgyan la gnas pa'i rang gi bdag po las gnod mdzes rgyal po la sogs pa rang gi rigs kyi khro bo rnams spros pas sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams dbang du bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should enthrall the Buddhas and so forth by means of the wrathful ones of one's own clan, such as Sumbharāja, emanated from one's own lord residing in one's crown.

original: aom yig mig gi dbus su zhes pa ni slob ma'i mig gi dbus su'o //
analyzed: aom yig mig gi dbus su zhes pa ni slob ma'i mig gi dbus su'o //
translated: The in the middle of the eye of the syllable Oṃ is in the middle of the eye of the disciple.

original: bstan zhes pa ni rten dang brtan pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: bstan zhes pa ni rten dang brtan pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The shown is the mandala of the support and the supported.

original: cho ga bzhin du zhes pa ni rim pa bzhin du ste de mthong ngo //
analyzed: cho ga bzhin du zhes pa ni rim pa bzhin du ste de mthong ngo //
translated: The according to the rite is in the proper order, and that is seen.

original: sngags rnams kun gyi gzugs ni lha'i gzugs so //
analyzed: sngags rnams kun gyi gzugs ni lha'i gzugs so //
translated: The form of all mantras is the form of the deity.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: mig tu 'bar bcas aom bsams la //
analyzed: mig tu 'bar bcas aom bsams la //
translated: The syllable Oṃ is contemplated in the eye with fire,🔽 and the eye of the disciple is anointed with the eye ointment of gold.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' deng khyod kyi //🔽mig 'byed pa la brtson par mdzad //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' deng khyod kyi //🔽mig 'byed pa la brtson par mdzad //
translated: Vajrasattva is now intent on opening your eye,

original: mig gis thams cad 'byed mdzad de //
analyzed: mig gis thams cad 'byed mdzad de //
translated: The eye is the illuminator of all,

original: rdo rje'i mig ni bla na med //
analyzed: rdo rje'i mig ni bla na med //
translated: the vajra eye is unsurpassed.

original: de nas 'khor lo bstan par bya //
analyzed: de nas 'khor lo bstan par bya //
translated: Then the wheel should be shown,

original: 'khor lo bdag po nas brtsams te //
analyzed: 'khor lo bdag po nas brtsams te //
translated: beginning with the lord of the wheel,

original: bdud rtsi thab sbyor bar du'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi thab sbyor bar du'o //
translated: up to the nectar cauldron.

original: zhes so // bkres skom la sogs zhes pa la sogs pas dngos grub chen po la sogs pa la zhugs pa'i bkres pa la sogs pa bsal ba'i rnal 'byor gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so // bkres skom la sogs zhes pa la sogs pas dngos grub chen po la sogs pa la zhugs pa'i bkres pa la sogs pa bsal ba'i rnal 'byor gsungs pa'o //
translated: By hunger, thirst, and so on and so forth, he teaches the yoga of dispelling the hunger and so on of one who has entered into the great powers and so on.

original: thams cad 'byor zhes pa ni sna tshogs pa'i ro dang ldan pa'i @136b bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad 'byor zhes pa ni sna tshogs pa'i ro dang ldan pa'i @136b bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa sgrub pa'o //
