original: bam yig kha yi nang du bsgom //
analyzed: bam yig kha yi nang du bsgom //
translated: The syllable vaṃ is meditated in the mouth.

original: zhes pa ni bum pa bzang po ser po'i rnam pa rang gi ma mchu la kha reg pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bum pa bzang po ser po'i rnam pa rang gi ma mchu la kha reg pa'o //
translated: This is the excellent vase, which is yellow in form, touching the mouth of one's lower lip.

original: aom ni lce la 'dug par bsam //
analyzed: aom ni lce la 'dug par bsam //
translated: Oṃ is thought to be located on the tongue.

original: zhes pa ni lce'i tshul du de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lce'i tshul du de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
translated: This is in the form of the tongue, which has become its nature.

original: kun gyi gnas zhes pa ni bde ba thams cad ster ba'i ro'i rten no //
analyzed: kun gyi gnas zhes pa ni bde ba thams cad ster ba'i ro'i rten no //
translated: The abode of all is the support of the flavor which bestows all bliss.

original: yid bzhin nor bus brgyan pa ste //
analyzed: yid bzhin nor bus brgyan pa ste //
translated: Adorned with the wish-fulfilling gem

original: zhes pa ni de'i steng du zla ba phyed par skyes pa'i kha chod kyis cung zad kha bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de'i steng du zla ba phyed par skyes pa'i kha chod kyis cung zad kha bcad pa'o //
translated: means that above it is a half-moon, which is a slightly open cover.

original: de'i yang steng du gnas pa'i thig le las byung ba rin po ches brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yang steng du gnas pa'i thig le las byung ba rin po ches brgyan pa'o //
translated: Above that is a drop, which is adorned with a gem.

original: bkres pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir sdug bsngal thams cad dang bral ba dang / bsam gtan gyi zas yin pa'i phyir zhi ba'o //
analyzed: bkres pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir sdug bsngal thams cad dang bral ba dang / bsam gtan gyi zas yin pa'i phyir zhi ba'o //
translated: It is free from all suffering because it is free from hunger and so forth, and it is peace because it is the food of concentration.

original: dbyer med pa'i ye shes las byung ba'i phyir ye shes rdo rje las byung ba'o //
analyzed: dbyer med pa'i ye shes las byung ba'i phyir ye shes rdo rje las byung ba'o //
translated: It is born from the vajra of wisdom because it arises from the wisdom of non-duality.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa'i zas sgrub par byed pa'i sbyor ba ston pas yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rdo rje ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'i zas sgrub par byed pa'i sbyor ba ston pas yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rdo rje ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The wish-fulfilling gem vajra is glorious Vajrasattva, who teaches the practice of accomplishing the food of desire.

original: nam mkha'i rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa la /
translated: The vajra of space, etc.

original: rdo rje sku gsum sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: rdo rje sku gsum sbyor ba yis //
translated: The vajra of the three bodies is the union of the three bodies.

original: zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor las byung ba'i sbyor ba yis so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor las byung ba'i sbyor ba yis so //
translated: This is the application arising from the yoga of Vairocana.

original: dpa' bo chen po rdo rje de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo chen po rdo rje de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The great hero should be contemplated as the nature of the Tathagata Vajra.

original: ser po rdo rje rnam 'phrul ba //
analyzed: ser po rdo rje rnam 'phrul ba //
translated: Yellow, with a vajra, he is the emanation.

original: zhes pa ni rtsa ba'i zhal dang sku mdog kyang gser gyi kha dog go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rtsa ba'i zhal dang sku mdog kyang gser gyi kha dog go //

original: g-yas dang g-yon pa na ni nag po dang dkar po'i zhal lo //
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon pa na ni nag po dang dkar po'i zhal lo //
translated: His right and left faces are black and white.

original: lhag ma ni rnam par snang mdzad bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rnam par snang mdzad bzhin no //

original: skul byed ma'i rnam pa'i kun du bzang po'i ting nge 'dzin gsungs pa /
analyzed: skul byed ma'i rnam pa'i kun du bzang po'i ting nge 'dzin gsungs pa /
translated: The samadhi of Samantabhadra in the form of Cunda is stated:

analyzed: kun nas dbyangs ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi dam pa'i chos ston pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The melody is the essence of the teaching of the sublime Dharma of the twelve branches of scripture.🔽The explanation of by the rite is:

analyzed: cho ga yis zhes pa 'di'i bshad pa ni rang gi de nyid las byung phyag mtshan las skyes pa'i /
translated: Born from one's own reality, arisen from the hand implement,

original: dpal ldan skul byed rab tu bsam //
analyzed: dpal ldan skul byed rab tu bsam //
translated: The glorious Cunda should be contemplated.

original: shel zla'i sku dang dbus kyi zhal //
analyzed: shel zla'i sku dang dbus kyi zhal //
translated: His body is crystal moon, his central face

original: zhal gnyis sngo dang dmar ba'o //
analyzed: zhal gnyis sngo dang dmar ba'o //
translated: The two faces are blue and red.

original: phyag gnyis yang dag 'khyud pa ni //
analyzed: phyag gnyis yang dag 'khyud pa ni //
translated: The two arms are in perfect embrace,

original: rang 'od thabs dang lus 'brel pa //
analyzed: rang 'od thabs dang lus 'brel pa //
translated: one's own light united with the method.

original: phyag na padma ral gri dang // rin chen rtsibs brgyad 'khor lo 'dzin //
analyzed: phyag na padma ral gri dang // rin chen rtsibs brgyad 'khor lo 'dzin //
translated: He holds a lotus, a sword, a jewel, and an eight-spoked wheel.

original: sna tshogs chu skyes 'dab zlar gnas //
analyzed: sna tshogs chu skyes 'dab zlar gnas //
translated: He abides on a multicolored lotus and moon.

original: rdo rje'i gdan dang zla ba'i 'od //
analyzed: rdo rje'i gdan dang zla ba'i 'od //
translated: The vajra seat and moon light

original: ces pa la sogs pa bzang po zhabs kyi'o //
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa bzang po zhabs kyi'o //
translated: are explained by Bhavyakīrti and others.

original: nyi ma'i gdan dang @137a * //
analyzed: nyi ma'i gdan dang @137a * //
translated: The sun seat

original: dkyil 'khor ro zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ro zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: and the maṇḍala are explained by others.

analyzed: nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo rgya che ba la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid kyi dzam bha la'i sgrub thabs gsungs pa /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad longs spyod pa ste nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin no //

original: 'di yang 'di ni bzang po'i zhabs kyis bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang 'di ni bzang po'i zhabs kyis bshad pa yin te /

original: shes rab thabs kyi rang bzhin sbyor //
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi rang bzhin sbyor //

original: dzam bha la ni gnod sbyin gzugs //
analyzed: dzam bha la ni gnod sbyin gzugs //

original: sna tshogs rdo rje zla dbus gnas //
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje zla dbus gnas //

original: rdo rje skyil krung gis gnas pa //🔽ser po nag po dkar 'od zhal //
analyzed: rdo rje skyil krung gis gnas pa // ser po nag po dkar 'od zhal //
translated: He is seated in the vajra posture,🔽yellow, with a black and white radiant face.

original: thugs kyi dbang pos spyi gtsug brgyan //
analyzed: thugs kyi dbang pos spyi gtsug brgyan //
translated: He is adorned with a crest of hair,

original: phyag gnyis kyis ni yang dag 'khyud //
analyzed: phyag gnyis kyis ni yang dag 'khyud //
translated: with two hands, he embraces,

original: rang 'od rig ma 'dzin dgyes pa //
analyzed: rang 'od rig ma 'dzin dgyes pa //
translated: delighting in holding his own light consort.🔽He holds a sword, a mongoose vomiting jewels,🔽and a skull filled with blood.

analyzed: b'i dza p'u ra ral gri dang // rin bzang skyug pa'i ne le dang // rang gi lha yi sbyor ba yis //

analyzed: rig ma'i padma'i nang gnas pa //
translated: he abides in the lotus of his consort.

original: thams cad phyogs nas rdzogs sangs rgyas //🔽'od byung rig ma'i tshogs rnams kyis //
analyzed: thams cad phyogs nas rdzogs sangs rgyas // 'od byung rig ma'i tshogs rnams kyis //
translated: All the perfect buddhas🔽are seen as always bestowing empowerment

original: rtag tu dbang bskur bar blta ste //
analyzed: rtag tu dbang bskur bar blta ste //
translated: with the host of light-born consorts.

analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yis rtag tu bsgom //

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /

analyzed: dzam nam mkha' rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Jambhala, Akāśa-vajra, and so on.

analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga rnams gnas lnga rnams te dbang po lnga rnams su'o //
translated: The five buddhas are in the five places, in the five sense faculties.

analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' ni mi bskyod pa'o zhes kha cig go //

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: Vajrasattva is the name of another.

analyzed: rdo rje bdud rtsi chu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bla ma las 'di'i don rtogs par bya'o //

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa las dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la nye bar longs spyod pa'i don du dpal ldan gnod sbyin mo ste de la dmigs pa dang de'i ming yang de bzhin du ting🔽nge 'dzin du brjod do //

translated: The samadhi is called by the name of the yakshini and the object of meditation on her.

original: gnod sbyin mo rnams thams cad rdo rje'i dam tshig gi gnas ni bskyed pa'i sa bon no //
analyzed: gnod sbyin mo rnams thams cad rdo rje'i dam tshig gi gnas ni bskyed pa'i sa bon no //
translated: The seed syllable of the generation of all the yakshinis is the vajra pledge.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus gnas par //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus gnas par //
translated: In the middle of the realm of space,

original: zhes pa ni mdun gyi nam mkha' la gru bzhi pa rin po che bzhi'i rang bzhin 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i gnod sbyin mo'i mdun du shel gyi rang bzhin dang g-yas su aindra n'i la lta bu dang rgyab tu padma r'a ga dmar po dang g-yon du rin po🔽che ljang gu'i rang bzhin dang dbus su bee d'u r+ya dang 'dra ba ni lugs so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mdun gyi nam mkha' la gru bzhi pa rin po che bzhi'i rang bzhin 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i gnod sbyin mo'i mdun du shel gyi rang bzhin dang g-yas su aindra n'i la lta bu dang rgyab tu padma r'a ga dmar po dang g-yon du rin po che ljang gu'i rang bzhin dang dbus su bee d'u r+ya dang 'dra ba ni lugs so //
translated: This is the square in the space in front, the nature of the four jewels, in the east crystal, in the south like sapphire, in the west like ruby, in the north like emerald, in the middle like beryl.

original: kun du 'khrigs zhes pa ni dus thams cad pa'i me tog la sogs pa nye @137b bar mkho bas khyab par ro //🔽rdo rje gsum gyi sbyor bas dbab //
analyzed: kun du 'khrigs zhes pa ni dus thams cad pa'i me tog la sogs pa nye @137b bar mkho bas khyab par ro // rdo rje gsum gyi sbyor bas dbab //
translated: “Totally filled” means filled with the necessary flowers, etc.

original: ces pa ni ji skad du brjod pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gnas te rdo rje gsum gyi bdag nyid 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas mdun du gyur par brjod ma thag pa'i gnas kyi dbus su gnas pa zla ba ser po'i steng du
analyzed: ces pa ni ji skad du brjod pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gnas te rdo rje gsum gyi bdag nyid 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas mdun du gyur par brjod ma thag pa'i gnas kyi dbus su gnas pa zla ba ser po'i steng du
translated: “By the yoga of the three vajras, one should bring down” means that, abiding in the middle of the maṇḍala as described, endowed with the yoga of Ārya Mañjuśrī, whose nature is the three vajras, in front, in the middle of the place just described, on a yellow moon, one should visualize the syllable hūṃ, the nature of the three vajras.

original: zla ba phyed pa'i thig le'i rtse mo dang ldan pa'i yi ge kshim las rang 'dod pa'i gnod sbyin mo dang rjes su mthun pa'i kha dog bsgoms la de las byung ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis nam mkha' gang bar bsams te spyan la sogs pa'i lha mo'i tshogs
analyzed: zla ba phyed pa'i thig le'i rtse mo dang ldan pa'i yi ge kshim las rang 'dod pa'i gnod sbyin mo dang rjes su mthun pa'i kha dog bsgoms la de las byung ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis nam mkha' gang bar bsams te spyan la sogs pa'i lha mo'i tshogs
translated: The host of goddesses such as Locanā and so on,

original: la yang dag par reg pas mngon par 'dod pa'i gnod sbyin mo sprul nas kshim yig la yang dag par bsdus te thams cad yongs su gyur pa las mngon par 'dod pa'i gnod sbyin mo'i gzugs cig bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: la yang dag par reg pas mngon par 'dod pa'i gnod sbyin mo sprul nas kshim yig la yang dag par bsdus te thams cad yongs su gyur pa las mngon par 'dod pa'i gnod sbyin mo'i gzugs cig bsgom par bya'o //
translated: having touched the yakṣiṇī one desires, emanate from kṣiṃ, and having gathered into the syllable kṣiṃ, one should meditate on the form of the yakṣiṇī one desires, having completely transformed everything.

original: de la re zhig longs spyod dang ldan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mngon par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig longs spyod dang ldan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mngon par brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the form and so on endowed with wealth should be expressed.

original: gser gyi kha dog can lha'i bud med kyi gzugs 'dzin pa lang tsho sar pa sgeg pa'i nyams can gsal ba'i dar gyi gos kyis smad g-yogs dang stong g-yogs byas pa rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /

translated: She is golden-colored, has the form of a divine maiden, is in the prime of youth, is graceful, is dressed in lower and upper garments of clear silk, and is adorned with all the ornaments.

original: lag pa g-yas na gdugs dkar po 'dzin pa /
analyzed: lag pa g-yas na gdugs dkar po 'dzin pa /
translated: In her right hand she holds a white parasol.

original: g-yon pas dpag bsam gyi shing la brten pa /
analyzed: g-yon pas dpag bsam gyi shing la brten pa /
translated: In her left hand she holds a wish-fulfilling tree.

original: sgeg pa dang bcas pa 'dzum pa'i byad dang rol pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sgeg pa dang bcas pa 'dzum pa'i byad dang rol pa dang ldan pa /
translated: She is graceful, has a smiling face, and is playful.

original: kha dog lnga'i me tog gis spras pa'i phyed 'khyil pa'i skra dang me tog gi phreng ba dang dpag bsam gyi shing la sogs pas mdzes pa rin po che mi g-yo ba'i nang na gnas pa padma ser po dang zla ba la 'dug par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: kha dog lnga'i me tog gis spras pa'i phyed 'khyil pa'i skra dang me tog gi phreng ba dang dpag bsam gyi shing la sogs pas mdzes pa rin po che mi g-yo ba'i nang na gnas pa padma ser po dang zla ba la 'dug par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Her hair is half-bound with flowers of five colors, and she is beautified with flower garlands, wish-fulfilling trees, and so forth. She resides in an immovable jewel, and is imagined to be sitting on a yellow lotus and moon.

original: gnod sbyin mo thams cad thun mong ba'i sa bon 'di yin te /
analyzed: gnod sbyin mo thams cad thun mong ba'i sa bon 'di yin te /
translated: This is the common seed of all yakṣiṇīs:

original: des gnod sbyin mo gzhan rnams kyi yang gzugs la sogs pa dpal 'byung po 'dul ba la sogs pa la rtogs par bya ste bsgrub par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: des gnod sbyin mo gzhan rnams kyi yang gzugs la sogs pa dpal 'byung po 'dul ba la sogs pa la rtogs par bya ste bsgrub par bya'o zhes so //
translated: One should understand that the forms and so forth of the other yakṣiṇīs are also accomplished in the same way as Śrī Vighnāntaka.

original: las gsum rdo rje'i bye brag gis //
analyzed: las gsum rdo rje'i bye brag gis //
translated: By the distinction of the three vajra actions,🔽one should visualize the head of Śrī Yamāntaka, who is taught by the teacher, arisen from one’s own meditative concentration, endowed with the application of Mañjuśrī, and confer the empowerment of bodhicitta upon him.

original: zhes pa ni 'jam dpal gyi sbyor ba dang ldan pa nyid kyis rang snyoms par zhugs pa las dpal gshin rje mthar byed ston pas de'i mgo bo la byang chub kyi sems kyi dbang bskur ba bltas nas rang gi snying ga'i zla ba la gnas pa'i sngags kyi
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'jam dpal gyi sbyor ba dang ldan pa nyid kyis rang snyoms par zhugs pa las dpal gshin rje mthar byed ston pas de'i mgo bo la byang chub kyi sems kyi dbang bskur ba bltas nas rang gi snying ga'i zla ba la gnas pa'i sngags kyi
translated: The mantra garland, which is located in the moon at one’s heart,

original: phreng ba rang gi kha nas 'thon te de'i kha nas zhugs nas snying ga'i padma'i zla ba la @138a * //
analyzed: phreng ba rang gi kha nas 'thon te de'i kha nas zhugs nas snying ga'i padma'i zla ba la @138a * //
translated: emerges from one’s mouth, enters his mouth, and is arranged on the moon in his heart.

original: bkod nas de dang lhan cig rdo rje dang padma'i sbyor ba bya'o //
analyzed: bkod nas de dang lhan cig rdo rje dang padma'i sbyor ba bya'o //
translated: One should perform the union of the vajra and lotus with her.

original: gnod sbyin mo thams cad kyi bskyed pa'i sa bon thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnod sbyin mo thams cad kyi bskyed pa'i sa bon thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the uncommon seed syllable of all yakṣiṇīs is generated,

original: gnod sbyin mo thams cad dang mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod sbyin mo thams cad dang mnyam pa yin no //
translated: one is equal to all yakṣiṇīs.

original: sa bon las byung ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis gnod sbyin mo thams cad kun nas bkug ste gnod sbyin mo gcig yongs su rdzogs par byas pa gang la yin pa de bzhin no zhes kha cig go / rdo rje thams cad kyi lha rnams kyi sngags rnam par
analyzed: sa bon las byung ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis gnod sbyin mo thams cad kun nas bkug ste gnod sbyin mo gcig yongs su rdzogs par byas pa gang la yin pa de bzhin no zhes kha cig go / rdo rje thams cad kyi lha rnams kyi sngags rnam par
translated: Some say that the light rays arising from the seed completely summon all the yakṣiṇīs and make one yakṣiṇī complete, just as it is.

original: 'phrul pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rnam par dag pa la dmigs pa ni rdo rje bzhin du dbyer med pa gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'phrul pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rnam par dag pa la dmigs pa ni rdo rje bzhin du dbyer med pa gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: The mantra of all the deities of the vajra family is the mantra of Vajrapāṇi. The state of being indivisible like a vajra is that which is focused on the pure body, speech, and mind of the emanation body.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub rnam pa ji lta bus rdzogs she na /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub rnam pa ji lta bus rdzogs she na /
translated: In what way are the accomplishments of the great seal of Vairocana and so forth perfected?

original: gsungs pa sku zhes pa la sogs pa la sangs rgyas kyi gzugs 'dzin pa'i 'od ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor can de gser la sogs pa'i kha dog dang 'dra ba dang ldan pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gsungs pa sku zhes pa la sogs pa la sangs rgyas kyi gzugs 'dzin pa'i 'od ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor can de gser la sogs pa'i kha dog dang 'dra ba dang ldan pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is said “the body” and so forth. The light that holds the form of the Buddha is the maṇḍala of the light of the tathāgatas. It is said to possess the color of gold and so forth.

original: dman pa ni zhen pa ste dman pa ma yin pa ni mchog gi dngos grub de ru gnas pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dman pa ni zhen pa ste dman pa ma yin pa ni mchog gi dngos grub de ru gnas pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The inferior is attachment, and the non-inferior is the supreme attainment, which is the meaning of “abiding there.”

original: mi snang ba la la sogs pa'i dngos grub kyang rdo rje 'dzin pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi snang ba la la sogs pa'i dngos grub kyang rdo rje 'dzin pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The attainments such as invisibility are like the Vajra-Holder.

original: gnod sbyin gyi rgyal po ni 'phags pa dzam bha la'o //
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi rgyal po ni 'phags pa dzam bha la'o //
translated: The king of yakshas is the noble Jambhala.

original: thams cad rnams zhes pa ni sngar brjod pa thams cad kyang phyis 'chad par 'gyur ba yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad rnams zhes pa ni sngar brjod pa thams cad kyang phyis 'chad par 'gyur ba yang ngo //
translated: “All” means all that was mentioned before and also what will be explained later.

original: yid kyis 'dod pa zhes pa ni yid dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyis 'dod pa zhes pa ni yid dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Mental desire” is what delights the mind.

original: dngos grub kyi sgras de dang sbyor bas dngos grub nyid du brjod pa rnams so //
analyzed: dngos grub kyi sgras de dang sbyor bas dngos grub nyid du brjod pa rnams so //
translated: The word “attainment” is connected with that, and those that are described as attainments.

original: gtsug tor zhes pa ni gtsug gi nor bu bzhin du ste /
analyzed: gtsug tor zhes pa ni gtsug gi nor bu bzhin du ste /
translated: “Crown” is like a crest jewel.

original: rgyud gzhan thams cad la sogs pa'i dngos grub rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan thams cad la sogs pa'i dngos grub rnams kyis so //
translated: The attainments of all other tantras, etc.

original: yid bzhin nor bu bzhin du yang thams cad kyi bsam pa yangs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yid bzhin nor bu bzhin du yang thams cad kyi bsam pa yangs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Like a wish-fulfilling gem, it fulfills the vast wishes of all.

original: snod ji lta bar gang las sangs rgyas kyi byang chub byed pa'i mchog go //
analyzed: snod ji lta bar gang las sangs rgyas kyi byang chub byed pa'i mchog go //
translated: The supreme means of making the enlightenment of the Buddhas is from the vessel as it is.

original: 'di yang sangs rgyas rdo rje rab tu bsgoms pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yang sangs rgyas rdo rje rab tu bsgoms pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is also because of the meditation on the Vajra of the Buddha.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra bar dngos grub thams cad kyi 'bras bu ston par byed pas bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra bar dngos grub thams cad kyi 'bras bu ston par byed pas bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The fulfillment of all wishes is the glorious Vajrasattva, who shows the fruit of all powers like a wish-granting gem.

original: da ni ye shes 'jug pa thob pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: da ni ye shes 'jug pa thob pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: Now, with reference to the attainment of the entry of intuition,

original: mtshan ma thob pa sngon du song ba'i rig pa'i brtul zhugs @138b gsungs pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma thob pa sngon du song ba'i rig pa'i brtul zhugs @138b gsungs pa /
translated: the conduct of knowledge is stated for one who has previously attained the sign.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rang bzhin gyi rig pa'i brtul zhugs so //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rang bzhin gyi rig pa'i brtul zhugs so //
translated: Then, etc. The conduct of knowledge is the nature of the body, speech, and mind of all the Ones Gone Thus.

original: de'i yang dag par len pa ni rtag tu sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yang dag par len pa ni rtag tu sbyangs pa'o //
translated: Its perfect taking is the constant practice.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi spyod pa ste sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje rnams so so la sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje'i gzugs kyis bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi spyod pa ste sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje rnams so so la sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje'i gzugs kyis bsgoms pas so //
translated: The conduct of their nature is the vajras of body, etc. , because of the meditation on the vajra forms of body, etc. , in each of the individual vajras.

original: rang tshul nyid kyis de byas te //
analyzed: rang tshul nyid kyis de byas te //
translated: One should do it with one's own nature.

original: zhes pa ni rang gi rigs kyi bu mo dang yang dag par sbyor ba dang / bdud rtsi lnga za ba la sogs pa rang gi gzugs nyid kyis bya ste //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang gi rigs kyi bu mo dang yang dag par sbyor ba dang / bdud rtsi lnga za ba la sogs pa rang gi gzugs nyid kyis bya ste //
translated: One should do it with one's own form, i. e. , one should unite with a daughter of one's own clan, and one should eat the five nectars, etc.

original: de yang drang ba'i don du ma yin la bsam gtan gyi dmigs pa tsam yang ma yin no ;
analyzed: de yang drang ba'i don du ma yin la bsam gtan gyi dmigs pa tsam yang ma yin no ;
translated: And this is not in the indirect sense, nor is it merely an object of concentration.

original: / de ltar dngos grub thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: / de ltar dngos grub thob par 'gyur //
translated: In that way, one attains power.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar byas pa nyid byang chub ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar byas pa nyid byang chub ces pa'i don to //
translated: In that way, one attains enlightenment, is the meaning.

original: bshad gci'i dam tshig dag gis ni //
analyzed: bshad gci'i dam tshig dag gis ni //
translated: By the pledges of the explanatory tantra,

original: dbang po gnyis kyi rab sbyor las //
analyzed: dbang po gnyis kyi rab sbyor las //
translated: from the union of the two organs,

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub 'thob //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub 'thob //
translated: one attains unexcelled enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas byang chub gsal zhi ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub gsal zhi ba //
translated: The enlightenment of the Buddha is clear and peaceful.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas bco lnga pa la sogs par bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis 'di'i nyams su blang ba lhan cig byed pa nyid du rab tu bstan pa'i phyir dang / de rgyu med pa las de thob pa dang ldan par shin tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas bco lnga pa la sogs par bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis 'di'i nyams su blang ba lhan cig byed pa nyid du rab tu bstan pa'i phyir dang / de rgyu med pa las de thob pa dang ldan par shin tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, in the fifteenth chapter and so forth, the Bhagavān himself taught this to be the cooperating condition of practice, and it would be quite absurd to attain it without a cause.

original: gang rnam 'grel las /
analyzed: gang rnam 'grel las /
translated: As it says in the Thorough Exposition of Valid Cognition:

original: rgyu med gzhan la mi ltos phyir //
analyzed: rgyu med gzhan la mi ltos phyir //
translated: Because it is causeless and does not depend on another,

original: rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur ;
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur ;
translated: it would be either always existent or always nonexistent.

original: / dngos po rnams ni res 'ga' zhig /'byung ba ltos pa las yin no //
analyzed: / dngos po rnams ni res 'ga' zhig /'byung ba ltos pa las yin no //
translated: Things sometimes arise from dependence.

original: rigs pa nyid rab tu rtog par bya bar gsungs pa /🔽spyan gyi go 'phang yang dag sbyor //
analyzed: rigs pa nyid rab tu rtog par bya bar gsungs pa / spyan gyi go 'phang yang dag sbyor //
translated: It is said that one should contemplate this very reasoning.🔽The union with the state of the eyes🔽is the union with the state of the eyes.

original: zhes so // phyag mtshan ni ye shes kyi phyag mtshan gyis so //
analyzed: zhes so // phyag mtshan ni ye shes kyi phyag mtshan gyis so //
translated: The hand implements are the hand implements of gnosis.🔽Knowing the ritual of the mudrā and mantra

original: phyag rgya sngags kyi cho ga shes //
analyzed: phyag rgya sngags kyi cho ga shes //
translated: is knowing the ritual of the mudrā and mantra.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni mi dbang ba bkag pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni mi dbang ba bkag pa'o //
translated: Thus, the one who is not a lord is prohibited.

original: de lta bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi btsun mo ste /
analyzed: de lta bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi btsun mo ste /
translated: Such a one is the queen of the tathāgatas.

original: rang las tha mi dad pa'i rig mar bya'o //
analyzed: rang las tha mi dad pa'i rig mar bya'o //
translated: One should be the knowledge-woman who is not different from oneself.

original: gsang ba'i mchod pa brtul zhugs chen po ni 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don rdzogs pa'i ched du nges pa dang ldan pa'i brtul zhugs chen po'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i mchod pa brtul zhugs chen po ni 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don rdzogs pa'i ched du nges pa dang ldan pa'i brtul zhugs chen po'o //
translated: The great observance of the secret worship is the great observance endowed with certainty for the sake of fulfilling the purpose of all beings without exception.

original: sdong bu rtsa ba zhes pa la sogs pa ni ye shes la 'jug pa thob pas grong khyer la sogs par gnas pa 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: sdong bu rtsa ba zhes pa la sogs pa ni ye shes la 'jug pa thob pas grong khyer la sogs par gnas pa 'gog par byed do //
translated: The trunk, root, etc. are the city, etc. which are stopped by attaining the entry into the knowledge.

original: sku'i rigs kyi rig pa'i brtul zhugs gsungs nas gsung dang thugs kyi rigs kyi dbang du byas te /🔽gsungs pa / 'dod chags rdo rje lcags kyu mo ni gos @139a * //
analyzed: sku'i rigs kyi rig pa'i brtul zhugs gsungs nas gsung dang thugs kyi rigs kyi dbang du byas te / gsungs pa / 'dod chags rdo rje lcags kyu mo ni gos @139a * //
translated: Having taught the observance of the knowledge of the family of body, he speaks of the observance of the knowledge of the family of speech and mind.

original: dkar mo yin la m'a ma k'i ni thugs kyi rigs kyi yum ste /
analyzed: dkar mo yin la m'a ma k'i ni thugs kyi rigs kyi yum ste /
translated: The passion-vajra-hook is Pāṇḍaravāsinī, and the mother is Māmakī, the mother of the family of mind.

original: gsung rdo rje dang thugs rdo rje dag la brjod ma thag pa rnam pa thams cad du rigs so //
analyzed: gsung rdo rje dang thugs rdo rje dag la brjod ma thag pa rnam pa thams cad du rigs so //
translated: The speech-vajra and the mind-vajra are of all aspects just as was stated immediately before.

original: rang gi phyag rgya'am zhes pa ni gal te brjod ma thag pa'i mtshan nyid ma rnyed na de'i rang 'od kyi rig ma bsam par bya'o zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya'am zhes pa ni gal te brjod ma thag pa'i mtshan nyid ma rnyed na de'i rang 'od kyi rig ma bsam par bya'o zhes kha cig go //
translated: One's own seal means that if one does not find the characteristics just mentioned, one should imagine one's own natural light consort.

original: rigs gsum gyi rig pa'i brtul zhugs bor nas de'i rigs kyi dbang du byas te gsungs pa /
analyzed: rigs gsum gyi rig pa'i brtul zhugs bor nas de'i rigs kyi dbang du byas te gsungs pa /
translated: Some say that after abandoning the spiritual discipline of the knowledge of the three clans, it is taught from the perspective of their clan.

original: rang gi phyag rgya ma ni rang 'od kyi shes rab kyi ngo bor ci ltar brjod pa'i bu mo de'i rigs su bsgom par bya'o zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya ma ni rang 'od kyi shes rab kyi ngo bor ci ltar brjod pa'i bu mo de'i rigs su bsgom par bya'o zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: Others say that one's own seal is one's own natural light consort, and one should imagine her as the daughter described, in the clan of that clan.

original: bsam gtan yi ge gsum rdo rje can ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi yi ge'i rdo rje rnams so //
analyzed: bsam gtan yi ge gsum rdo rje can ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi yi ge'i rdo rje rnams so //
translated: The three contemplations are the vajras of the letters of body, speech, and mind.

original: da ni 'bras bu dang rtsa ba tshol ba'i rnam par g-yeng ba yongs su spong bas ye shes la dbang thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i rig pa'i brtul zhugs kyi dbang du byas te gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni 'bras bu dang rtsa ba tshol ba'i rnam par g-yeng ba yongs su spong bas ye shes la dbang thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i rig pa'i brtul zhugs kyi dbang du byas te gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to abandon the distraction of seeking the fruit and the root, it is taught from the perspective of the spiritual discipline of the knowledge of the yogi who has attained mastery of intuition.

original: nags tshal zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nags tshal zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The forest, etc., is as follows.

original: sgrub pa po ye shes la dbang thob pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa po ye shes la dbang thob pa'o //
translated: The adept is one who has attained mastery over the knowledge.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nges par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nges par bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is taught.

original: 'dis cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / nags tshal gyi lhas kha zas lha las byung ba ster bar byed do //
analyzed: gsungs pa / nags tshal gyi lhas kha zas lha las byung ba ster bar byed do //
translated: The forest goddess gives food born from the gods.

original: 'o ma la sogs pa lha'i bya ba brgyan pa yang ngo //
analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pa lha'i bya ba brgyan pa yang ngo //
translated: Milk, etc. is also the ornament of the divine act.

original: 'das na zhes pa la sogs pas ni nges par 'byung ba ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'das na zhes pa la sogs pas ni nges par 'byung ba ston pa yin no //
translated: Having passed beyond, etc. teaches the renunciation.

original: da ni rnal 'byor pa gnyis pas rnyed par sla ba mi'i bu mo yongs su spangs te dbang thob pas rig pa'i brtul zhugs spyad pa'i don du mi ma yin gyi bu mo gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni rnal 'byor pa gnyis pas rnyed par sla ba mi'i bu mo yongs su spangs te dbang thob pas rig pa'i brtul zhugs spyad pa'i don du mi ma yin gyi bu mo gsungs pa /
translated: Now, having abandoned the human girl who is easy to obtain for the second yogi, in order to practice the knowledge observance with the one who has attained mastery, the non-human girl is taught.

original: lha mo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha mo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The goddess, etc.

original: mi mo yang 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'i rigs las byung ba'o //
analyzed: mi mo yang 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'i rigs las byung ba'o //
translated: The human girl also comes from the family of the world-emperor, etc.

original: nus pa thob pa'i phyir de'i'o ;
analyzed: nus pa thob pa'i phyir de'i'o ;
translated: It is hers because she has attained the power.

original: / dngos grub thams cad ni mchog dang gzhan no //
analyzed: / dngos grub thams cad ni mchog dang gzhan no //
translated: All powers are the supreme and the other.

original: thams cad ni sku'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni sku'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'o //
translated: All are the body mandala, etc.

original: de'i rdo rje mngon par byang chub pa yang yin la de nyid kyang rdo rje yin te de'i mngon par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rdo rje mngon par byang chub pa yang yin la de nyid kyang rdo rje yin te de'i mngon par byang chub pa'o //
translated: That is the vajra, and that is the manifest enlightenment, and that is the vajra.

original: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyan las le'u bcu drug pa'o /
analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyan las le'u bcu drug pa'o /
translated: This is the sixteenth chapter of the Ornament of the Guhyasamāja.

original: // / de nas zhes pa la bsrung ba dang bza' ba'i dam tshig gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / de nas zhes pa la bsrung ba dang bza' ba'i dam tshig gsungs pa /
translated: Then, having spoken of the commitments of protection and eating,

original: de yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lhan cig byed ma nyid kyis yin nam /
analyzed: de yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lhan cig byed ma nyid kyis yin nam /
translated: it is asked whether that is by the nature of the co-emergent of perfect enlightenment,🔽or else, how is this for the sake of engaging the disciples?

original: yang na ci ltar 'di yang gdul bya gzhug par bya ba'i phyir yin zhes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su chod pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: yang na ci ltar 'di yang gdul bya gzhug par bya ba'i phyir yin zhes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su chod pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: After resolving such conceptual thoughts,

original: dkyil @139b 'khor rgyal po mchog ces pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang 'brel ba'i mchod pa'i rjes la byung ba de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sgo nas bstod pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: dkyil @139b 'khor rgyal po mchog ces pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang 'brel ba'i mchod pa'i rjes la byung ba de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sgo nas bstod pa gsungs pa /
translated: following the offering connected with the samādhi called the supreme king maṇḍala, the praise through the five tathāgatas is stated.

original: ye shes chen po ni gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes chen po ni gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the great wisdom is the nature of nonduality.

original: rdo rje dbyings ni rigs yin te rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings ni rigs yin te rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The vajra realm is the family, because it has the nature of emptiness by intrinsic reality.

original: mkhas pa chen po ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mkhas pa chen po ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great sage is the omniscient one.

original: dkyil 'khor gsum ni sku la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gsum ni sku la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: The three circles are the nature of the body, etc.

original: sku la sogs pa gsum rnams kyi rdo rje yis mchog yin no //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa gsum rnams kyi rdo rje yis mchog yin no //
translated: The vajra of the three, body, etc., is the supreme.

original: dag pa chen po ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa rnam par dag pa'o ;
analyzed: dag pa chen po ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa rnam par dag pa'o ;
translated: The great purity is the purification of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, along with their traces.

original: / rdo rje zhi ba ni dri ma rnams slar yang nye bar mi bskyod pas dbyer mi phyed pa'i zhi ba'o //
analyzed: / rdo rje zhi ba ni dri ma rnams slar yang nye bar mi bskyod pas dbyer mi phyed pa'i zhi ba'o //
translated: The vajra peace is the peace that is indivisible, because the defilements do not move again.

original: dga' ba chen po ni snying rje chen po'i mtshan nyid gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: dga' ba chen po ni snying rje chen po'i mtshan nyid gang gi yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: The great joy is just that which has the nature of great compassion.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba rnams la gang mchog yin pa de de rnams las mchog go //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba rnams la gang mchog yin pa de de rnams las mchog go //
translated: The supreme among those that are naturally radiant is the supreme of those.

original: sngags te sdug bsngal gyi rten mi phyed pa'i phyir dang phyir ldog pa med pa ste ma rig pa'i bag chags spangs pa'i phyir dang / ma lus pa ste nyon mongs pa ma yin pa'i sku dang gsung dang bla ma tshad pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngags te sdug bsngal gyi rten mi phyed pa'i phyir dang phyir ldog pa med pa ste ma rig pa'i bag chags spangs pa'i phyir dang / ma lus pa ste nyon mongs pa ma yin pa'i sku dang gsung dang bla ma tshad pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mantra is the non-separation of the basis of suffering, the non-return, i.e., the abandonment of the latent tendencies of ignorance, and the total, i.e., the abandonment of the body, speech, and mind that are not afflictive.

original: zab pa ni rtog pa med pa gang gi 'di yin pa de bde bar zab pa'o //
analyzed: zab pa ni rtog pa med pa gang gi 'di yin pa de bde bar zab pa'o //
translated: The profound is the bliss of the one who is non-conceptual.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na nam mkha' rdo rje'o ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na nam mkha' rdo rje'o ;
translated: For that very reason, it is the space-vajra.

original: / nam mkha' bzhin du dri ma med pa ni rang bzhin gyis dag pa'o //
analyzed: / nam mkha' bzhin du dri ma med pa ni rang bzhin gyis dag pa'o //
translated: It is stainless like space, i.e., naturally pure.

original: des na gos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: des na gos pa med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is unsoiled.

original: brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa med pas rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa med pas rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: It is non-conceptual because there is no expression and nothing to be expressed.

original: yang na rtog pa shin tu dag pas so //
analyzed: yang na rtog pa shin tu dag pas so //
translated: Or else, it is so because of the purity of conceptualization.

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni nam mkha' ste /
translated: The non-dual intuition is space because it is equal to space.

original: de nyid rdo rje yin la de'i bdag nyid du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje yin la de'i bdag nyid du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: That is the vajra, and it is the grasping of that as one’s own nature.

original: 'dod chags pha rol phyin pa ni mchog ste rnam par dag pa de rnams mnyes pa'o //🔽des na dam pa'i don gyis na //
analyzed: 'dod chags pha rol phyin pa ni mchog ste rnam par dag pa de rnams mnyes pa'o // des na dam pa'i don gyis na //
translated: The perfection of passion is the highest, since those purities please them.🔽Therefore,

original: pha rol phyin pa bcur 'dod do //
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa bcur 'dod do //
translated: the ten perfections are accepted in the ultimate sense.

original: zhes rgyal ba byams pas gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes rgyal ba byams pas gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said by the Victor Maitreya.

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas ni rnam pa thams cad kyi chos thams cad mngon par byang chub pas so //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas ni rnam pa thams cad kyi chos thams cad mngon par byang chub pas so //
translated: The perfect Buddha is the one who has fully awakened to all aspects and all things.

original: bsam pa thams cad ni sems can thams cad mngon par byang chub pa la sogs par 'dod pa ste de yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa thams cad ni sems can thams cad mngon par byang chub pa la sogs par 'dod pa ste de yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: All wishes are the desires of all sentient beings for full awakening, etc.

original: dag pa'i ngo bo chos kyi dbyings las byung pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa'i ngo bo chos kyi dbyings las byung pa'o //
translated: It is the source of the pure essence, the dharma-element.

original: rdo rje'i longs spyod ni de bzhin gshegs @140a * //🔽pa rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje'i longs spyod ni de bzhin gshegs @140a * // pa rnams so //
translated: The vajra enjoyments are the Tathagatas.

original: dag pa ni tshad ma dang lung gis grub pas so //
analyzed: dag pa ni tshad ma dang lung gis grub pas so //
translated: They are pure because they are established by valid cognition and scripture.

original: dam tshig ni bsrung bar bya ba bzhi yin la bza' bar bya ba yang brtson 'grus lnga dang bdud rtsi lnga'i bdag nyid yin te bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi lhan cig byed pa yin pas nges par dus ji lta ba dang ji ltar rnyed pa nyams🔽su blangs te /
analyzed: dam tshig ni bsrung bar bya ba bzhi yin la bza' bar bya ba yang brtson 'grus lnga dang bdud rtsi lnga'i bdag nyid yin te bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi lhan cig byed pa yin pas nges par dus ji lta ba dang ji ltar rnyed pa nyams su blangs te /
translated: Therefore, one should practice them as they are found and as they are obtained.

original: gzhan du na phas pham pas dge ba'i rtsa ba mtha' dag chad par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gzhan du na phas pham pas dge ba'i rtsa ba mtha' dag chad par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that one would be defeated by a root downfall and all of one’s roots of virtue would be severed.

original: dus ji lta ba dang ji ltar rnyed pa'i dam tshig bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: dus ji lta ba dang ji ltar rnyed pa'i dam tshig bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: One should practice the commitments as they are found and as they are obtained.

original: de rnams nyams su ma blangs na rtsa ba'i ltung ba bcu gsum pa yin zhes brjod pas so //
analyzed: de rnams nyams su ma blangs na rtsa ba'i ltung ba bcu gsum pa yin zhes brjod pas so //
translated: If one does not practice them, it is said that one would have the thirteenth root downfall.

original: sku rdo rje la sogs pa yang 'dir rigs gsum gyi rnal 'byor par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sku rdo rje la sogs pa yang 'dir rigs gsum gyi rnal 'byor par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Also, the body vajra and so forth should be regarded here as the yogas of the three families.

original: lhan cig byed pa nyid kyi dam tshig kyang gsal por brjod do //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa nyid kyi dam tshig kyang gsal por brjod do //
translated: The commitments of cooperating cause are also clearly stated.

original: dam tshig 'di rnams bsrungs na de'i sku dang gsung dang thugs su gyur pa de'i bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dam tshig 'di rnams bsrungs na de'i sku dang gsung dang thugs su gyur pa de'i bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one observes these pledges, one becomes a Buddha by the nature of that Body, Speech, and Mind.

original: de ma thag tu zhes pa ni phun sum tshogs pa de'i tshogs pa nyid kyi rjes la'o //
analyzed: de ma thag tu zhes pa ni phun sum tshogs pa de'i tshogs pa nyid kyi rjes la'o //
translated: Immediately means after the collection of that perfection.

original: de bzhin du dpal sangs rgyas thams cad las /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpal sangs rgyas thams cad las /
translated: Similarly, in the Shri-Paramadya-Tantra,

original: dkyil 'khor dman par gyur pa dang // dam tshig spangs par gyur pa yang //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dman par gyur pa dang // dam tshig spangs par gyur pa yang //
translated: One who has a low mandala, or who has abandoned the pledges,

original: sgrub thabs cung zad mi 'grub po //
analyzed: sgrub thabs cung zad mi 'grub po //
translated: Will not accomplish the slightest of the means of achievement.

original: de nyid sems gsang mi shes pas //
analyzed: de nyid sems gsang mi shes pas //
translated: Because he does not know the secret of the mind.

original: zhes so // bdag nyid gcig pu'i ched du rang nyid kyis rtogs pas rang sangs rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: zhes so // bdag nyid gcig pu'i ched du rang nyid kyis rtogs pas rang sangs rgyas rnams so //
translated: The Pratyekabuddhas are those who have realized the truth for themselves alone, and not for the sake of others.

original: de rnams kyi lus kyis ston pa ste dag med pa nyid kyis rang gis rtogs pa'i don snod ci lta bar gzhan la rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi lus kyis ston pa ste dag med pa nyid kyis rang gis rtogs pa'i don snod ci lta bar gzhan la rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are teachers by their bodies because they cause others to realize the truth which they themselves have realized, by the power of their own example, without the use of speech.

original: gang 'phags pa byams pas /🔽gang dang gang don gang gang la //
analyzed: gang 'phags pa byams pas / gang dang gang don gang gang la //
translated: As the noble Maitreya says in the Uttaratantra-shastra,🔽To whomsoever, in whatever way,

original: ji lta ji ltar nyan de la //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar nyan de la //
translated: and to whatever extent they are able,

original: de la sgra med kyang don de //
analyzed: de la sgra med kyang don de //
translated: Although there is no sound there, that meaning

original: de ni de ltar de ltar snang //
analyzed: de ni de ltar de ltar snang //
translated: appears just like that.

original: zhes so / gang du yang rang gi byang chub mngon du byed kyang de la yang nyan thos rnams kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams la chos nyan par byed do //
analyzed: zhes so / gang du yang rang gi byang chub mngon du byed kyang de la yang nyan thos rnams kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams la chos nyan par byed do //
translated: And even when they manifest their own enlightenment, the śrāvakas listen to the Dharma from the buddhas and so on.

original: de rnams rang gi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ye shes spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams rang gi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ye shes spangs pa yin no //
translated: They are devoid of the gnosis that has the characteristics of their own realization.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan la rag las pas rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa las kyang dman par mos pa gang rnams yin pa de rnams ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan la rag las pas rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa las kyang dman par mos pa gang rnams yin pa de rnams ni de bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, those who have inferior aspirations, who are inferior to the pratyekabuddhas, are just like that.

original: gti mug ni gti mug gi rigs so //
analyzed: gti mug ni gti mug gi rigs so //
translated: The deluded are of the type that is deluded.

original: lam gyis zhes pa ni stong pa nyid la mos pas so //
analyzed: lam gyis zhes pa ni stong pa nyid la mos pas so //
translated: The path is the path of emptiness.
